Translated: Moses washed the entrails and the legs with water and turned all of the ram into smoke. That was a burnt offering for a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to יהוה —as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: veet-hakerev veet-hakheraayiim rachats vamayiim vayaketer mosheh et-khׇl-haayiil hamizevechah olah hu lereycha-niychocha isheh hu layhovah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֙ אֶת־הָאַ֣יִל הַשֵּׁנִ֔י אֵ֖יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים וַֽיִּסְמְכ֞וּ אַהֲרֹ֧ן וּבָנָ֛יו אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹ֥אשׁ הָאָֽיִל׃
Translated: He brought forward the second ram, the ram of ordination. Aaron and his sons laid their hands upon the ram’s head,
Transliteration: vayakerev et-haayiil hasheniy eyl hamiluiym vayisemekhu aharon uvanayv et-yedeyhem al-rosh haayiil

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחָ֓ט ׀ וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ מִדָּמ֔וֹ וַיִּתֵּ֛ן עַל־תְּנ֥וּךְ אֹֽזֶן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִֽית׃
Translated: and it was slaughtered. Moses took some of its blood and put it on the ridge of Aaron’s right ear, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
Transliteration: vayishechat vayikach mosheh midamvo vayiten al-tenukhe ozen-aharon hayemaniyt veal-vohen yadvo hayemaniyt veal-vohen ragelvo hayemaniyt

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֞ב אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיִּתֵּ֨ן מֹשֶׁ֤ה מִן־הַדָּם֙ עַל־תְּנ֤וּךְ אׇזְנָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדָם֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְלָ֖ם הַיְמָנִ֑ית וַיִּזְרֹ֨ק מֹשֶׁ֧ה אֶת־הַדָּ֛ם עַל־הַֽמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Moses then brought forward the sons of Aaron, and put some of the blood on the ridges of their right ears, and on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet; and the rest of the blood Moses dashed against every side of the altar.
Transliteration: vayakerev et-veney aharon vayiten mosheh min-hadam al-tenukhe ׇzenam hayemaniyt veal-vohen yadam hayemaniyt veal-vohen ragelam hayemaniyt vayizerok mosheh et-hadam al-hamizevecha saviyv

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־הַחֵ֣לֶב וְאֶת־הָֽאַלְיָ֗ה וְאֶֽת־כׇּל־הַחֵ֘לֶב֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַקֶּ֒רֶב֒ וְאֵת֙ יֹתֶ֣רֶת הַכָּבֵ֔ד וְאֶת־שְׁתֵּ֥י הַכְּלָיֹ֖ת וְאֶֽת־חֶלְבְּהֶ֑ן וְאֵ֖ת שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִֽין׃
Translated: He took the fat—the broad tail, all the fat about the entrails, the protuberance of the liver, and the two kidneys and their fat—and the right thigh.
Transliteration: vayikach et-hachelev veet-haaleyah veet-khׇl-hachelev asher al-hakerev veet yoteret hakhaved veet-shetey hakhelayot veet-chelevehen veet shvok hayamiyn

Hebrew: וּמִסַּ֨ל הַמַּצּ֜וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה לָ֠קַ֠ח חַלַּ֨ת מַצָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ וְֽחַלַּ֨ת לֶ֥חֶם שֶׁ֛מֶן אַחַ֖ת וְרָקִ֣יק אֶחָ֑ד וַיָּ֙שֶׂם֙ עַל־הַ֣חֲלָבִ֔ים וְעַ֖ל שׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִֽין׃
Translated: From the basket of unleavened bread that was before יהוה, he took one cake of unleavened bread, one cake of oil bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat parts and on the right thigh.
Transliteration: umisal hamatsvot asher lifeney yehovah lakach chalat matsah achat vechalat lechem shemen achat verakiyk echad vayashem al-hachalaviym veal shvok hayamiyn

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אֶת־הַכֹּ֔ל עַ֚ל כַּפֵּ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְעַ֖ל כַּפֵּ֣י בָנָ֑יו וַיָּ֧נֶף אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He placed all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons, and elevated them as an elevation offering before יהוה.
Transliteration: vayiten et-hakhol al khafey aharon veal khafey vanayv vayanef otam tenufah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֹתָם֙ מֵעַ֣ל כַּפֵּיהֶ֔ם וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חָה עַל־הָעֹלָ֑ה מִלֻּאִ֥ים הֵם֙ לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֥ה ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then Moses took them from their hands and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering. This was an ordination offering for a pleasing odor; it was an offering by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh otam meal khafeyhem vayaketer hamizevechah al-haolah miluiym hem lereycha niychocha isheh hu layhovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הֶ֣חָזֶ֔ה וַיְנִיפֵ֥הוּ תְנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה מֵאֵ֣יל הַמִּלֻּאִ֗ים לְמֹשֶׁ֤ה הָיָה֙ לְמָנָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Moses took the breast and elevated it as an elevation offering before יהוה; it was Moses’ portion of the ram of ordination—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-hechazeh vayeniyfehu tenufah lifeney yehovah meeyl hamiluiym lemosheh hayah lemanah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֗ה וּמִן־הַדָּם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֒חַ֒ וַיַּ֤ז עַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ עַל־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְעַל־בָּנָ֛יו וְעַל־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּ֑וֹ וַיְקַדֵּ֤שׁ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְאֶת־בָּנָ֛יו וְאֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י בָנָ֖יו אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar and sprinkled it upon Aaron and upon his vestments, and also upon his sons and upon their vestments. Thus he consecrated Aaron and his vestments, and also his sons and their vestments.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh mishemen hamishechah umin-hadam asher al-hamizevecha vayaz al-aharon al-vegadayv veal-vanayv veal-vigedey vanayv itvo vayekadesh et-aharon et-vegadayv veet-vanayv veet-vigedey vanayv itvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־אַהֲרֹ֣ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו בַּשְּׁל֣וּ אֶת־הַבָּשָׂר֮ פֶּ֣תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֒ וְשָׁם֙ תֹּאכְל֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ וְאֶ֨ת־הַלֶּ֔חֶם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּסַ֣ל הַמִּלֻּאִ֑ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר צִוֵּ֙יתִי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אַהֲרֹ֥ן וּבָנָ֖יו יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: Moses said to Aaron and his sons: Boil the flesh at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of ordination—as I commanded: Aaron and his sons shall eat it;
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon veel-vanayv vashelu et-havashar fetach ohel mvoed vesham tokhelu otvo veet-halechem asher vesal hamiluiym khaasher tsiveytiy lemor aharon uvanayv yokheluhu

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֥ר בַּבָּשָׂ֖ר וּבַלָּ֑חֶם בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשְׂרֹֽפוּ׃
Translated: and what is left over of the flesh and the bread you shall consume in fire.
Transliteration: vehanvotar vavashar uvalachem vaesh tisherofu

Hebrew: וּמִפֶּ֩תַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד לֹ֤א תֵֽצְאוּ֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים עַ֚ד י֣וֹם מְלֹ֔את יְמֵ֖י מִלֻּאֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים יְמַלֵּ֖א אֶת־יֶדְכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting for seven days, until the day that your period of ordination is completed. For your ordination will require seven days.
Transliteration: umifetach ohel mvoed lo tetseu shiveat yamiym ad yvom melot yemey milueykhem khiy shiveat yamiym yemale et-yedekhem

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה לַעֲשֹׂ֖ת לְכַפֵּ֥ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Everything done today, יהוה has commanded to be done [seven days], to make expiation for you.
Transliteration: khaasher ashah vayyvom hazeh tsivah yehovah laashot lekhafer aleykhem

Hebrew: וּפֶ֩תַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד תֵּשְׁב֨וּ יוֹמָ֤ם וָלַ֙יְלָה֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֛ם אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א תָמ֑וּתוּ כִּי־כֵ֖ן צֻוֵּֽיתִי׃
Translated: You shall remain at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting day and night for seven days, keeping יהוה’s charge—that you may not die—for so I have been commanded.
Transliteration: ufetach ohel mvoed teshevu yvomam valayelah shiveat yamiym ushemaretem et-mishemeret yehovah velo tamutu khiy-khen tsuveytiy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ אַהֲרֹ֖ן וּבָנָ֑יו אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: And Aaron and his sons did all the things that יהוה had commanded through Moses.
Transliteration: vayaash aharon uvanayv et khׇl-hadevariym asher-tsivah yehovah veyad-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י קָרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו וּלְזִקְנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: On the eighth day Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hashemiyniy kara mosheh leaharon ulevanayv ulezikeney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַח־לְ֠ךָ֠ עֵ֣גֶל בֶּן־בָּקָ֧ר לְחַטָּ֛את וְאַ֥יִל לְעֹלָ֖ה תְּמִימִ֑ם וְהַקְרֵ֖ב לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He said to Aaron: “Take a calf of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and bring them before יהוה.
Transliteration: vayomer el-aharon kach-lekha egel ven-vakar lechatat veayiil leolah temiymim vehakerev lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר קְח֤וּ שְׂעִיר־עִזִּים֙ לְחַטָּ֔את וְעֵ֨גֶל וָכֶ֧בֶשׂ בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה תְּמִימִ֖ם לְעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: And speak to the Israelites, saying: Take a he-goat for a sin offering; a calf and a lamb, yearlings without blemish, for a burnt offering;
Transliteration: veel-veney yisherael tedaver lemor kechu sheiyr-iziym lechatat veegel vakhevesh veney-shanah temiymim leolah

Hebrew: וְשׁ֨וֹר וָאַ֜יִל לִשְׁלָמִ֗ים לִזְבֹּ֙חַ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמִנְחָ֖ה בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן כִּ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם יְהֹוָ֖ה נִרְאָ֥ה אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: and an ox and a ram for an offering of well-being to sacrifice before יהוה; and a meal offering with oil mixed in. For today יהוה will appear to you.”
Transliteration: veshvor vaayiil lishelamiym lizevocha lifeney yehovah uminechah velulah vashamen khiy hayyvom yehovah nireah aleykhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֗וּ אֵ֚ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַֽיִּקְרְבוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַיַּֽעַמְד֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They brought to the front of the Tent of Meeting the things that Moses had commanded, and the community leadership came forward and stood before יהוה.
Transliteration: vayikechu et asher tsivah mosheh el-feney ohel mvoed vayikerevu khׇl-haedah vayaamedu lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה זֶ֧ה הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ וְיֵרָ֥א אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם כְּב֥וֹד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Moses said: “This is what יהוה has commanded that you do, that the Presence of יהוה may appear to you.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh zeh hadavar asher-tsivah yehovah taashu veeira aleykhem khevvod yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קְרַ֤ב אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ וַעֲשֵׂ֞ה אֶת־חַטָּֽאתְךָ֙ וְאֶת־עֹ֣לָתֶ֔ךָ וְכַפֵּ֥ר בַּֽעַדְךָ֖ וּבְעַ֣ד הָעָ֑ם וַעֲשֵׂ֞ה אֶת־קׇרְבַּ֤ן הָעָם֙ וְכַפֵּ֣ר בַּֽעֲדָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Then Moses said to Aaron: “Come forward to the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering, making expiation for yourself and for the people; and sacrifice the people’s offering and make expiation for them, as יהוה has commanded.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon kerav el-hamizevecha vaasheh et-chatatekha veet-olatekha vekhafer vaadekha uvead haam vaasheh et-kׇrevan haam vekhafer vaadam khaasher tsivah yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרַ֥ב אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וַיִּשְׁחַ֛ט אֶת־עֵ֥גֶל הַחַטָּ֖את אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Aaron came forward to the altar and slaughtered his calf of sin offering.
Transliteration: vayikerav aharon el-hamizevecha vayishechat et-egel hachatat asher-lvo

Hebrew: וַ֠יַּקְרִ֠בוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֣ן אֶת־הַדָּם֮ אֵלָיו֒ וַיִּטְבֹּ֤ל אֶצְבָּעוֹ֙ בַּדָּ֔ם וַיִּתֵּ֖ן עַל־קַרְנ֣וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְאֶת־הַדָּ֣ם יָצַ֔ק אֶל־יְס֖וֹד הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Aaron’s sons brought the blood to him; he dipped his finger in the blood and put it on the horns of the altar; and he poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
Transliteration: vayakerivu veney aharon et-hadam elayv vayitevol etsevavo vadam vayiten al-karenvot hamizevecha veet-hadam yatsak el-yesvod hamizevecha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחֵ֨לֶב וְאֶת־הַכְּלָיֹ֜ת וְאֶת־הַיֹּתֶ֤רֶת מִן־הַכָּבֵד֙ מִן־הַ֣חַטָּ֔את הִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: The fat, the kidneys, and the protuberance of the liver from the sin offering he turned into smoke on the altar—as יהוה had commanded Moses;
Transliteration: veet-hachelev veet-hakhelayot veet-hayoteret min-hakhaved min-hachatat hiketiyr hamizevechah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֖ר וְאֶת־הָע֑וֹר שָׂרַ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: and the flesh and the skin were consumed in fire outside the camp.
Transliteration: veet-havashar veet-havor sharaf vaesh michuts lamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחַ֖ט אֶת־הָעֹלָ֑ה וַ֠יַּמְצִ֠אוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֤ן אֵלָיו֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וַיִּזְרְקֵ֥הוּ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: Then he slaughtered the burnt offering. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him, and he dashed it against all sides of the altar.
Transliteration: vayishechat et-haolah vayametsiu veney aharon elayv et-hadam vayizerekehu al-hamizevecha saviyv

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָעֹלָ֗ה הִמְצִ֧יאוּ אֵלָ֛יו לִנְתָחֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־הָרֹ֑אשׁ וַיַּקְטֵ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: They passed the burnt offering to him in sections, as well as the head, and he turned it into smoke on the altar.
Transliteration: veet-haolah himetsiyu elayv linetacheyha veet-harosh vayaketer al-hamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיִּרְחַ֥ץ אֶת־הַקֶּ֖רֶב וְאֶת־הַכְּרָעָ֑יִם וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר עַל־הָעֹלָ֖ה הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
Translated: He washed the entrails and the legs, and turned them into smoke on the altar with the burnt offering.
Transliteration: vayirechats et-hakerev veet-hakheraayiim vayaketer al-haolah hamizevechah

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֕ב אֵ֖ת קׇרְבַּ֣ן הָעָ֑ם וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶת־שְׂעִ֤יר הַֽחַטָּאת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָעָ֔ם וַיִּשְׁחָטֵ֥הוּ וַֽיְחַטְּאֵ֖הוּ כָּרִאשֽׁוֹן׃
Translated: Next he brought forward the people’s offering. He took the goat for the people’s sin offering, and slaughtered it, and presented it as a sin offering like the previous one.
Transliteration: vayakerev et kׇrevan haam vayikach et-sheiyr hachatat asher laam vayishechatehu vayechateehu kharishvon

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֖ב אֶת־הָעֹלָ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲשֶׂ֖הָ כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: He brought forward the burnt offering and sacrificed it according to regulation.
Transliteration: vayakerev et-haolah vayaasheha khamishefat

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֮ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָה֒ וַיְמַלֵּ֤א כַפּוֹ֙ מִמֶּ֔נָּה וַיַּקְטֵ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ מִלְּבַ֖ד עֹלַ֥ת הַבֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: He then brought forward the meal offering and, taking a handful of it, he turned it into smoke on the altar—in addition to the burnt offering of the morning.
Transliteration: vayakerev et-haminechah vayemale khafvo mimenah vayaketer al-hamizevecha milevad olat havoker

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁחַ֤ט אֶת־הַשּׁוֹר֙ וְאֶת־הָאַ֔יִל זֶ֥בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָעָ֑ם וַ֠יַּמְצִ֠אוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֤ן אֶת־הַדָּם֙ אֵלָ֔יו וַיִּזְרְקֵ֥הוּ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: He slaughtered the ox and the ram, the people’s sacrifice of well-being. Aaron’s sons passed the blood to him—which he dashed against every side of the altar—
Transliteration: vayishechat et-hashvor veet-haayiil zevach hashelamiym asher laam vayametsiu veney aharon et-hadam elayv vayizerekehu al-hamizevecha saviyv

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַחֲלָבִ֖ים מִן־הַשּׁ֑וֹר וּמִ֨ן־הָאַ֔יִל הָֽאַלְיָ֤ה וְהַֽמְכַסֶּה֙ וְהַכְּלָיֹ֔ת וְיֹתֶ֖רֶת הַכָּבֵֽד׃
Translated: and the fat parts of the ox and the ram: the broad tail, the covering [fat], the kidneys, and the protuberances of the livers.
Transliteration: veet-hachalaviym min-hashvor umin-haayiil haaleyah vehamekhaseh vehakhelayot veyoteret hakhaved

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ אֶת־הַחֲלָבִ֖ים עַל־הֶחָז֑וֹת וַיַּקְטֵ֥ר הַחֲלָבִ֖ים הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
Translated: They laid these fat parts over the breasts; and Aaron turned the fat parts into smoke on the altar,
Transliteration: vayashiymu et-hachalaviym al-hechazvot vayaketer hachalaviym hamizevechah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת הֶחָז֗וֹת וְאֵת֙ שׁ֣וֹק הַיָּמִ֔ין הֵנִ֧יף אַהֲרֹ֛ן תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: and elevated the breasts and the right thighs as an elevation offering before יהוה —as Moses had commanded.
Transliteration: veet hechazvot veet shvok hayamiyn heniyf aharon tenufah lifeney yehovah khaasher tsivah mosheh

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א אַהֲרֹ֧ן אֶת־יָדָ֛ו אֶל־הָעָ֖ם וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֑ם וַיֵּ֗רֶד מֵעֲשֹׂ֧ת הַֽחַטָּ֛את וְהָעֹלָ֖ה וְהַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
Translated: Aaron lifted his hands toward the people and blessed them; and he stepped down after offering the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the offering of well-being.
Transliteration: vayisha aharon et-yadav el-haam vayevarekhem vayered meashot hachatat vehaolah vehashelamiym

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וַיֵּ֣צְא֔וּ וַֽיְבָרְכ֖וּ אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיֵּרָ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Moses and Aaron then went inside the Tent of Meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people; and the Presence of יהוה appeared to all the people.
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh veaharon el-ohel mvoed vayetseu vayevarekhu et-haam vayera khevvod-yehovah el-khׇl-haam

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤צֵא אֵשׁ֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתֹּ֙אכַל֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ אֶת־הָעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶת־הַחֲלָבִ֑ים וַיַּ֤רְא כׇּל־הָעָם֙ וַיָּרֹ֔נּוּ וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Fire came forth from before יהוה and consumed the burnt offering and the fat parts on the altar. And all the people saw, and shouted, and fell on their faces.
Transliteration: vatetse esh milifeney yehovah vatokhal al-hamizevecha et-haolah veet-hachalaviym vayare khׇl-haam vayaronu vayifelu al-feneyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֣וּ בְנֵֽי־אַ֠הֲרֹ֠ן נָדָ֨ב וַאֲבִיה֜וּא אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֗וֹ וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ בָהֵן֙ אֵ֔שׁ וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ עָלֶ֖יהָ קְטֹ֑רֶת וַיַּקְרִ֜יבוּ לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אֵ֣שׁ זָרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹ֦א צִוָּ֖ה אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Now Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu each took his fire pan, put fire in it, and laid incense on it; and they offered before יהוה alien fire, which had not been enjoined upon them.
Transliteration: vayikechu veney-aharon nadav vaaviyhu iysh machetatvo vayitenu vahen esh vayashiymu aleyha ketoret vayakeriyvu lifeney yehovah esh zarah asher lo tsivah otam

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֥צֵא אֵ֛שׁ מִלִּפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה וַתֹּ֣אכַל אוֹתָ֑ם וַיָּמֻ֖תוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And fire came forth from יהוה and consumed them; thus they died at the instance of יהוה.
Transliteration: vatetse esh milifeney yehovah vatokhal votam vayamutu lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן הוּא֩ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֤ה <small>׀</small> לֵאמֹר֙ בִּקְרֹבַ֣י אֶקָּדֵ֔שׁ וְעַל־פְּנֵ֥י כׇל־הָעָ֖ם אֶכָּבֵ֑ד וַיִּדֹּ֖ם אַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated:
Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what יהוה meant by saying:
Through those near to Me I show Myself holy,
And gain glory before all the people.”
And Aaron was silent.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon hu asher-diver yehovah <small></small> lemor vikerovay ekadesh veal-feney khׇl-haam ekhaved vayidom aharon

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶל־מִֽישָׁאֵל֙ וְאֶ֣ל אֶלְצָפָ֔ן בְּנֵ֥י עֻזִּיאֵ֖ל דֹּ֣ד אַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם קִ֞֠רְב֞֠וּ שְׂא֤וּ אֶת־אֲחֵיכֶם֙ מֵאֵ֣ת פְּנֵי־הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, “Come forward and carry your kinsmen away from the front of the sanctuary to a place outside the camp.”
Transliteration: vayikera mosheh el-miyshael veel eletsafan veney uziyel dod aharon vayomer alehem kirevuu sheu et-acheykhem meet feney-hakodesh el-michuts lamachaneh

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְב֗וּ וַיִּשָּׂאֻם֙ בְּכֻתֳּנֹתָ֔ם אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: They came forward and carried them out of the camp by their tunics, as Moses had ordered.
Transliteration: vayikerevu vayishaum vekhutonotam el-michuts lamachaneh khaasher diver mosheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֣ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֡ן וּלְאֶלְעָזָר֩ וּלְאִֽיתָמָ֨ר ׀ בָּנָ֜יו רָֽאשֵׁיכֶ֥ם אַל־תִּפְרָ֣עוּ ׀ וּבִגְדֵיכֶ֤ם לֹֽא־תִפְרֹ֙מוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א תָמֻ֔תוּ וְעַ֥ל כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה יִקְצֹ֑ף וַאֲחֵיכֶם֙ כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִבְכּוּ֙ אֶת־הַשְּׂרֵפָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר שָׂרַ֥ף יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And Moses said to Aaron and to his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, “Do not bare your heads and do not rend your clothes, lest you die and anger strike the whole community. But your kin, all the house of Israel, shall bewail the burning that יהוה has wrought.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon uleeleazar uleiytamar vanayv rasheykhem al-tiferau uvigedeykhem lo-tiferomu velo tamutu veal khׇl-haedah yiketsof vaacheykhem khׇl-veyt yisherael yivekhu et-hasherefah asher sharaf yehovah

Hebrew: וּמִפֶּ֩תַח֩ אֹ֨הֶל מוֹעֵ֜ד לֹ֤א תֵֽצְאוּ֙ פֶּן־תָּמֻ֔תוּ כִּי־שֶׁ֛מֶן מִשְׁחַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ כִּדְבַ֥ר מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: And so do not go outside the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, lest you die, for יהוה’s anointing oil is upon you.” And they did as Moses had bidden.
Transliteration: umifetach ohel mvoed lo tetseu fen-tamutu khiy-shemen mishechat yehovah aleykhem vayaashu khidevar mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה spoke to Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-aharon lemor

Hebrew: יַ֣יִן וְשֵׁכָ֞ר אַל־תֵּ֣שְׁתְּ ׀ אַתָּ֣ה ׀ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִתָּ֗ךְ בְּבֹאֲכֶ֛ם אֶל־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְלֹ֣א תָמֻ֑תוּ חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Drink no wine or other intoxicant, you or your sons, when you enter the Tent of Meeting, that you may not die. This is a law for all time throughout the ages,
Transliteration: yayiin veshekhar al-teshete atah uvaneykha itakhe vevoakhem el-ohel mvoed velo tamutu chukat volam ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: וּֽלְהַבְדִּ֔יל בֵּ֥ין הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ וּבֵ֣ין הַחֹ֑ל וּבֵ֥ין הַטָּמֵ֖א וּבֵ֥ין הַטָּהֽוֹר׃
Translated: for you must distinguish between the sacred and the profane, and between the impure and the pure;
Transliteration: ulehavediyl veyn hakodesh uveyn hachol uveyn hatame uveyn hatahvor

Hebrew: וּלְהוֹרֹ֖ת אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַ֣חֻקִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: and you must teach the Israelites all the laws which יהוה has imparted to them through Moses.
Transliteration: ulehvorot et-veney yisherael et khׇl-hachukiym asher diver yehovah aleyhem veyad-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וְאֶ֣ל אֶ֠לְעָזָ֠ר וְאֶל־אִ֨יתָמָ֥ר <small>׀</small> בָּנָיו֮ הַנּֽוֹתָרִים֒ קְח֣וּ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֗ה הַנּוֹתֶ֙רֶת֙ מֵאִשֵּׁ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְאִכְל֥וּהָ מַצּ֖וֹת אֵ֣צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כִּ֛י קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִֽוא׃
Translated: Moses spoke to Aaron and to his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar: Take the meal offering that is left over from יהוה’s offerings by fire and eat it unleavened beside the altar, for it is most holy.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-aharon veel eleazar veel-iytamar <small></small> vanayv hanvotariym kechu et-haminechah hanvoteret meishey yehovah veikheluha matsvot etsel hamizevecha khiy kodesh kׇdashiym hiv

Hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֹתָהּ֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָד֔וֹשׁ כִּ֣י חׇקְךָ֤ וְחׇק־בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ הִ֔וא מֵאִשֵּׁ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּי־כֵ֖ן צֻוֵּֽיתִי׃
Translated: You shall eat it in the sacred precinct, inasmuch as it is your due, and that of your sons, from יהוה’s offerings by fire; for so I have been commanded.
Transliteration: vaakhaletem otah vemakvom kadvosh khiy chׇkekha vechׇk-vaneykha hiv meishey yehovah khiy-khen tsuveytiy

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ חֲזֵ֨ה הַתְּנוּפָ֜ה וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֗ה תֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם טָה֔וֹר אַתָּ֕ה וּבָנֶ֥יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֖יךָ אִתָּ֑ךְ כִּֽי־חׇקְךָ֤ וְחׇק־בָּנֶ֙יךָ֙ נִתְּנ֔וּ מִזִּבְחֵ֥י שַׁלְמֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But the breast of elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering you [and your wife], and your sons and daughters with you, may eat in any pure place, for they have been assigned as a due to you and your sons from the Israelites’ sacrifices of well-being.
Transliteration: veet chazeh hatenufah veet shvok haterumah tokhelu vemakvom tahvor atah uvaneykha uvenoteykha itakhe khiy-chׇkekha vechׇk-vaneykha nitenu mizivechey shalemey veney yisherael

Hebrew: שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֞ה וַחֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֗ה עַ֣ל אִשֵּׁ֤י הַחֲלָבִים֙ יָבִ֔יאוּ לְהָנִ֥יף תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֨ה לְךָ֜ וּלְבָנֶ֤יךָ אִתְּךָ֙ לְחׇק־עוֹלָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Together with the fat of fire offering, they must present the thigh of gift offering and the breast of elevation offering, which are to be elevated as an elevation offering before יהוה, and which are to be your due and that of your sons with you for all time—as יהוה has commanded.
Transliteration: shvok haterumah vachazeh hatenufah al ishey hachalaviym yaviyu lehaniyf tenufah lifeney yehovah vehayah lekha ulevaneykha itekha lechׇk-volam khaasher tsivah yehovah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׂעִ֣יר הַֽחַטָּ֗את דָּרֹ֥שׁ דָּרַ֛שׁ מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְהִנֵּ֣ה שֹׂרָ֑ף וַ֠יִּקְצֹ֠ף עַל־אֶלְעָזָ֤ר וְעַל־אִֽיתָמָר֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן הַנּוֹתָרִ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then Moses inquired about the goat of sin offering, and it had already been burned! He was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, and said,
Transliteration: veet sheiyr hachatat darosh darash mosheh vehineh shoraf vayiketsof al-eleazar veal-iytamar veney aharon hanvotarim lemor

Hebrew: מַדּ֗וּעַ לֹֽא־אֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־הַחַטָּאת֙ בִּמְק֣וֹם הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ כִּ֛י קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֖ים הִ֑וא וְאֹתָ֣הּ ׀ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֗ם לָשֵׂאת֙ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הָעֵדָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֥ר עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “Why did you not eat the sin offering in the sacred area? For it is most holy, and it is what was given to you to remove the guilt of the community and to make expiation for them before יהוה.
Transliteration: madua lo-akhaletem et-hachatat vimekvom hakodesh khiy kodesh kׇdashiym hiv veotah natan lakhem lashet et-avon haedah lekhafer aleyhem lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: הֵ֚ן לֹא־הוּבָ֣א אֶת־דָּמָ֔הּ אֶל־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ פְּנִ֑ימָה אָכ֨וֹל תֹּאכְל֥וּ אֹתָ֛הּ בַּקֹּ֖דֶשׁ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוֵּֽיתִי׃
Translated: Since its blood was not brought inside the sanctuary, you should certainly have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded.”
Transliteration: hen lo-huva et-damah el-hakodesh feniymah akhvol tokhelu otah vakodesh khaasher tsiveytiy

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הֵ֣ן הַ֠יּ֠וֹם הִקְרִ֨יבוּ אֶת־חַטָּאתָ֤ם וְאֶת־עֹֽלָתָם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתִּקְרֶ֥אנָה אֹתִ֖י כָּאֵ֑לֶּה וְאָכַ֤לְתִּי חַטָּאת֙ הַיּ֔וֹם הַיִּיטַ֖ב בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And Aaron spoke to Moses, “See, this day they brought their sin offering and their burnt offering before יהוה, and such things have befallen me! Had I eaten sin offering today, would יהוה have approved?”
Transliteration: vayedaver aharon el-mosheh hen hayyvom hikeriyvu et-chatatam veet-olatam lifeney yehovah vatikerenah otiy khaeleh veakhaletiy chatat hayyvom hayiytav veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּיטַ֖ב בְּעֵינָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: And when Moses heard this, he approved.
Transliteration: vayishema mosheh vayiytav veeynayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹ֥ר אֲלֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying to them:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor alehem

Hebrew: דַּבְּר֛וּ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֹ֤את הַֽחַיָּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֹּאכְל֔וּ מִכׇּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people thus: These are the creatures that you may eat from among all the land animals:
Transliteration: daveru el-veney yisherael lemor zot hachayah asher tokhelu mikhׇl-havehemah asher al-haarets

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ל ׀ מַפְרֶ֣סֶת פַּרְסָ֗ה וְשֹׁסַ֤עַת שֶׁ֙סַע֙ פְּרָסֹ֔ת מַעֲלַ֥ת גֵּרָ֖ה בַּבְּהֵמָ֑ה אֹתָ֖הּ תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: any animal that has true hoofs, with clefts through the hoofs, and that chews the cud—such you may eat.
Transliteration: khol mafereset faresah veshosaat shesa ferasot maalat gerah vavehemah otah tokhelu

Hebrew: אַ֤ךְ אֶת־זֶה֙ לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְל֔וּ מִֽמַּעֲלֵי֙ הַגֵּרָ֔ה וּמִמַּפְרִסֵ֖י הַפַּרְסָ֑ה אֶֽת־הַ֠גָּמָ֠ל כִּֽי־מַעֲלֵ֨ה גֵרָ֜ה ה֗וּא וּפַרְסָה֙ אֵינֶ֣נּוּ מַפְרִ֔יס טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: The following, however, of those that either chew the cud or have true hoofs, you shall not eat: the camel—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is impure for you;
Transliteration: akhe et-zeh lo tokhelu mimaaley hagerah umimaferisey hafaresah et-hagamal khiy-maaleh gerah hu ufaresah eynenu maferiys tame hu lakhem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַשָּׁפָ֗ן כִּֽי־מַעֲלֵ֤ה גֵרָה֙ ה֔וּא וּפַרְסָ֖ה לֹ֣א יַפְרִ֑יס טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: the daman—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is impure for you;
Transliteration: veet-hashafan khiy-maaleh gerah hu ufaresah lo yaferiys tame hu lakhem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַרְנֶ֗בֶת כִּֽי־מַעֲלַ֤ת גֵּרָה֙ הִ֔וא וּפַרְסָ֖ה לֹ֣א הִפְרִ֑יסָה טְמֵאָ֥ה הִ֖וא לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: the hare—although it chews the cud, it has no true hoofs: it is impure for you;
Transliteration: veet-haarenevet khiy-maalat gerah hiv ufaresah lo hiferiysah temeah hiv lakhem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַ֠חֲזִ֠יר כִּֽי־מַפְרִ֨יס פַּרְסָ֜ה ה֗וּא וְשֹׁסַ֥ע שֶׁ֙סַע֙ פַּרְסָ֔ה וְה֖וּא גֵּרָ֣ה לֹֽא־יִגָּ֑ר טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: and the swine—although it has true hoofs, with the hoofs cleft through, it does not chew the cud: it is impure for you.
Transliteration: veet-hachaziyr khiy-maferiys faresah hu veshosa shesa faresah vehu gerah lo-yigar tame hu lakhem

Hebrew: מִבְּשָׂרָם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ וּבְנִבְלָתָ֖ם לֹ֣א תִגָּ֑עוּ טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not eat of their flesh or touch their carcasses; they are impure for you.
Transliteration: mivesharam lo tokhelu uvenivelatam lo tigau temeiym hem lakhem

Hebrew: אֶת־זֶה֙ תֹּֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמָּ֑יִם כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֩ סְנַפִּ֨יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֜שֶׂת בַּמַּ֗יִם בַּיַּמִּ֛ים וּבַנְּחָלִ֖ים אֹתָ֥ם תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: These you may eat of all that live in water: anything in water, whether in the seas or in the streams, that has fins and scales—these you may eat.
Transliteration: et-zeh tokhelu mikhol asher vamayiim khol asher-lvo senafiyr vekashekeshet vamayiim vayamiym uvanechaliym otam tokhelu

Hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֵֽין־ל֜וֹ סְנַפִּ֣יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֗שֶׂת בַּיַּמִּים֙ וּבַנְּחָלִ֔ים מִכֹּל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הַמַּ֔יִם וּמִכֹּ֛ל נֶ֥פֶשׁ הַחַיָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמָּ֑יִם שֶׁ֥קֶץ הֵ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: But anything in the seas or in the streams that has no fins and scales, among all the swarming things of the water and among all the other living creatures that are in the water—they are an abomination for you
Transliteration: vekhol asher eyn-lvo senafiyr vekashekeshet vayamiym uvanechaliym mikhol sherets hamayiim umikhol nefesh hachayah asher vamayiim shekets hem lakhem

Hebrew: וְשֶׁ֖קֶץ יִהְי֣וּ לָכֶ֑ם מִבְּשָׂרָם֙ לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֔לוּ וְאֶת־נִבְלָתָ֖ם תְּשַׁקֵּֽצוּ׃
Translated: and an abomination for you they shall remain: you shall not eat of their flesh and you shall abominate their carcasses.
Transliteration: veshekets yiheyu lakhem mivesharam lo tokhelu veet-nivelatam teshaketsu

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵֽין־ל֛וֹ סְנַפִּ֥יר וְקַשְׂקֶ֖שֶׂת בַּמָּ֑יִם שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Everything in water that has no fins and scales shall be an abomination for you.
Transliteration: khol asher eyn-lvo senafiyr vekashekeshet vamayiim shekets hu lakhem

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ תְּשַׁקְּצ֣וּ מִן־הָע֔וֹף לֹ֥א יֵאָכְל֖וּ שֶׁ֣קֶץ הֵ֑ם אֶת־הַנֶּ֙שֶׁר֙ וְאֶת־הַפֶּ֔רֶס וְאֵ֖ת הָעׇזְנִיָּֽה׃
Translated: The following you shall abominate among the birds—they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle, the vulture, and the black vulture;
Transliteration: veet-eleh teshaketsu min-havof lo eiakhelu shekets hem et-hanesher veet-haferes veet haׇzeniyah

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־הַדָּאָ֔ה וְאֶת־הָאַיָּ֖ה לְמִינָֽהּ׃
Translated: the kite, falcons of every variety;
Transliteration: veet-hadaah veet-haayah lemiynah

Hebrew: אֵ֥ת כׇּל־עֹרֵ֖ב לְמִינֽוֹ׃
Translated: all varieties of raven;
Transliteration: et khׇl-orev lemiynvo

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ בַּ֣ת הַֽיַּעֲנָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַתַּחְמָ֖ס וְאֶת־הַשָּׁ֑חַף וְאֶת־הַנֵּ֖ץ לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: the ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull; hawks of every variety;
Transliteration: veet vat hayaanah veet-hatachemas veet-hashachaf veet-hanets lemiynehu

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַכּ֥וֹס וְאֶת־הַשָּׁלָ֖ךְ וְאֶת־הַיַּנְשֽׁוּף׃
Translated: the little owl, the cormorant, and the great owl;
Transliteration: veet-hakhvos veet-hashalakhe veet-hayaneshuf

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַתִּנְשֶׁ֥מֶת וְאֶת־הַקָּאָ֖ת וְאֶת־הָרָחָֽם׃
Translated: the white owl, the pelican, and the bustard;
Transliteration: veet-hatineshemet veet-hakaat veet-haracham

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַחֲסִידָ֔ה הָאֲנָפָ֖ה לְמִינָ֑הּ וְאֶת־הַדּוּכִיפַ֖ת וְאֶת־הָעֲטַלֵּֽף׃
Translated: the stork; herons of every variety; the hoopoe, and the bat.
Transliteration: veet hachasiydah haanafah lemiynah veet-hadukhiyfat veet-haatalef

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ל שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֑ע שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: All winged swarming things that walk on fours shall be an abomination for you.
Transliteration: khol sherets havof haholekhe al-areva shekets hu lakhem

Hebrew: אַ֤ךְ אֶת־זֶה֙ תֹּֽאכְל֔וּ מִכֹּל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף הַהֹלֵ֖ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֑ע אֲשֶׁר־[ל֤וֹ] (לא) כְרָעַ֙יִם֙ מִמַּ֣עַל לְרַגְלָ֔יו לְנַתֵּ֥ר בָּהֵ֖ן עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: But these you may eat among all the winged swarming things that walk on fours: all that have, above their feet, jointed legs to leap with on the ground—
Transliteration: akhe et-zeh tokhelu mikhol sherets havof haholekhe al-areva asher-[lvo] (l) kheraayiim mimaal leragelayv lenater vahen al-haarets

Hebrew: אֶת־אֵ֤לֶּה מֵהֶם֙ תֹּאכֵ֔לוּ אֶת־הָֽאַרְבֶּ֣ה לְמִינ֔וֹ וְאֶת־הַסׇּלְעָ֖ם לְמִינֵ֑הוּ וְאֶת־הַחַרְגֹּ֣ל לְמִינֵ֔הוּ וְאֶת־הֶחָגָ֖ב לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: of these you may eat the following: locusts of every variety; all varieties of bald locust; crickets of every variety; and all varieties of grasshopper.
Transliteration: et-eleh mehem tokhelu et-haareveh lemiynvo veet-hasׇleam lemiynehu veet-hacharegol lemiynehu veet-hechagav lemiynehu

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ שֶׁ֣רֶץ הָע֔וֹף אֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ אַרְבַּ֣ע רַגְלָ֑יִם שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: But all other winged swarming things that have four legs shall be an abomination for you.
Transliteration: vekhol sherets havof asher-lvo areva ragelayiim shekets hu lakhem

Hebrew: וּלְאֵ֖לֶּה תִּטַּמָּ֑אוּ כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖ם יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: And the following shall make you impure—whoever touches their carcasses shall be impure until evening,
Transliteration: uleeleh titamau khׇl-hanogea venivelatam yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַנֹּשֵׂ֖א מִנִּבְלָתָ֑ם יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: and whoever carries the carcasses of any of them shall wash those clothes and be impure until evening—
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanoshe minivelatam yekhaves vegadayv vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: לְֽכׇל־הַבְּהֵמָ֡ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִוא֩ מַפְרֶ֨סֶת פַּרְסָ֜ה וְשֶׁ֣סַע ׀ אֵינֶ֣נָּה שֹׁסַ֗עַת וְגֵרָה֙ אֵינֶ֣נָּה מַעֲלָ֔ה טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶ֑ם כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּהֶ֖ם יִטְמָֽא׃
Translated: every animal that has true hoofs but without clefts through the hoofs, or that does not chew the cud. They are impure for you; whoever touches them shall be impure.
Transliteration: lekhׇl-havehemah asher hiv mafereset faresah veshesa eynenah shosaat vegerah eynenah maalah temeiym hem lakhem khׇl-hanogea vahem yitema

Hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ עַל־כַּפָּ֗יו בְּכׇל־הַֽחַיָּה֙ הַהֹלֶ֣כֶת עַל־אַרְבַּ֔ע טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖ם לָכֶ֑ם כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖ם יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Also all animals that walk on paws, among those that walk on fours, are impure for you; whoever touches their carcasses shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhol hvolekhe al-khafayv vekhׇl-hachayah haholekhet al-areva temeiym hem lakhem khׇl-hanogea venivelatam yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְהַנֹּשֵׂא֙ אֶת־נִבְלָתָ֔ם יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֣א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב טְמֵאִ֥ים הֵ֖מָּה לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And anyone who carries their carcasses shall wash those clothes and remain impure until evening. They are impure for you.
Transliteration: vehanoshe et-nivelatam yekhaves vegadayv vetame ad-haarev temeiym hemah lakhem {s}

Hebrew: וְזֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ הַטָּמֵ֔א בַּשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ הַחֹ֥לֶד וְהָעַכְבָּ֖ר וְהַצָּ֥ב לְמִינֵֽהוּ׃
Translated: The following shall be impure for you from among the things that swarm on the earth: the mole, the mouse, and great lizards of every variety;
Transliteration: vezeh lakhem hatame vasherets hashorets al-haarets hacholed vehaakhevar vehatsav lemiynehu

Hebrew: וְהָאֲנָקָ֥ה וְהַכֹּ֖חַ וְהַלְּטָאָ֑ה וְהַחֹ֖מֶט וְהַתִּנְשָֽׁמֶת׃
Translated: the gecko, the land crocodile, the lizard, the sand lizard, and the chameleon.
Transliteration: vehaanakah vehakhocha vehaletaah vehachomet vehatineshamet

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה הַטְּמֵאִ֥ים לָכֶ֖ם בְּכׇל־הַשָּׁ֑רֶץ כׇּל־הַנֹּגֵ֧עַ בָּהֶ֛ם בְּמֹתָ֖ם יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Those are for you the impure among all the swarming things; whoever touches them when they are dead shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: eleh hatemeiym lakhem vekhׇl-hasharets khׇl-hanogea vahem vemotam yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יִפֹּל־עָלָיו֩ מֵהֶ֨ם <small>׀</small> בְּמֹתָ֜ם יִטְמָ֗א מִכׇּל־כְּלִי־עֵץ֙ א֣וֹ בֶ֤גֶד אוֹ־עוֹר֙ א֣וֹ שָׂ֔ק כׇּל־כְּלִ֕י אֲשֶׁר־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה מְלָאכָ֖ה בָּהֶ֑ם בַּמַּ֧יִם יוּבָ֛א וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעֶ֖רֶב וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: And anything on which one of them falls when dead shall be impure: be it any article of wood, or a cloth, or a skin, or a sack—any such article that can be put to use shall be dipped in water, and it shall remain impure until evening; then it shall be pure.
Transliteration: vekhol asher-yifol-alayv mehem <small></small> vemotam yitema mikhׇl-kheliy-ets vo veged vo-vor vo shak khׇl-kheliy asher-eiasheh melakhah vahem vamayiim yuva vetame ad-haerev vetaher

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־כְּלִי־חֶ֔רֶשׂ אֲשֶׁר־יִפֹּ֥ל מֵהֶ֖ם אֶל־תּוֹכ֑וֹ כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּתוֹכ֛וֹ יִטְמָ֖א וְאֹת֥וֹ תִשְׁבֹּֽרוּ׃
Translated: And if any of those falls into an earthen vessel, everything inside it shall be impure and [the vessel] itself you shall break.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-kheliy-cheresh asher-yifol mehem el-tvokhvo khol asher vetvokhvo yitema veotvo tishevoru

Hebrew: מִכׇּל־הָאֹ֜כֶל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵאָכֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָב֥וֹא עָלָ֛יו מַ֖יִם יִטְמָ֑א וְכׇל־מַשְׁקֶה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשָּׁתֶ֔ה בְּכׇל־כְּלִ֖י יִטְמָֽא׃
Translated: As to any food that may be eaten, it shall become impure if it came in contact with water; as to any liquid that may be drunk, it shall become impure if it was inside any vessel.
Transliteration: mikhׇl-haokhel asher eiakhel asher yavvo alayv mayiim yitema vekhׇl-mashekeh asher yishateh vekhׇl-kheliy yitema

Hebrew: וְ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁר־יִפֹּ֨ל מִנִּבְלָתָ֥ם <small>׀</small> עָלָיו֮ יִטְמָא֒ תַּנּ֧וּר וְכִירַ֛יִם יֻתָּ֖ץ טְמֵאִ֣ים הֵ֑ם וּטְמֵאִ֖ים יִהְי֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Everything on which the carcass of any of them falls shall be impure: an oven or stove shall be smashed. They are impure—and impure they shall remain for you.
Transliteration: vekhol asher-yifol minivelatam <small></small> alayv yitema tanur vekhiyrayiim yutats temeiym hem utemeiym yiheyu lakhem

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ מַעְיָ֥ן וּב֛וֹר מִקְוֵה־מַ֖יִם יִהְיֶ֣ה טָה֑וֹר וְנֹגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖ם יִטְמָֽא׃
Translated: However, a spring or cistern in which water is collected shall be pure, but whoever touches such a carcass in it shall be impure.
Transliteration: akhe maeyan uvvor mikeveh-mayiim yiheyeh tahvor venogea venivelatam yitema

Hebrew: וְכִ֤י יִפֹּל֙ מִנִּבְלָתָ֔ם עַל־כׇּל־זֶ֥רַע זֵר֖וּעַ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִזָּרֵ֑עַ טָה֖וֹר הֽוּא׃
Translated: If such a carcass falls upon seed grain that is to be sown, it is pure;
Transliteration: vekhiy yifol minivelatam al-khׇl-zera zerua asher yizarea tahvor hu

Hebrew: וְכִ֤י יֻתַּן־מַ֙יִם֙ עַל־זֶ֔רַע וְנָפַ֥ל מִנִּבְלָתָ֖ם עָלָ֑יו טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: but if water is put on the seed and any part of a carcass falls upon it, it shall be impure for you.
Transliteration: vekhiy yutan-mayiim al-zera venafal minivelatam alayv tame hu lakhem {s}

Hebrew: וְכִ֤י יָמוּת֙ מִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הִ֥יא לָכֶ֖ם לְאׇכְלָ֑ה הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּנִבְלָתָ֖הּ יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: If an animal that you may eat has died, anyone who touches its carcass shall be impure until evening;
Transliteration: vekhiy yamut min-havehemah asher-hiy lakhem leׇkhelah hanogea venivelatah yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְהָֽאֹכֵל֙ מִנִּבְלָתָ֔הּ יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֣א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְהַנֹּשֵׂא֙ אֶת־נִבְלָתָ֔הּ יְכַבֵּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: anyone who eats of its carcass shall wash those clothes and remain impure until evening; and anyone who carries its carcass shall wash those clothes and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vehaokhel minivelatah yekhaves vegadayv vetame ad-haarev vehanoshe et-nivelatah yekhaves vegadayv vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ שֶׁ֥קֶץ ה֖וּא לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵֽל׃
Translated: All the things that swarm upon the earth are an abomination; they shall not be eaten.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hasherets hashorets al-haarets shekets hu lo eiakhel

Hebrew: כֹּל֩ הוֹלֵ֨ךְ עַל־גָּח֜וֹן וְכֹ֣ל ׀ הוֹלֵ֣ךְ עַל־אַרְבַּ֗ע עַ֚ד כׇּל־מַרְבֵּ֣ה רַגְלַ֔יִם לְכׇל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֣ץ עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ לֹ֥א תֹאכְל֖וּם כִּי־שֶׁ֥קֶץ הֵֽם׃
Translated: You shall not eat, among all things that swarm upon the earth, anything that crawls on its belly, or anything that walks on fours, or anything that has many legs; for they are an abomination.
Transliteration: khol hvolekhe al-gachvon vekhol hvolekhe al-areva ad khׇl-mareveh ragelayiim lekhׇl-hasherets hashorets al-haarets lo tokhelum khiy-shekets hem

Hebrew: אַל־תְּשַׁקְּצוּ֙ אֶת־נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכׇל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הַשֹּׁרֵ֑ץ וְלֹ֤א תִֽטַּמְּאוּ֙ בָּהֶ֔ם וְנִטְמֵתֶ֖ם בָּֽם׃
Translated: You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through anything that swarms; you shall not make yourselves impure therewith and thus become impure.
Transliteration: al-teshaketsu et-nafeshoteykhem vekhׇl-hasherets hashorets velo titameu vahem venitemetem vam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָה֮ אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֒ וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם֙ וִהְיִיתֶ֣ם קְדֹשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י קָד֖וֹשׁ אָ֑נִי וְלֹ֤א תְטַמְּאוּ֙ אֶת־נַפְשֹׁ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכׇל־הַשֶּׁ֖רֶץ הָרֹמֵ֥שׂ עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: For I יהוה am your God: you shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I am holy. You shall not make yourselves impure through any swarming thing that moves upon the earth.
Transliteration: khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem vehitekadishetem viheyiytem kedoshiym khiy kadvosh aniy velo tetameu et-nafeshoteykhem vekhׇl-hasherets haromesh al-haarets

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה הַֽמַּעֲלֶ֤ה אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִהְיֹ֥ת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים וִהְיִיתֶ֣ם קְדֹשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י קָד֖וֹשׁ אָֽנִי׃
Translated: For I יהוה am the One who brought you up from the land of Egypt to be your God: you shall be holy, for I am holy.
Transliteration: khiy aniy yehovah hamaaleh etekhem meerets mitserayiim liheyot lakhem lelohiym viheyiytem kedoshiym khiy kadvosh aniy

Hebrew: זֹ֣את תּוֹרַ֤ת הַבְּהֵמָה֙ וְהָע֔וֹף וְכֹל֙ נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַֽחַיָּ֔ה הָרֹמֶ֖שֶׂת בַּמָּ֑יִם וּלְכׇל־נֶ֖פֶשׁ הַשֹּׁרֶ֥צֶת עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: These are the instructions concerning animals, birds, all living creatures that move in water, and all creatures that swarm on earth,
Transliteration: zot tvorat havehemah vehavof vekhol nefesh hachayah haromeshet vamayiim ulekhׇl-nefesh hashoretset al-haarets

Hebrew: לְהַבְדִּ֕יל בֵּ֥ין הַטָּמֵ֖א וּבֵ֣ין הַטָּהֹ֑ר וּבֵ֤ין הַֽחַיָּה֙ הַֽנֶּאֱכֶ֔לֶת וּבֵין֙ הַֽחַיָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֥א תֵאָכֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: for distinguishing between the impure and the pure, between the living things that may be eaten and the living things that may not be eaten.
Transliteration: lehavediyl veyn hatame uveyn hatahor uveyn hachayah haneekhelet uveyn hachayah asher lo teakhel {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אִשָּׁה֙ כִּ֣י תַזְרִ֔יעַ וְיָלְדָ֖ה זָכָ֑ר וְטָֽמְאָה֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים כִּימֵ֛י נִדַּ֥ת דְּוֺתָ֖הּ תִּטְמָֽא׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people thus: When a woman at childbirth bears a male, she shall be impure seven days; she shall be impure as at the time of her condition of menstrual separation.—
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael lemor ishah khiy tazeriya veyaledah zakhar vetameah shiveat yamiym khiymey nidat devotah titema

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֖וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֑י יִמּ֖וֹל בְּשַׂ֥ר עׇרְלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: On the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.—
Transliteration: uvayyvom hashemiyniy yimvol veshar ׇrelatvo

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים יוֹם֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים תֵּשֵׁ֖ב בִּדְמֵ֣י טׇהֳרָ֑הֿ בְּכׇל־קֹ֣דֶשׁ לֹֽא־תִגָּ֗ע וְאֶל־הַמִּקְדָּשׁ֙ לֹ֣א תָבֹ֔א עַד־מְלֹ֖את יְמֵ֥י טׇהֳרָֽהּ׃
Translated: She shall remain in a state of blood purification for thirty-three days: she shall not touch any consecrated thing, nor enter the sanctuary until her period of purification is completed.
Transliteration: usheloshiym yvom usheloshet yamiym teshev videmey tׇhorahֿ vekhׇl-kodesh lo-tiga veel-hamikedash lo tavo ad-melot yemey tׇhorah

Hebrew: וְאִם־נְקֵבָ֣ה תֵלֵ֔ד וְטָמְאָ֥ה שְׁבֻעַ֖יִם כְּנִדָּתָ֑הּ וְשִׁשִּׁ֥ים יוֹם֙ וְשֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים תֵּשֵׁ֖ב עַל־דְּמֵ֥י טׇהֳרָֽהֿ׃
Translated: If she bears a female, she shall be impure two weeks as during her menstruation, and she shall remain in a state of blood purification for sixty-six days.
Transliteration: veim-nekevah teled vetameah shevuayiim khenidatah veshishiym yvom vesheshet yamiym teshev al-demey tׇhorahֿ

Hebrew: וּבִמְלֹ֣את ׀ יְמֵ֣י טׇהֳרָ֗הּ לְבֵן֮ א֣וֹ לְבַת֒ תָּבִ֞יא כֶּ֤בֶשׂ בֶּן־שְׁנָתוֹ֙ לְעֹלָ֔ה וּבֶן־יוֹנָ֥ה אוֹ־תֹ֖ר לְחַטָּ֑את אֶל־פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: On the completion of her period of purification, for either son or daughter, she shall bring to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, a lamb in its first year for a burnt offering, and a pigeon or a turtledove for a sin offering.
Transliteration: uvimelot yemey tׇhorah leven vo levat taviy khevesh ven-shenatvo leolah uven-yvonah vo-tor lechatat el-fetach ohel-mvoed el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִיב֞וֹ לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ וְכִפֶּ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ וְטָהֲרָ֖הֿ מִמְּקֹ֣ר דָּמֶ֑יהָ זֹ֤את תּוֹרַת֙ הַיֹּלֶ֔דֶת לַזָּכָ֖ר א֥וֹ לַנְּקֵבָֽה׃
Translated: He shall offer it before יהוה and make expiation on her behalf; she shall then be pure from her flow of blood. Such are the rituals concerning her who bears a child, male or female.
Transliteration: vehikeriyvvo lifeney yehovah vekhifer aleyha vetaharahֿ mimekor dameyha zot tvorat hayoledet lazakhar vo lanekevah

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תִמְצָ֣א יָדָהּ֮ דֵּ֣י שֶׂה֒ וְלָקְחָ֣ה שְׁתֵּֽי־תֹרִ֗ים א֤וֹ שְׁנֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֔ה אֶחָ֥ד לְעֹלָ֖ה וְאֶחָ֣ד לְחַטָּ֑את וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלֶ֛יהָ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְטָהֵֽרָה׃ {פ}
Translated: If, however, her means do not suffice for a sheep, she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons, one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering. The priest shall make expiation on her behalf, and she shall be pure.
Transliteration: veim-lo timetsa yadah dey sheh velakechah shetey-toriym vo sheney veney yvonah echad leolah veechad lechatat vekhifer aleyha hakhohen vetaherah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: אָדָ֗ם כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֤ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרוֹ֙ שְׂאֵ֤ת אֽוֹ־סַפַּ֙חַת֙ א֣וֹ בַהֶ֔רֶת וְהָיָ֥ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ לְנֶ֣גַע צָרָ֑עַת וְהוּבָא֙ אֶל־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן א֛וֹ אֶל־אַחַ֥ד מִבָּנָ֖יו הַכֹּהֲנִֽים׃
Translated: When a person has on the skin of the body a swelling, a rash, or a discoloration, and it develops into a scaly affection on the skin of the body, it shall be reported to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons, the priests.
Transliteration: adam khiy-yiheyeh vevor-vesharvo sheet vo-safachat vo vaheret vehayah vevor-vesharvo lenega tsaraat vehuva el-aharon hakhohen vo el-achad mivanayv hakhohaniym

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֣ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֣גַע בְּעֽוֹר־הַ֠בָּשָׂ֠ר וְשֵׂעָ֨ר בַּנֶּ֜גַע הָפַ֣ךְ ׀ לָבָ֗ן וּמַרְאֵ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ עָמֹק֙ מֵע֣וֹר בְּשָׂר֔וֹ נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת ה֑וּא וְרָאָ֥הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְטִמֵּ֥א אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The priest shall examine the affection on the skin of the body: if hair in the affected patch has turned white and the affection appears to be deeper than the skin of the body, it is a leprous affection; when the priest sees it, he shall pronounce the person impure.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen et-hanega vevor-havashar veshear vanega hafakhe lavan umareeh hanega amok mevor vesharvo nega tsaraat hu veraahu hakhohen vetime otvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־בַּהֶ֩רֶת֩ לְבָנָ֨ה הִ֜וא בְּע֣וֹר בְּשָׂר֗וֹ וְעָמֹק֙ אֵין־מַרְאֶ֣הָ מִן־הָע֔וֹר וּשְׂעָרָ֖הֿ לֹא־הָפַ֣ךְ לָבָ֑ן וְהִסְגִּ֧יר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֖גַע שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: But if it is a white discoloration on the skin of the body which does not appear to be deeper than the skin and the hair in it has not turned white, the priest shall isolate the affected person for seven days.
Transliteration: veim-vaheret levanah hiv vevor vesharvo veamok eyn-mareeha min-havor ushearahֿ lo-hafakhe lavan vehisegiyr hakhohen et-hanega shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣הוּ הַכֹּהֵן֮ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֒ וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ עָמַ֣ד בְּעֵינָ֔יו לֹֽא־פָשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בָּע֑וֹר וְהִסְגִּיר֧וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֛ן שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים שֵׁנִֽית׃
Translated: On the seventh day the priest shall conduct an examination, and if the affection has remained unchanged in color and the disease has not spread on the skin, the priest shall isolate that person for another seven days.
Transliteration: veraahu hakhohen vayyvom hasheviyiy vehineh hanega amad veeynayv lo-fashah hanega vavor vehisegiyrvo hakhohen shiveat yamiym sheniyt

Hebrew: וְרָאָה֩ הַכֹּהֵ֨ן אֹת֜וֹ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֮ שֵׁנִית֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ כֵּהָ֣ה הַנֶּ֔גַע וְלֹא־פָשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בָּע֑וֹר וְטִהֲר֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ מִסְפַּ֣חַת הִ֔וא וְכִבֶּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: On the seventh day the priest shall again conduct an examination: if the affection has faded and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce the person pure. It is a rash; after washing those clothes, that person shall be pure.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen otvo vayyvom hasheviyiy sheniyt vehineh khehah hanega velo-fashah hanega vavor vetiharvo hakhohen misefachat hiv vekhives vegadayv vetaher

Hebrew: וְאִם־פָּשֹׂ֨ה תִפְשֶׂ֤ה הַמִּסְפַּ֙חַת֙ בָּע֔וֹר אַחֲרֵ֧י הֵרָאֹת֛וֹ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לְטׇהֳרָת֑וֹ וְנִרְאָ֥ה שֵׁנִ֖ית אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: But if the rash should spread on the skin after the person has been seen by the priest and pronounced pure, that person shall again report to the priest.
Transliteration: veim-fashoh tifesheh hamisefachat vavor acharey heraotvo el-hakhohen letׇhoratvo venireah sheniyt el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְרָאָה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשְׂתָ֥ה הַמִּסְפַּ֖חַת בָּע֑וֹר וְטִמְּא֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן צָרַ֥עַת הִֽוא׃ {פ}
Translated: And if the priest sees that the rash has spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce that person impure; it is leprosy.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen vehineh fashetah hamisefachat vavor vetimevo hakhohen tsaraat hiv {f}

Hebrew: נֶ֣גַע צָרַ֔עַת כִּ֥י תִהְיֶ֖ה בְּאָדָ֑ם וְהוּבָ֖א אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: When a person has a scaly affection, it shall be reported to the priest.
Transliteration: nega tsaraat khiy tiheyeh veadam vehuva el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה שְׂאֵת־לְבָנָה֙ בָּע֔וֹר וְהִ֕יא הָפְכָ֖ה שֵׂעָ֣ר לָבָ֑ן וּמִֽחְיַ֛ת בָּשָׂ֥ר חַ֖י בַּשְׂאֵֽת׃
Translated: If the priest finds on the skin a white swelling which has turned some hair white, with a patch of undiscolored flesh in the swelling,
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen vehineh sheet-levanah vavor vehiy hafekhah shear lavan umicheyat vashar chay vasheet

Hebrew: צָרַ֨עַת נוֹשֶׁ֤נֶת הִוא֙ בְּע֣וֹר בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וְטִמְּא֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן לֹ֣א יַסְגִּרֶ֔נּוּ כִּ֥י טָמֵ֖א הֽוּא׃
Translated: it is chronic leprosy on the skin of the body, and the priest shall pronounce the person impure; being impure, that person need not be isolated.
Transliteration: tsaraat nvoshenet hiv vevor vesharvo vetimevo hakhohen lo yasegirenu khiy tame hu

Hebrew: וְאִם־פָּר֨וֹחַ תִּפְרַ֤ח הַצָּרַ֙עַת֙ בָּע֔וֹר וְכִסְּתָ֣ה הַצָּרַ֗עַת אֵ֚ת כׇּל־ע֣וֹר הַנֶּ֔גַע מֵרֹאשׁ֖וֹ וְעַד־רַגְלָ֑יו לְכׇל־מַרְאֵ֖ה עֵינֵ֥י הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: If the eruption spreads out over the skin so that it covers all the skin of the affected person from head to foot, wherever the priest can see—
Transliteration: veim-farvocha tiferach hatsaraat vavor vekhisetah hatsaraat et khׇl-vor hanega meroshvo vead-ragelayv lekhׇl-mareeh eyney hakhohen

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֨ה כִסְּתָ֤ה הַצָּרַ֙עַת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־בְּשָׂר֔וֹ וְטִהַ֖ר אֶת־הַנָּ֑גַע כֻּלּ֛וֹ הָפַ֥ךְ לָבָ֖ן טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃
Translated: if the priest sees that the eruption has covered the whole body—he shall pronounce as pure the affected person, who is pure from having turned all white.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen vehineh khisetah hatsaraat et-khׇl-vesharvo vetihar et-hanaga khulvo hafakhe lavan tahvor hu

Hebrew: וּבְי֨וֹם הֵרָא֥וֹת בּ֛וֹ בָּשָׂ֥ר חַ֖י יִטְמָֽא׃
Translated: But as soon as undiscolored flesh appears in it, that person shall be impure;
Transliteration: uveyvom heravot vvo vashar chay yitema

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֧ה הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַבָּשָׂ֥ר הַחַ֖י וְטִמְּא֑וֹ הַבָּשָׂ֥ר הַחַ֛י טָמֵ֥א ה֖וּא צָרַ֥עַת הֽוּא׃
Translated: when the priest sees the undiscolored flesh, he shall pronounce the person impure. The undiscolored flesh is impure; it is leprosy.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen et-havashar hachay vetimevo havashar hachay tame hu tsaraat hu

Hebrew: א֣וֹ כִ֥י יָשׁ֛וּב הַבָּשָׂ֥ר הַחַ֖י וְנֶהְפַּ֣ךְ לְלָבָ֑ן וּבָ֖א אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: But if the undiscolored flesh again turns white, that person shall come to the priest,
Transliteration: vo khiy yashuv havashar hachay venehefakhe lelavan uva el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֙הוּ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ הַנֶּ֖גַע לְלָבָ֑ן וְטִהַ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֖גַע טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: and the priest shall conduct an examination: if the affection has turned white, the priest shall pronounce as pure the affected person, who is then pure.
Transliteration: veraahu hakhohen vehineh nehefakhe hanega lelavan vetihar hakhohen et-hanega tahvor hu {f}

Hebrew: וּבָשָׂ֕ר כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה בֽוֹ־בְעֹר֖וֹ שְׁחִ֑ין וְנִרְפָּֽא׃
Translated: When an inflammation appears on the skin of one’s body and it heals,
Transliteration: uvashar khiy-yiheyeh vvo-veorvo shechiyn venirefa

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה בִּמְק֤וֹם הַשְּׁחִין֙ שְׂאֵ֣ת לְבָנָ֔ה א֥וֹ בַהֶ֖רֶת לְבָנָ֣ה אֲדַמְדָּ֑מֶת וְנִרְאָ֖ה אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: and a white swelling or a white discoloration streaked with red develops where the inflammation was, that person shall report to the priest.
Transliteration: vehayah vimekvom hashechiyn sheet levanah vo vaheret levanah adamedamet venireah el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה מַרְאֶ֙הָ֙ שָׁפָ֣ל מִן־הָע֔וֹר וּשְׂעָרָ֖הּ הָפַ֣ךְ לָבָ֑ן וְטִמְּא֧וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֛ן נֶֽגַע־צָרַ֥עַת הִ֖וא בַּשְּׁחִ֥ין פָּרָֽחָה׃
Translated: If the priest finds that it appears lower than the rest of the skin and that the hair in it has turned white, the priest shall pronounce the person impure; it is a leprous affection that has broken out in the inflammation.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen vehineh mareeha shafal min-havor ushearah hafakhe lavan vetimevo hakhohen nega-tsaraat hiv vashechiyn farachah

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ יִרְאֶ֣נָּה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵֽין־בָּהּ֙ שֵׂעָ֣ר לָבָ֔ן וּשְׁפָלָ֥הֿ אֵינֶ֛נָּה מִן־הָע֖וֹר וְהִ֣יא כֵהָ֑ה וְהִסְגִּיר֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in it and it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate that person for seven days.
Transliteration: veim yireenah hakhohen vehineh eyn-vah shear lavan ushefalahֿ eynenah min-havor vehiy khehah vehisegiyrvo hakhohen shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְאִם־פָּשֹׂ֥ה תִפְשֶׂ֖ה בָּע֑וֹר וְטִמֵּ֧א הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֹת֖וֹ נֶ֥גַע הִֽוא׃
Translated: If it should spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce the person impure; it is an affection.
Transliteration: veim-fashoh tifesheh vavor vetime hakhohen otvo nega hiv

Hebrew: וְאִם־תַּחְתֶּ֜יהָ תַּעֲמֹ֤ד הַבַּהֶ֙רֶת֙ לֹ֣א פָשָׂ֔תָה צָרֶ֥בֶת הַשְּׁחִ֖ין הִ֑וא וְטִהֲר֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: But if the discoloration remains stationary, not having spread, it is the scar of the inflammation; the priest shall pronounce that person pure.
Transliteration: veim-tacheteyha taamod havaheret lo fashatah tsarevet hashechiyn hiv vetiharvo hakhohen {s}

Hebrew: א֣וֹ בָשָׂ֔ר כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְעֹר֖וֹ מִכְוַת־אֵ֑שׁ וְֽהָיְתָ֞ה מִֽחְיַ֣ת הַמִּכְוָ֗ה בַּהֶ֛רֶת לְבָנָ֥ה אֲדַמְדֶּ֖מֶת א֥וֹ לְבָנָֽה׃
Translated: When the skin of one’s body sustains a burn by fire, and the patch from the burn is a discoloration, either white streaked with red, or white,
Transliteration: vo vashar khiy-yiheyeh veorvo mikhevat-esh vehayetah micheyat hamikhevah vaheret levanah adamedemet vo levanah

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה אֹתָ֣הּ הַכֹּהֵ֡ן וְהִנֵּ֣ה נֶהְפַּךְ֩ שֵׂעָ֨ר לָבָ֜ן בַּבַּהֶ֗רֶת וּמַרְאֶ֙הָ֙ עָמֹ֣ק מִן־הָע֔וֹר צָרַ֣עַת הִ֔וא בַּמִּכְוָ֖ה פָּרָ֑חָה וְטִמֵּ֤א אֹתוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת הִֽוא׃
Translated: the priest shall examine it. If some hair has turned white in the discoloration, which itself appears to go deeper than the skin, it is leprosy that has broken out in the burn. The priest shall pronounce the person impure; it is a leprous affection.
Transliteration: veraah otah hakhohen vehineh nehefakhe shear lavan vavaheret umareeha amok min-havor tsaraat hiv vamikhevah farachah vetime otvo hakhohen nega tsaraat hiv

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ יִרְאֶ֣נָּה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵֽין־בַּבַּהֶ֙רֶת֙ שֵׂעָ֣ר לָבָ֔ן וּשְׁפָלָ֥הֿ אֵינֶ֛נָּה מִן־הָע֖וֹר וְהִ֣וא כֵהָ֑ה וְהִסְגִּיר֥וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: But if the priest finds that there is no white hair in the discoloration, and that it is not lower than the rest of the skin, and it is faded, the priest shall isolate that person for seven days.
Transliteration: veim yireenah hakhohen vehineh eyn-vavaheret shear lavan ushefalahֿ eynenah min-havor vehiv khehah vehisegiyrvo hakhohen shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֥הוּ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י אִם־פָּשֹׂ֤ה תִפְשֶׂה֙ בָּע֔וֹר וְטִמֵּ֤א הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֹת֔וֹ נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת הִֽוא׃
Translated: On the seventh day the priest shall conduct an examination: if it has spread in the skin, the priest shall pronounce the person impure; it is a leprous affection.
Transliteration: veraahu hakhohen vayyvom hasheviyiy im-fashoh tifesheh vavor vetime hakhohen otvo nega tsaraat hiv

Hebrew: וְאִם־תַּחְתֶּ֩יהָ֩ תַעֲמֹ֨ד הַבַּהֶ֜רֶת לֹא־פָשְׂתָ֤ה בָעוֹר֙ וְהִ֣וא כֵהָ֔ה שְׂאֵ֥ת הַמִּכְוָ֖ה הִ֑וא וְטִֽהֲרוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן כִּֽי־צָרֶ֥בֶת הַמִּכְוָ֖ה הִֽוא׃ {פ}
Translated: But if the discoloration has remained stationary, not having spread on the skin, and it is faded, it is the swelling from the burn. The priest shall pronounce that person pure, for it is the scar of the burn.
Transliteration: veim-tacheteyha taamod havaheret lo-fashetah vavor vehiv khehah sheet hamikhevah hiv vetiharvo hakhohen khiy-tsarevet hamikhevah hiv {f}

Hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ א֣וֹ אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ נָ֑גַע בְּרֹ֖אשׁ א֥וֹ בְזָקָֽן׃
Translated: If a man or a woman has an affection on the head or in the beard,
Transliteration: veiysh vo ishah khiy-yiheyeh vvo naga verosh vo vezakan

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֗גַע וְהִנֵּ֤ה מַרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ עָמֹ֣ק מִן־הָע֔וֹר וּב֛וֹ שֵׂעָ֥ר צָהֹ֖ב דָּ֑ק וְטִמֵּ֨א אֹת֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ נֶ֣תֶק ה֔וּא צָרַ֧עַת הָרֹ֛אשׁ א֥וֹ הַזָּקָ֖ן הֽוּא׃
Translated: the priest shall examine the affection. If it appears to go deeper than the skin and there is thin yellow hair in it, the priest shall pronounce the person impure; it is a scall, a scaly eruption in the hair or beard.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen et-hanega vehineh mareehu amok min-havor uvvo shear tsahov dak vetime otvo hakhohen netek hu tsaraat harosh vo hazakan hu

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִרְאֶ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־נֶ֣גַע הַנֶּ֗תֶק וְהִנֵּ֤ה אֵין־מַרְאֵ֙הוּ֙ עָמֹ֣ק מִן־הָע֔וֹר וְשֵׂעָ֥ר שָׁחֹ֖ר אֵ֣ין בּ֑וֹ וְהִסְגִּ֧יר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־נֶ֥גַע הַנֶּ֖תֶק שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: But if the priest finds that the scall affection does not appear to go deeper than the skin, yet there is no black hair in it, the priest shall isolate the person with the scall affection for seven days.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yireeh hakhohen et-nega hanetek vehineh eyn-mareehu amok min-havor veshear shachor eyn vvo vehisegiyr hakhohen et-nega hanetek shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֣ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֘גַע֮ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ לֹא־פָשָׂ֣ה הַנֶּ֔תֶק וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה ב֖וֹ שֵׂעָ֣ר צָהֹ֑ב וּמַרְאֵ֣ה הַנֶּ֔תֶק אֵ֥ין עָמֹ֖ק מִן־הָעֽוֹר׃
Translated: On the seventh day the priest shall examine the affection. If the scall has not spread and no yellow hair has appeared in it, and the scall does not appear to go deeper than the skin,
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen et-hanega vayyvom hasheviyiy vehineh lo-fashah hanetek velo-hayah vvo shear tsahov umareeh hanetek eyn amok min-havor

Hebrew: וְהִ֨תְ<big>גַּ</big>לָּ֔ח וְאֶת־הַנֶּ֖תֶק לֹ֣א יְגַלֵּ֑חַ וְהִסְגִּ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֧ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֛תֶק שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים שֵׁנִֽית׃
Translated: the person with the scall shall shave—but without shaving the scall; the priest shall isolate that person for another seven days.
Transliteration: vehite<big>ga</big>lach veet-hanetek lo yegalecha vehisegiyr hakhohen et-hanetek shiveat yamiym sheniyt

Hebrew: וְרָאָה֩ הַכֹּהֵ֨ן אֶת־הַנֶּ֜תֶק בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י וְ֠הִנֵּ֠ה לֹא־פָשָׂ֤ה הַנֶּ֙תֶק֙ בָּע֔וֹר וּמַרְאֵ֕הוּ אֵינֶ֥נּוּ עָמֹ֖ק מִן־הָע֑וֹר וְטִהַ֤ר אֹתוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְכִבֶּ֥ס בְּגָדָ֖יו וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: On the seventh day the priest shall examine the scall. If the scall has not spread on the skin, and does not appear to go deeper than the skin, the priest shall pronounce the person pure; after washing those clothes, that person shall be pure.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen et-hanetek vayyvom hasheviyiy vehineh lo-fashah hanetek vavor umareehu eynenu amok min-havor vetihar otvo hakhohen vekhives vegadayv vetaher

Hebrew: וְאִם־פָּשֹׂ֥ה יִפְשֶׂ֛ה הַנֶּ֖תֶק בָּע֑וֹר אַחֲרֵ֖י טׇהֳרָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: If, however, the scall should spread on the skin after the person has been pronounced pure,
Transliteration: veim-fashoh yifesheh hanetek vavor acharey tׇhoratvo

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֙הוּ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖תֶק בָּע֑וֹר לֹֽא־יְבַקֵּ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן לַשֵּׂעָ֥ר הַצָּהֹ֖ב טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
Translated: the priest shall conduct an examination. If the scall has spread on the skin, the priest need not look for yellow hair: the person is impure.
Transliteration: veraahu hakhohen vehineh fashah hanetek vavor lo-yevaker hakhohen lashear hatsahov tame hu

Hebrew: וְאִם־בְּעֵינָיו֩ עָמַ֨ד הַנֶּ֜תֶק וְשֵׂעָ֨ר שָׁחֹ֧ר צָֽמַח־בּ֛וֹ נִרְפָּ֥א הַנֶּ֖תֶק טָה֣וֹר ה֑וּא וְטִהֲר֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: But if the scall has remained unchanged in color, and black hair has grown in it, the scall is healed; the person is pure. The priest shall pronounce that person pure.
Transliteration: veim-veeynayv amad hanetek veshear shachor tsamach-vvo nirefa hanetek tahvor hu vetiharvo hakhohen {s}

Hebrew: וְאִישׁ֙ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֔ה כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרָ֖ם בֶּהָרֹ֑ת בֶּהָרֹ֖ת לְבָנֹֽת׃
Translated: If a man or a woman has the skin of the body streaked with white discolorations,
Transliteration: veiysh vo-ishah khiy-yiheyeh vevor-vesharam veharot veharot levanot

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֧ה בְעוֹר־בְּשָׂרָ֛ם בֶּהָרֹ֖ת כֵּה֣וֹת לְבָנֹ֑ת בֹּ֥הַק ה֛וּא פָּרַ֥ח בָּע֖וֹר טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃ {ס}
Translated: and the priest sees that the discolorations on the skin of the body are of a dull white, it is a tetter broken out on the skin; that person is pure.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen vehineh vevor-vesharam veharot khehvot levanot vohak hu farach vavor tahvor hu {s}

Hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּ֥י יִמָּרֵ֖ט רֹאשׁ֑וֹ קֵרֵ֥חַ ה֖וּא טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃
Translated: If a man loses the hair of his head and becomes bald, he is pure.
Transliteration: veiysh khiy yimaret roshvo kerecha hu tahvor hu

Hebrew: וְאִם֙ מִפְּאַ֣ת פָּנָ֔יו יִמָּרֵ֖ט רֹאשׁ֑וֹ גִּבֵּ֥חַ ה֖וּא טָה֥וֹר הֽוּא׃
Translated: If he loses the hair on the front part of his head and becomes bald at the forehead, he is pure.
Transliteration: veim mifeat fanayv yimaret roshvo givecha hu tahvor hu

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִהְיֶ֤ה בַקָּרַ֙חַת֙ א֣וֹ בַגַּבַּ֔חַת נֶ֖גַע לָבָ֣ן אֲדַמְדָּ֑ם צָרַ֤עַת פֹּרַ֙חַת֙ הִ֔וא בְּקָרַחְתּ֖וֹ א֥וֹ בְגַבַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But if a white affection streaked with red appears on the bald part in the front or at the back of the head, it is a scaly eruption that is spreading over the bald part in the front or at the back of the head.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yiheyeh vakarachat vo vagavachat nega lavan adamedam tsaraat forachat hiv vekarachetvo vo vegavachetvo

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה אֹת֜וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְהִנֵּ֤ה שְׂאֵת־הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ לְבָנָ֣ה אֲדַמְדֶּ֔מֶת בְּקָרַחְתּ֖וֹ א֣וֹ בְגַבַּחְתּ֑וֹ כְּמַרְאֵ֥ה צָרַ֖עַת ע֥וֹר בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated: The priest shall examine him: if the swollen affection on the bald part in the front or at the back of his head is white streaked with red, like the leprosy of body skin in appearance,
Transliteration: veraah otvo hakhohen vehineh sheet-hanega levanah adamedemet vekarachetvo vo vegavachetvo khemareeh tsaraat vor vashar

Hebrew: אִישׁ־צָר֥וּעַ ה֖וּא טָמֵ֣א ה֑וּא טַמֵּ֧א יְטַמְּאֶ֛נּוּ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בְּרֹאשׁ֥וֹ נִגְעֽוֹ׃
Translated: he is a leprous man; he is impure. The priest shall pronounce him impure; he has the affection on his head.
Transliteration: iysh-tsarua hu tame hu tame yetameenu hakhohen veroshvo nigevo

Hebrew: וְהַצָּר֜וּעַ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֣וֹ הַנֶּ֗גַע בְּגָדָ֞יו יִהְי֤וּ פְרֻמִים֙ וְרֹאשׁוֹ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה פָר֔וּעַ וְעַל־שָׂפָ֖ם יַעְטֶ֑ה וְטָמֵ֥א <small>׀</small> טָמֵ֖א יִקְרָֽא׃
Translated: As for the person with a leprous affection: the clothes shall be rent, the head shall be left bare, and the upper lip shall be covered over; and that person shall call out, “Impure! Impure!”
Transliteration: vehatsarua asher-vvo hanega vegadayv yiheyu ferumiym veroshvo yiheyeh farua veal-shafam yaeteh vetame <small></small> tame yikera

Hebrew: כׇּל־יְמֵ֞י אֲשֶׁ֨ר הַנֶּ֥גַע בּ֛וֹ יִטְמָ֖א טָמֵ֣א ה֑וּא בָּדָ֣ד יֵשֵׁ֔ב מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה מוֹשָׁבֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: The person shall be impure as long as the disease is present. Being impure, that person shall dwell apart—in a dwelling outside the camp.
Transliteration: khׇl-yemey asher hanega vvo yitema tame hu vadad eishev michuts lamachaneh mvoshavvo {s}

Hebrew: וְהַבֶּ֕גֶד כִּֽי־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ נֶ֣גַע צָרָ֑עַת בְּבֶ֣גֶד צֶ֔מֶר א֖וֹ בְּבֶ֥גֶד פִּשְׁתִּֽים׃
Translated: When an eruptive affection occurs in a cloth of wool or linen fabric,
Transliteration: vehaveged khiy-yiheyeh vvo nega tsaraat veveged tsemer vo veveged fishetiym

Hebrew: א֤וֹ בִֽשְׁתִי֙ א֣וֹ בְעֵ֔רֶב לַפִּשְׁתִּ֖ים וְלַצָּ֑מֶר א֣וֹ בְע֔וֹר א֖וֹ בְּכׇל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֽוֹר׃
Translated: in the warp or in the woof of the linen or the wool, or in a skin or in anything made of skin;
Transliteration: vo vishetiy vo veerev lafishetiym velatsamer vo vevor vo vekhׇl-melekhet vor

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הַנֶּ֜גַע יְרַקְרַ֣ק ׀ א֣וֹ אֲדַמְדָּ֗ם בַּבֶּ֩גֶד֩ א֨וֹ בָע֜וֹר אֽוֹ־בַשְּׁתִ֤י אוֹ־בָעֵ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בְכׇל־כְּלִי־ע֔וֹר נֶ֥גַע צָרַ֖עַת ה֑וּא וְהׇרְאָ֖ה אֶת־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: if the affection in the cloth or the skin, in the warp or the woof, or in any article of skin, is streaky green or red, it is an eruptive affection. It shall be shown to the priest;
Transliteration: vehayah hanega yerakerak vo adamedam vaveged vo vavor vo-vashetiy vo-vaerev vo vekhׇl-kheliy-vor nega tsaraat hu vehׇreah et-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֥ה הַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֶת־הַנָּ֑גַע וְהִסְגִּ֥יר אֶת־הַנֶּ֖גַע שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: and the priest, after examining the affection, shall isolate the affected article for seven days.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen et-hanaga vehisegiyr et-hanega shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה אֶת־הַנֶּ֜גַע בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י כִּֽי־פָשָׂ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ בַּ֠בֶּ֠גֶד אֽוֹ־בַשְּׁתִ֤י אֽוֹ־בָעֵ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בָע֔וֹר לְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יֵעָשֶׂ֥ה הָע֖וֹר לִמְלָאכָ֑ה צָרַ֧עַת מַמְאֶ֛רֶת הַנֶּ֖גַע טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
Translated: On the seventh day he shall examine the affection: if the affection has spread in the cloth—whether in the warp or the woof, or in the skin, for whatever purpose the skin may be used—the affection is a malignant eruption; it is impure.
Transliteration: veraah et-hanega vayyvom hasheviyiy khiy-fashah hanega vaveged vo-vashetiy vo-vaerev vo vavor lekhol asher-eiasheh havor limelakhah tsaraat mameeret hanega tame hu

Hebrew: וְשָׂרַ֨ף אֶת־הַבֶּ֜גֶד א֥וֹ אֶֽת־הַשְּׁתִ֣י ׀ א֣וֹ אֶת־הָעֵ֗רֶב בַּצֶּ֙מֶר֙ א֣וֹ בַפִּשְׁתִּ֔ים א֚וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־כְּלִ֣י הָע֔וֹר אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ הַנָּ֑גַע כִּֽי־צָרַ֤עַת מַמְאֶ֙רֶת֙ הִ֔וא בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשָּׂרֵֽף׃
Translated: The cloth—whether warp or woof in wool or linen, or any article of skin—in which the affection is found, shall be burned, for it is a malignant eruption; it shall be consumed in fire.
Transliteration: vesharaf et-haveged vo et-hashetiy vo et-haerev vatsemer vo vafishetiym vo et-khׇl-kheliy havor asher-yiheyeh vvo hanaga khiy-tsaraat mameeret hiv vaesh tisharef

Hebrew: וְאִם֮ יִרְאֶ֣ה הַכֹּהֵן֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ לֹא־פָשָׂ֣ה הַנֶּ֔גַע בַּבֶּ֕גֶד א֥וֹ בַשְּׁתִ֖י א֣וֹ בָעֵ֑רֶב א֖וֹ בְּכׇל־כְּלִי־עֽוֹר׃
Translated: But if the priest sees that the affection in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof, or in any article of skin—has not spread,
Transliteration: veim yireeh hakhohen vehineh lo-fashah hanega vaveged vo vashetiy vo vaerev vo vekhׇl-kheliy-vor

Hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְכִ֨בְּס֔וּ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ הַנָּ֑גַע וְהִסְגִּיר֥וֹ שִׁבְעַת־יָמִ֖ים שֵׁנִֽית׃
Translated: the priest shall order the affected article washed, and he shall isolate it for another seven days.
Transliteration: vetsivah hakhohen vekhivesu et asher-vvo hanaga vehisegiyrvo shiveat-yamiym sheniyt

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אַחֲרֵ֣י ׀ הֻכַּבֵּ֣ס אֶת־הַנֶּ֗גַע וְ֠הִנֵּ֠ה לֹֽא־הָפַ֨ךְ הַנֶּ֤גַע אֶת־עֵינוֹ֙ וְהַנֶּ֣גַע לֹֽא־פָשָׂ֔ה טָמֵ֣א ה֔וּא בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשְׂרְפֶ֑נּוּ פְּחֶ֣תֶת הִ֔וא בְּקָרַחְתּ֖וֹ א֥וֹ בְגַבַּחְתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And if, after the affected article has been washed, the priest sees that the affection has not changed color and that it has not spread, it is impure. It shall be consumed in fire; it is a fret, whether on its inner side or on its outer side.
Transliteration: veraah hakhohen acharey hukhaves et-hanega vehineh lo-hafakhe hanega et-eynvo vehanega lo-fashah tame hu vaesh tisherefenu fechetet hiv vekarachetvo vo vegavachetvo

Hebrew: וְאִם֮ רָאָ֣ה הַכֹּהֵן֒ וְהִנֵּה֙ כֵּהָ֣ה הַנֶּ֔גַע אַחֲרֵ֖י הֻכַּבֵּ֣ס אֹת֑וֹ וְקָרַ֣ע אֹת֗וֹ מִן־הַבֶּ֙גֶד֙ א֣וֹ מִן־הָע֔וֹר א֥וֹ מִן־הַשְּׁתִ֖י א֥וֹ מִן־הָעֵֽרֶב׃
Translated: But if the priest sees that the affected part, after it has been washed, is faded, he shall tear it out from the cloth or skin, whether in the warp or in the woof;
Transliteration: veim raah hakhohen vehineh khehah hanega acharey hukhaves otvo vekara otvo min-haveged vo min-havor vo min-hashetiy vo min-haerev

Hebrew: וְאִם־תֵּרָאֶ֨ה ע֜וֹד בַּ֠בֶּ֠גֶד אֽוֹ־בַשְּׁתִ֤י אֽוֹ־בָעֵ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בְכׇל־כְּלִי־ע֔וֹר פֹּרַ֖חַת הִ֑וא בָּאֵ֣שׁ תִּשְׂרְפֶ֔נּוּ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ הַנָּֽגַע׃
Translated: and if it occurs again in the cloth—whether in warp or in woof—or in any article of skin, it is a wild growth; the affected article shall be consumed in fire.
Transliteration: veim-teraeh vod vaveged vo-vashetiy vo-vaerev vo vekhׇl-kheliy-vor forachat hiv vaesh tisherefenu et asher-vvo hanaga

Hebrew: וְהַבֶּ֡גֶד אֽוֹ־הַשְּׁתִ֨י אוֹ־הָעֵ֜רֶב אֽוֹ־כׇל־כְּלִ֤י הָעוֹר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תְּכַבֵּ֔ס וְסָ֥ר מֵהֶ֖ם הַנָּ֑גַע וְכֻבַּ֥ס שֵׁנִ֖ית וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: If, however, the affection disappears from the cloth—warp or woof—or from any article of skin that has been washed, it shall be washed again, and it shall be pure.
Transliteration: vehaveged vo-hashetiy vo-haerev vo-khׇl-kheliy havor asher tekhaves vesar mehem hanaga vekhuvas sheniyt vetaher

Hebrew: זֹ֠את תּוֹרַ֨ת נֶֽגַע־צָרַ֜עַת בֶּ֥גֶד הַצֶּ֣מֶר ׀ א֣וֹ הַפִּשְׁתִּ֗ים א֤וֹ הַשְּׁתִי֙ א֣וֹ הָעֵ֔רֶב א֖וֹ כׇּל־כְּלִי־ע֑וֹר לְטַהֲר֖וֹ א֥וֹ לְטַמְּאֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Such is the procedure for eruptive affections of cloth, woolen or linen, in warp or in woof, or of any article of skin, for pronouncing it pure or impure.
Transliteration: zot tvorat nega-tsaraat veged hatsemer vo hafishetiym vo hashetiy vo haerev vo khׇl-kheliy-vor letaharvo vo letamevo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: זֹ֤את תִּֽהְיֶה֙ תּוֹרַ֣ת הַמְּצֹרָ֔ע בְּי֖וֹם טׇהֳרָת֑וֹ וְהוּבָ֖א אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: This shall be the ritual for a leper at the time of being purified. When it has been reported to the priest,
Transliteration: zot tiheyeh tvorat hametsora veyvom tׇhoratvo vehuva el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְיָצָא֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְרָאָה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִנֵּ֛ה נִרְפָּ֥א נֶֽגַע־הַצָּרַ֖עַת מִן־הַצָּרֽוּעַ׃
Translated: the priest shall go outside the camp. If the priest sees that the leper has been healed of the scaly affection,
Transliteration: veyatsa hakhohen el-michuts lamachaneh veraah hakhohen vehineh nirefa nega-hatsaraat min-hatsarua

Hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלָקַ֧ח לַמִּטַּהֵ֛ר שְׁתֵּֽי־צִפֳּרִ֥ים חַיּ֖וֹת טְהֹר֑וֹת וְעֵ֣ץ אֶ֔רֶז וּשְׁנִ֥י תוֹלַ֖עַת וְאֵזֹֽב׃
Translated: the priest shall order two live pure birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop to be brought for the one to be purified.
Transliteration: vetsivah hakhohen velakach lamitaher shetey-tsiforiym chayyvot tehorvot veets erez usheniy tvolaat veezov

Hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְשָׁחַ֖ט אֶת־הַצִּפּ֣וֹר הָאֶחָ֑ת אֶל־כְּלִי־חֶ֖רֶשׂ עַל־מַ֥יִם חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: The priest shall order one of the birds slaughtered over fresh water in an earthen vessel;
Transliteration: vetsivah hakhohen veshachat et-hatsifvor haechat el-kheliy-cheresh al-mayiim chayiym

Hebrew: אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֤ר הַֽחַיָּה֙ יִקַּ֣ח אֹתָ֔הּ וְאֶת־עֵ֥ץ הָאֶ֛רֶז וְאֶת־שְׁנִ֥י הַתּוֹלַ֖עַת וְאֶת־הָאֵזֹ֑ב וְטָבַ֨ל אוֹתָ֜ם וְאֵ֣ת ׀ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַֽחַיָּ֗ה בְּדַם֙ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַשְּׁחֻטָ֔ה עַ֖ל הַמַּ֥יִם הַֽחַיִּֽים׃
Translated: and he shall take the live bird, along with the cedar wood, the crimson stuff, and the hyssop, and dip them together with the live bird in the blood of the bird that was slaughtered over the fresh water.
Transliteration: et-hatsifor hachayah yikach otah veet-ets haerez veet-sheniy hatvolaat veet-haezov vetaval votam veet hatsifor hachayah vedam hatsifor hashechutah al hamayiim hachayiym

Hebrew: וְהִזָּ֗ה עַ֧ל הַמִּטַּהֵ֛ר מִן־הַצָּרַ֖עַת שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וְטִ֣הֲר֔וֹ וְשִׁלַּ֛ח אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֥ר הַֽחַיָּ֖ה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַשָּׂדֶֽה׃
Translated: He shall then sprinkle it seven times on the one to be purified of the eruption and effect the purification; and he shall set the live bird free in the open country.
Transliteration: vehizah al hamitaher min-hatsaraat sheva feamiym vetiharvo veshilach et-hatsifor hachayah al-feney hashadeh

Hebrew: וְכִבֶּס֩ הַמִּטַּהֵ֨ר אֶת־בְּגָדָ֜יו וְגִלַּ֣ח אֶת־כׇּל־שְׂעָר֗וֹ וְרָחַ֤ץ בַּמַּ֙יִם֙ וְטָהֵ֔ר וְאַחַ֖ר יָב֣וֹא אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְיָשַׁ֛ב מִח֥וּץ לְאׇהֳל֖וֹ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: The one to be purified shall wash those clothes, shave off all hair, and bathe in water—and then shall be pure. After that, the camp may be entered but one must remain outside one’s tent seven days.
Transliteration: vekhives hamitaher et-vegadayv vegilach et-khׇl-shearvo verachats vamayiim vetaher veachar yavvo el-hamachaneh veyashav michuts leׇholvo shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י יְגַלַּ֣ח אֶת־כׇּל־שְׂעָר֗וֹ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֤וֹ וְאֶת־זְקָנוֹ֙ וְאֵת֙ גַּבֹּ֣ת עֵינָ֔יו וְאֶת־כׇּל־שְׂעָר֖וֹ יְגַלֵּ֑חַ וְכִבֶּ֣ס אֶת־בְּגָדָ֗יו וְרָחַ֧ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֛וֹ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: On the seventh day all hair shall be shaved off—of head, beard [if any], and eyebrows. Having shaved off all hair, the person shall wash those clothes and bathe the body in water—and then shall be pure.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hasheviyiy yegalach et-khׇl-shearvo et-roshvo veet-zekanvo veet gavot eynayv veet-khׇl-shearvo yegalecha vekhives et-vegadayv verachats et-vesharvo vamayiim vetaher

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י יִקַּ֤ח שְׁנֵֽי־כְבָשִׂים֙ תְּמִימִ֔ם וְכַבְשָׂ֥ה אַחַ֛ת בַּת־שְׁנָתָ֖הּ תְּמִימָ֑ה וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן וְלֹ֥ג אֶחָ֖ד שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: On the eighth day that person shall take two male lambs without blemish, one ewe lamb in its first year without blemish, three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and one log of oil.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hashemiyniy yikach sheney-khevashiym temiymim vekhaveshah achat vat-shenatah temiymah usheloshah esheroniym solet minechah velulah vashemen velog echad shamen

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱמִ֞יד הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַֽמְטַהֵ֗ר אֵ֛ת הָאִ֥ישׁ הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר וְאֹתָ֑ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: These shall be presented before יהוה, with the party to be purified, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, by the priest who performs the purification.
Transliteration: veheemiyd hakhohen hametaher et haiysh hamitaher veotam lifeney yehovah fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֗ד וְהִקְרִ֥יב אֹת֛וֹ לְאָשָׁ֖ם וְאֶת־לֹ֣ג הַשָּׁ֑מֶן וְהֵנִ֥יף אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priest shall take one of the male lambs and offer it with the log of oil as a guilt offering, and he shall elevate them as an elevation offering before יהוה.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen et-hakhevesh haechad vehikeriyv otvo leasham veet-log hashamen veheniyf otam tenufah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֣ט אֶת־הַכֶּ֗בֶשׂ בִּ֠מְק֠וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁחַ֧ט אֶת־הַֽחַטָּ֛את וְאֶת־הָעֹלָ֖ה בִּמְק֣וֹם הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כִּ֡י כַּ֠חַטָּ֠את הָאָשָׁ֥ם הוּא֙ לַכֹּהֵ֔ן קֹ֥דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֖ים הֽוּא׃
Translated: The lamb shall be slaughtered at the spot in the sacred area where the sin offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered. For the guilt offering, like the sin offering, goes to the priest; it is most holy.
Transliteration: veshachat et-hakhevesh vimekvom asher yishechat et-hachatat veet-haolah vimekvom hakodesh khiy khachatat haasham hu lakhohen kodesh kׇdashiym hu

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח הַכֹּהֵן֮ מִדַּ֣ם הָאָשָׁם֒ וְנָתַן֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן עַל־תְּנ֛וּךְ אֹ֥זֶן הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִֽית׃
Translated: The priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering, and the priest shall put it on the ridge of the right ear of the one who is being purified, and on the thumb of the right hand, and on the big toe of the right foot.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen midam haasham venatan hakhohen al-tenukhe ozen hamitaher hayemaniyt veal-vohen yadvo hayemaniyt veal-vohen ragelvo hayemaniyt

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֥ח הַכֹּהֵ֖ן מִלֹּ֣ג הַשָּׁ֑מֶן וְיָצַ֛ק עַל־כַּ֥ף הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַשְּׂמָאלִֽית׃
Translated: The priest shall then take some of the log of oil and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen milog hashamen veyatsak al-khaf hakhohen hashemaliyt

Hebrew: וְטָבַ֤ל הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־אֶצְבָּע֣וֹ הַיְמָנִ֔ית מִן־הַשֶּׁ֕מֶן אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־כַּפּ֖וֹ הַשְּׂמָאלִ֑ית וְהִזָּ֨ה מִן־הַשֶּׁ֧מֶן בְּאֶצְבָּע֛וֹ שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And the priest shall dip his right finger in the oil that is in the palm of his left hand and sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before יהוה.
Transliteration: vetaval hakhohen et-etsevavo hayemaniyt min-hashemen asher al-khafvo hashemaliyt vehizah min-hashemen veetsevavo sheva feamiym lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וּמִיֶּ֨תֶר הַשֶּׁ֜מֶן אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כַּפּ֗וֹ יִתֵּ֤ן הַכֹּהֵן֙ עַל־תְּנ֞וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן הַמִּטַּהֵר֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִ֑ית עַ֖ל דַּ֥ם הָאָשָֽׁם׃
Translated: Some of the oil left in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being purified, on the thumb of the right hand, and on the big toe of the right foot—over the blood of the guilt offering.
Transliteration: umiyeter hashemen asher al-khafvo yiten hakhohen al-tenukhe ozen hamitaher hayemaniyt veal-vohen yadvo hayemaniyt veal-vohen ragelvo hayemaniyt al dam haasham

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֗ר בַּשֶּׁ֙מֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַכֹּהֵ֔ן יִתֵּ֖ן עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַמִּטַּהֵ֑ר וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
