Translated: The rest of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being purified. Thus the priest shall make expiation for that person before יהוה.
Transliteration: vehanvotar vashemen asher al-khaf hakhohen yiten al-rosh hamitaher vekhifer alayv hakhohen lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הַ֣חַטָּ֔את וְכִפֶּ֕ר עַל־הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר מִטֻּמְאָת֑וֹ וְאַחַ֖ר יִשְׁחַ֥ט אֶת־הָעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: The priest shall then offer the sin offering and make expiation for the one being purified of defilement. Last, the burnt offering shall be slaughtered,
Transliteration: veashah hakhohen et-hachatat vekhifer al-hamitaher mitumeatvo veachar yishechat et-haolah

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱלָ֧ה הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הָעֹלָ֥ה וְאֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֖ה הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְכִפֶּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְטָהֵֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: and the priest shall offer the burnt offering and the meal offering on the altar; the priest shall make expiation for that person, who shall then be pure.
Transliteration: veheelah hakhohen et-haolah veet-haminechah hamizevechah vekhifer alayv hakhohen vetaher {s}

Hebrew: וְאִם־דַּ֣ל ה֗וּא וְאֵ֣ין יָדוֹ֮ מַשֶּׂ֒גֶת֒ וְ֠לָקַ֠ח כֶּ֣בֶשׂ אֶחָ֥ד אָשָׁ֛ם לִתְנוּפָ֖ה לְכַפֵּ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וְעִשָּׂר֨וֹן סֹ֜לֶת אֶחָ֨ד בָּל֥וּל בַּשֶּׁ֛מֶן לְמִנְחָ֖ה וְלֹ֥ג שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: If, however, one is poor and without sufficient means, that person shall take one male lamb for a guilt offering, to be elevated in expiation, one-tenth of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in for a meal offering, and a log of oil;
Transliteration: veim-dal hu veeyn yadvo masheget velakach khevesh echad asham litenufah lekhafer alayv veisharvon solet echad valul vashemen leminechah velog shamen

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֗ים א֤וֹ שְׁנֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּשִּׂ֖יג יָד֑וֹ וְהָיָ֤ה אֶחָד֙ חַטָּ֔את וְהָאֶחָ֖ד עֹלָֽה׃
Translated: and two turtledoves or two pigeons—depending on that person’s means—the one to be the sin offering and the other the burnt offering.
Transliteration: ushetey toriym vo sheney veney yvonah asher tashiyg yadvo vehayah echad chatat vehaechad olah

Hebrew: וְהֵבִ֨יא אֹתָ֜ם בַּיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֛י לְטׇהֳרָת֖וֹ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֑ן אֶל־פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: On the eighth day of purification, the person shall bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, before יהוה.
Transliteration: veheviy otam vayyvom hashemiyniy letׇhoratvo el-hakhohen el-fetach ohel-mvoed lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֧ח הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־כֶּ֥בֶשׂ הָאָשָׁ֖ם וְאֶת־לֹ֣ג הַשָּׁ֑מֶן וְהֵנִ֨יף אֹתָ֧ם הַכֹּהֵ֛ן תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priest shall take the lamb of guilt offering and the log of oil, and elevate them as an elevation offering before יהוה.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen et-khevesh haasham veet-log hashamen veheniyf otam hakhohen tenufah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַט֮ אֶת־כֶּ֣בֶשׂ הָֽאָשָׁם֒ וְלָקַ֤ח הַכֹּהֵן֙ מִדַּ֣ם הָֽאָשָׁ֔ם וְנָתַ֛ן עַל־תְּנ֥וּךְ אֹֽזֶן־הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר הַיְמָנִ֑ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִֽית׃
Translated: When the lamb of guilt offering has been slaughtered, the priest shall take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the ridge of the right ear of the one being purified, on the thumb of the right hand, and on the big toe of the right foot.
Transliteration: veshachat et-khevesh haasham velakach hakhohen midam haasham venatan al-tenukhe ozen-hamitaher hayemaniyt veal-vohen yadvo hayemaniyt veal-vohen ragelvo hayemaniyt

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַשֶּׁ֖מֶן יִצֹ֣ק הַכֹּהֵ֑ן עַל־כַּ֥ף הַכֹּהֵ֖ן הַשְּׂמָאלִֽית׃
Translated: The priest shall then pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand,
Transliteration: umin-hashemen yitsok hakhohen al-khaf hakhohen hashemaliyt

Hebrew: וְהִזָּ֤ה הַכֹּהֵן֙ בְּאֶצְבָּע֣וֹ הַיְמָנִ֔ית מִן־הַשֶּׁ֕מֶן אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־כַּפּ֖וֹ הַשְּׂמָאלִ֑ית שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and with the finger of his right hand the priest shall sprinkle some of the oil that is in the palm of his left hand seven times before יהוה.
Transliteration: vehizah hakhohen veetsevavo hayemaniyt min-hashemen asher al-khafvo hashemaliyt sheva feamiym lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִן־הַשֶּׁ֣מֶן ׀ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־כַּפּ֗וֹ עַל־תְּנ֞וּךְ אֹ֤זֶן הַמִּטַּהֵר֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֤הֶן יָדוֹ֙ הַיְמָנִ֔ית וְעַל־בֹּ֥הֶן רַגְל֖וֹ הַיְמָנִ֑ית עַל־מְק֖וֹם דַּ֥ם הָאָשָֽׁם׃
Translated: Some of the oil in his palm shall be put by the priest on the ridge of the right ear of the one being purified, on the thumb of the right hand, and on the big toe of the right foot, over the same places as the blood of the guilt offering;
Transliteration: venatan hakhohen min-hashemen asher al-khafvo al-tenukhe ozen hamitaher hayemaniyt veal-vohen yadvo hayemaniyt veal-vohen ragelvo hayemaniyt al-mekvom dam haasham

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתָ֗ר מִן־הַשֶּׁ֙מֶן֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־כַּ֣ף הַכֹּהֵ֔ן יִתֵּ֖ן עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַמִּטַּהֵ֑ר לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָ֖יו לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and what is left of the oil in his palm the priest shall put on the head of the one being purified, to make expiation for that person before יהוה.
Transliteration: vehanvotar min-hashemen asher al-khaf hakhohen yiten al-rosh hamitaher lekhafer alayv lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־הָֽאֶחָד֙ מִן־הַתֹּרִ֔ים א֖וֹ מִן־בְּנֵ֣י הַיּוֹנָ֑ה מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּשִּׂ֖יג יָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: That person shall then offer one of the turtledoves or pigeons, depending on the person’s means—
Transliteration: veashah et-haechad min-hatoriym vo min-veney hayyvonah measher tashiyg yadvo

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר־תַּשִּׂ֞יג יָד֗וֹ אֶת־הָאֶחָ֥ד חַטָּ֛את וְאֶת־הָאֶחָ֥ד עֹלָ֖ה עַל־הַמִּנְחָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן עַ֥ל הַמִּטַּהֵ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: whichever that person can afford—the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, together with the meal offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation before יהוה for the one being purified.
Transliteration: et asher-tashiyg yadvo et-haechad chatat veet-haechad olah al-haminechah vekhifer hakhohen al hamitaher lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: זֹ֣את תּוֹרַ֔ת אֲשֶׁר־בּ֖וֹ נֶ֣גַע צָרָ֑עַת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹֽא־תַשִּׂ֥יג יָד֖וֹ בְּטׇהֳרָתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Such is the ritual for one who has a scaly affection and whose means for purification are limited.
Transliteration: zot tvorat asher-vvo nega tsaraat asher lo-tashiyg yadvo vetׇhoratvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תָבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם לַאֲחֻזָּ֑ה וְנָתַתִּי֙ נֶ֣גַע צָרַ֔עַת בְּבֵ֖ית אֶ֥רֶץ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: When you enter the land of Canaan that I give you as a possession, and I inflict an eruptive plague upon a house in the land you possess,
Transliteration: khiy tavou el-erets khenaan asher aniy noten lakhem laachuzah venatatiy nega tsaraat veveyt erets achuzatekhem

Hebrew: וּבָא֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֣וֹ הַבַּ֔יִת וְהִגִּ֥יד לַכֹּהֵ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּנֶ֕גַע נִרְאָ֥ה לִ֖י בַּבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: the owner of the house shall come and tell the priest, saying, “Something like a plague has appeared upon my house.”
Transliteration: uva asher-lvo havayiit vehigiyd lakhohen lemor khenega nireah liy vavayiit

Hebrew: וְצִוָּ֨ה הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וּפִנּ֣וּ אֶת־הַבַּ֗יִת בְּטֶ֨רֶם יָבֹ֤א הַכֹּהֵן֙ לִרְא֣וֹת אֶת־הַנֶּ֔גַע וְלֹ֥א יִטְמָ֖א כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּבָּ֑יִת וְאַ֥חַר כֵּ֛ן יָבֹ֥א הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לִרְא֥וֹת אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: The priest shall order the house cleared before the priest enters to examine the plague, so that nothing in the house may become impure; after that the priest shall enter to examine the house.
Transliteration: vetsivah hakhohen ufinu et-havayiit veterem yavo hakhohen lirevot et-hanega velo yitema khׇl-asher vavayiit veachar khen yavo hakhohen lirevot et-havayiit

Hebrew: וְרָאָ֣ה אֶת־הַנֶּ֗גַע וְהִנֵּ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ בְּקִירֹ֣ת הַבַּ֔יִת שְׁקַֽעֲרוּרֹת֙ יְרַקְרַקֹּ֔ת א֖וֹ אֲדַמְדַּמֹּ֑ת וּמַרְאֵיהֶ֥ן שָׁפָ֖ל מִן־הַקִּֽיר׃
Translated: If, when he examines the plague, the plague in the walls of the house is found to consist of greenish or reddish streaks that appear to go deep into the wall,
Transliteration: veraah et-hanega vehineh hanega vekiyrot havayiit shekaarurot yerakerakot vo adamedamot umareeyhen shafal min-hakiyr

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֧א הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מִן־הַבַּ֖יִת אֶל־פֶּ֣תַח הַבָּ֑יִת וְהִסְגִּ֥יר אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: the priest shall come out of the house to the entrance of the house, and close up the house for seven days.
Transliteration: veyatsa hakhohen min-havayiit el-fetach havayiit vehisegiyr et-havayiit shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֥ב הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י וְרָאָ֕ה וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בְּקִירֹ֥ת הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: On the seventh day the priest shall return. If he sees that the plague has spread on the walls of the house,
Transliteration: veshav hakhohen vayyvom hasheviyiy veraah vehineh fashah hanega vekiyrot havayiit

Hebrew: וְצִוָּה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְחִלְּצוּ֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֲבָנִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּהֵ֖ן הַנָּ֑גַע וְהִשְׁלִ֤יכוּ אֶתְהֶן֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֔יר אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָמֵֽא׃
Translated: the priest shall order the stones with the plague in them to be pulled out and cast outside the city into an impure place.
Transliteration: vetsivah hakhohen vechiletsu et-haavaniym asher vahen hanaga vehisheliykhu etehen el-michuts laiyr el-makvom tame

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַבַּ֛יִת יַקְצִ֥עַ מִבַּ֖יִת סָבִ֑יב וְשָׁפְכ֗וּ אֶת־הֶֽעָפָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִקְצ֔וּ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֔יר אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָמֵֽא׃
Translated: The house shall be scraped inside all around, and the coating that is scraped off shall be dumped outside the city in an impure place.
Transliteration: veet-havayiit yaketsia mivayiit saviyv veshafekhu et-heafar asher hiketsu el-michuts laiyr el-makvom tame

Hebrew: וְלָקְחוּ֙ אֲבָנִ֣ים אֲחֵר֔וֹת וְהֵבִ֖יאוּ אֶל־תַּ֣חַת הָאֲבָנִ֑ים וְעָפָ֥ר אַחֵ֛ר יִקַּ֖ח וְטָ֥ח אֶת־הַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: They shall take other stones and replace those stones with them, and take other coating and plaster the house.
Transliteration: velakechu avaniym achervot veheviyu el-tachat haavaniym veafar acher yikach vetach et-havayiit

Hebrew: וְאִם־יָשׁ֤וּב הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ וּפָרַ֣ח בַּבַּ֔יִת אַחַ֖ר חִלֵּ֣ץ אֶת־הָאֲבָנִ֑ים וְאַחֲרֵ֛י הִקְצ֥וֹת אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת וְאַחֲרֵ֥י הִטּֽוֹחַ׃
Translated: If the plague again breaks out in the house, after the stones have been pulled out and after the house has been scraped and replastered,
Transliteration: veim-yashuv hanega ufarach vavayiit achar chilets et-haavaniym veacharey hiketsvot et-havayiit veacharey hitvocha

Hebrew: וּבָא֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְרָאָ֕ה וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּשָׂ֥ה הַנֶּ֖גַע בַּבָּ֑יִת צָרַ֨עַת מַמְאֶ֥רֶת הִ֛וא בַּבַּ֖יִת טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
Translated: the priest shall come to examine: if the plague has spread in the house, it is a malignant eruption in the house; it is impure.
Transliteration: uva hakhohen veraah vehineh fashah hanega vavayiit tsaraat mameeret hiv vavayiit tame hu

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֣ץ אֶת־הַבַּ֗יִת אֶת־אֲבָנָיו֙ וְאֶת־עֵצָ֔יו וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־עֲפַ֣ר הַבָּ֑יִת וְהוֹצִיא֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֔יר אֶל־מָק֖וֹם טָמֵֽא׃
Translated: The house shall be torn down—its stones and timber and all the coating on the house—and taken to an impure place outside the city.
Transliteration: venatats et-havayiit et-avanayv veet-etsayv veet khׇl-afar havayiit vehvotsiy el-michuts laiyr el-makvom tame

Hebrew: וְהַבָּא֙ אֶל־הַבַּ֔יִת כׇּל־יְמֵ֖י הִסְגִּ֣יר אֹת֑וֹ יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Whoever enters the house while it is closed up shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: vehava el-havayiit khׇl-yemey hisegiyr otvo yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְהַשֹּׁכֵ֣ב בַּבַּ֔יִת יְכַבֵּ֖ס אֶת־בְּגָדָ֑יו וְהָאֹכֵ֣ל בַּבַּ֔יִת יְכַבֵּ֖ס אֶת־בְּגָדָֽיו׃
Translated: Whoever sleeps in the house must wash those clothes, and whoever eats in the house must wash those clothes.
Transliteration: vehashokhev vavayiit yekhaves et-vegadayv vehaokhel vavayiit yekhaves et-vegadayv

Hebrew: וְאִם־בֹּ֨א יָבֹ֜א הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְרָאָה֙ וְ֠הִנֵּ֠ה לֹא־פָשָׂ֤ה הַנֶּ֙גַע֙ בַּבַּ֔יִת אַחֲרֵ֖י הִטֹּ֣חַ אֶת־הַבָּ֑יִת וְטִהַ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת כִּ֥י נִרְפָּ֖א הַנָּֽגַע׃
Translated: If, however, the priest comes and sees that the plague has not spread in the house after the house was replastered, the priest shall pronounce the house pure, for the plague has healed.
Transliteration: veim-vo yavo hakhohen veraah vehineh lo-fashah hanega vavayiit acharey hitocha et-havayiit vetihar hakhohen et-havayiit khiy nirefa hanaga

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֛ח לְחַטֵּ֥א אֶת־הַבַּ֖יִת שְׁתֵּ֣י צִפֳּרִ֑ים וְעֵ֣ץ אֶ֔רֶז וּשְׁנִ֥י תוֹלַ֖עַת וְאֵזֹֽב׃
Translated: To purge the house, he shall take two birds, cedar wood, crimson stuff, and hyssop.
Transliteration: velakach lechate et-havayiit shetey tsiforiym veets erez usheniy tvolaat veezov

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֖ט אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הָאֶחָ֑ת אֶל־כְּלִי־חֶ֖רֶשׂ עַל־מַ֥יִם חַיִּֽים׃
Translated: He shall slaughter the one bird over fresh water in an earthen vessel.
Transliteration: veshachat et-hatsifor haechat el-kheliy-cheresh al-mayiim chayiym

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח אֶת־עֵֽץ־הָ֠אֶ֠רֶז וְאֶת־הָ֨אֵזֹ֜ב וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁנִ֣י הַתּוֹלַ֗עַת וְאֵת֮ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַֽחַיָּה֒ וְטָבַ֣ל אֹתָ֗ם בְּדַם֙ הַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַשְּׁחוּטָ֔ה וּבַמַּ֖יִם הַֽחַיִּ֑ים וְהִזָּ֥ה אֶל־הַבַּ֖יִת שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִֽים׃
Translated: He shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the crimson stuff, and the live bird, and dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and the fresh water, and sprinkle on the house seven times.
Transliteration: velakach et-ets-haerez veet-haezov veet sheniy hatvolaat veet hatsifor hachayah vetaval otam vedam hatsifor hashechutah uvamayiim hachayiym vehizah el-havayiit sheva feamiym

Hebrew: וְחִטֵּ֣א אֶת־הַבַּ֔יִת בְּדַם֙ הַצִּפּ֔וֹר וּבַמַּ֖יִם הַֽחַיִּ֑ים וּבַצִּפֹּ֣ר הַחַיָּ֗ה וּבְעֵ֥ץ הָאֶ֛רֶז וּבָאֵזֹ֖ב וּבִשְׁנִ֥י הַתּוֹלָֽעַת׃
Translated: Having purged the house with the blood of the bird, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the crimson stuff,
Transliteration: vechite et-havayiit vedam hatsifvor uvamayiim hachayiym uvatsifor hachayah uveets haerez uvaezov uvisheniy hatvolaat

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֞ח אֶת־הַצִּפֹּ֧ר הַֽחַיָּ֛ה אֶל־מִח֥וּץ לָעִ֖יר אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֥ר עַל־הַבַּ֖יִת וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: he shall set the live bird free outside the city in the open country. Thus he shall make expiation for the house, and it shall be pure.
Transliteration: veshilach et-hatsifor hachayah el-michuts laiyr el-feney hashadeh vekhifer al-havayiit vetaher

Hebrew: זֹ֖את הַתּוֹרָ֑ה לְכׇל־נֶ֥גַע הַצָּרַ֖עַת וְלַנָּֽתֶק׃
Translated: Such is the ritual for every eruptive affection—for scalls,
Transliteration: zot hatvorah lekhׇl-nega hatsaraat velanatek

Hebrew: וּלְצָרַ֥עַת הַבֶּ֖גֶד וְלַבָּֽיִת׃
Translated: for an eruption on a cloth or a house,
Transliteration: uletsaraat haveged velavayiit

Hebrew: וְלַשְׂאֵ֥ת וְלַסַּפַּ֖חַת וְלַבֶּהָֽרֶת׃
Translated: for swellings, for rashes, or for discolorations—
Transliteration: velasheet velasafachat velaveharet

Hebrew: לְהוֹרֹ֕ת בְּי֥וֹם הַטָּמֵ֖א וּבְי֣וֹם הַטָּהֹ֑ר זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַצָּרָֽעַת׃ {פ}
Translated: to determine when they are impure and when they are pure. Such is the ritual concerning eruptions.
Transliteration: lehvorot veyvom hatame uveyvom hatahor zot tvorat hatsaraat {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: דַּבְּרוּ֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֣ישׁ אִ֗ישׁ כִּ֤י יִהְיֶה֙ זָ֣ב מִבְּשָׂר֔וֹ זוֹב֖וֹ טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When any man has a discharge issuing from his member, he is impure.
Transliteration: daveru el-veney yisherael vaamaretem alehem iysh iysh khiy yiheyeh zav mivesharvo zvovvo tame hu

Hebrew: וְזֹ֛את תִּהְיֶ֥ה טֻמְאָת֖וֹ בְּזוֹב֑וֹ רָ֣ר בְּשָׂר֞וֹ אֶת־זוֹב֗וֹ אֽוֹ־הֶחְתִּ֤ים בְּשָׂרוֹ֙ מִזּוֹב֔וֹ טֻמְאָת֖וֹ הִֽוא׃
Translated: The impurity from his discharge shall mean the following—whether his member runs with the discharge or is stopped up so that there is no discharge, his impurity means this:
Transliteration: vezot tiheyeh tumeatvo vezvovvo rar vesharvo et-zvovvo vo-hechetiym vesharvo mizvovvo tumeatvo hiv

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכַּ֥ב עָלָ֛יו הַזָּ֖ב יִטְמָ֑א וְכׇֽל־הַכְּלִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־יֵשֵׁ֥ב עָלָ֖יו יִטְמָֽא׃
Translated: Any bedding on which the one with the discharge lies shall be impure, and every object on which he sits shall be impure.
Transliteration: khׇl-hamishekhav asher yishekhav alayv hazav yitema vekhׇl-hakheliy asher-eishev alayv yitema

Hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִגַּ֖ע בְּמִשְׁכָּב֑וֹ יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Those persons who touch his bedding shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yiga vemishekhavvo yekhaves vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְהַיֹּשֵׁב֙ עַֽל־הַכְּלִ֔י אֲשֶׁר־יֵשֵׁ֥ב עָלָ֖יו הַזָּ֑ב יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Those who sit on an object on which the one with the discharge has sat shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vehayoshev al-hakheliy asher-eishev alayv hazav yekhaves vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְהַנֹּגֵ֖עַ בִּבְשַׂ֣ר הַזָּ֑ב יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Those who touch the body of the one with the discharge shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vehanogea viveshar hazav yekhaves vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָרֹ֥ק הַזָּ֖ב בַּטָּה֑וֹר וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: If the one with a discharge spits on someone who is pure, the latter shall wash those clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yarok hazav vatahvor vekhives vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַמֶּרְכָּ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִרְכַּ֥ב עָלָ֛יו הַזָּ֖ב יִטְמָֽא׃
Translated: Any means for riding that the one with a discharge has mounted shall be impure;
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hamerekhav asher yirekhav alayv hazav yitema

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַנֹּגֵ֗עַ בְּכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִהְיֶ֣ה תַחְתָּ֔יו יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְהַנּוֹשֵׂ֣א אוֹתָ֔ם יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: all those who touch anything that was under him shall be impure until evening; and all those who carry such things shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanogea vekhol asher yiheyeh tachetayv yitema ad-haarev vehanvoshe votam yekhaves vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִגַּע־בּוֹ֙ הַזָּ֔ב וְיָדָ֖יו לֹא־שָׁטַ֣ף בַּמָּ֑יִם וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: All those whom the one with a discharge touches, without having rinsed his hands in water, shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhol asher yiga-vvo hazav veyadayv lo-shataf vamayiim vekhives vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וּכְלִי־חֶ֛רֶשׂ אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּע־בּ֥וֹ הַזָּ֖ב יִשָּׁבֵ֑ר וְכׇ֨ל־כְּלִי־עֵ֔ץ יִשָּׁטֵ֖ף בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: An earthen vessel that the one with a discharge touches shall be broken; and any wooden implement shall be rinsed with water.
Transliteration: ukheliy-cheresh asher-yiga-vvo hazav yishaver vekhׇl-kheliy-ets yishatef vamayiim

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יִטְהַ֤ר הַזָּב֙ מִזּוֹב֔וֹ וְסָ֨פַר ל֜וֹ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֛ים לְטׇהֳרָת֖וֹ וְכִבֶּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֑יו וְרָחַ֧ץ בְּשָׂר֛וֹ בְּמַ֥יִם חַיִּ֖ים וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: When the one with a discharge becomes purified of his discharge, he shall count off seven days for his purification, wash those clothes, and bathe his body in fresh water; then he shall be pure.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yitehar hazav mizvovvo vesafar lvo shiveat yamiym letׇhoratvo vekhives vegadayv verachats vesharvo vemayiim chayiym vetaher

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י יִֽקַּֽח־לוֹ֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֔ים א֥וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֑ה וּבָ֣א ׀ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־פֶּ֙תַח֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וּנְתָנָ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and come before יהוה at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting and give them to the priest.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hashemiyniy yikach-lvo shetey toriym vo sheney veney yvonah uva lifeney yehovah el-fetach ohel mvoed unetanam el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה אֹתָם֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶחָ֣ד חַטָּ֔את וְהָאֶחָ֖ד עֹלָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלָ֧יו הַכֹּהֵ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מִזּוֹבֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: The priest shall offer them, the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. Thus the priest shall make expiation on his behalf, for his discharge, before יהוה.
Transliteration: veashah otam hakhohen echad chatat vehaechad olah vekhifer alayv hakhohen lifeney yehovah mizvovvo {s}

Hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּֽי־תֵצֵ֥א מִמֶּ֖נּוּ שִׁכְבַת־זָ֑רַע וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֛יִם אֶת־כׇּל־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: When a man has an emission of semen, he shall bathe his whole body in water and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-tetse mimenu shikhevat-zara verachats vamayiim et-khׇl-vesharvo vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכׇל־בֶּ֣גֶד וְכׇל־ע֔וֹר אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֥ה עָלָ֖יו שִׁכְבַת־זָ֑רַע וְכֻבַּ֥ס בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: All cloth or leather on which semen falls shall be washed in water and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-veged vekhׇl-vor asher-yiheyeh alayv shikhevat-zara vekhuvas vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֕ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכַּ֥ב אִ֛ישׁ אֹתָ֖הּ שִׁכְבַת־זָ֑רַע וְרָחֲצ֣וּ בַמַּ֔יִם וְטָמְא֖וּ עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃ {פ}
Translated: Likewise for a woman: when a man has carnal relations with her, both shall bathe in water and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: veishah asher yishekhav iysh otah shikhevat-zara verachatsu vamayiim vetameu ad-haarev {f}

Hebrew: וְאִשָּׁה֙ כִּֽי־תִהְיֶ֣ה זָבָ֔ה דָּ֛ם יִהְיֶ֥ה זֹבָ֖הּ בִּבְשָׂרָ֑הּ שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה בְנִדָּתָ֔הּ וְכׇל־הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בָּ֖הּ יִטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: When a woman has a discharge, her discharge being blood from her body, she shall remain in her menstrual separation seven days; whoever touches her shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: veishah khiy-tiheyeh zavah dam yiheyeh zovah vivesharah shiveat yamiym tiheyeh venidatah vekhׇl-hanogea vah yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכֹל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּשְׁכַּ֥ב עָלָ֛יו בְּנִדָּתָ֖הּ יִטְמָ֑א וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־תֵּשֵׁ֥ב עָלָ֖יו יִטְמָֽא׃
Translated: Anything that she lies on during her menstrual separation shall be impure; and anything that she sits on shall be impure.
Transliteration: vekhol asher tishekhav alayv venidatah yitema vekhol asher-teshev alayv yitema

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַנֹּגֵ֖עַ בְּמִשְׁכָּבָ֑הּ יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: All those who touch her bedding shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening;
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanogea vemishekhavah yekhaves vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־הַנֹּגֵ֔עַ בְּכׇל־כְּלִ֖י אֲשֶׁר־תֵּשֵׁ֣ב עָלָ֑יו יְכַבֵּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: and all those who touch any object on which she has sat shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanogea vekhׇl-kheliy asher-teshev alayv yekhaves vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם עַֽל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֜ב ה֗וּא א֧וֹ עַֽל־הַכְּלִ֛י אֲשֶׁר־הִ֥וא יֹשֶֽׁבֶת־עָלָ֖יו בְּנׇגְעוֹ־ב֑וֹ יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Be it the bedding or be it the object on which she has sat, on touching it one shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: veim al-hamishekhav hu vo al-hakheliy asher-hiv yoshevet-alayv venׇgevo-vvo yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְאִ֡ם שָׁכֹב֩ יִשְׁכַּ֨ב אִ֜ישׁ אֹתָ֗הּ וּתְהִ֤י נִדָּתָהּ֙ עָלָ֔יו וְטָמֵ֖א שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וְכׇל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ב אֲשֶׁר־יִשְׁכַּ֥ב עָלָ֖יו יִטְמָֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: And if a man lies with her, her menstrual separation applies to him; he shall be impure seven days, and any bedding on which he lies shall become impure.
Transliteration: veim shakhov yishekhav iysh otah utehiy nidatah alayv vetame shiveat yamiym vekhׇl-hamishekhav asher-yishekhav alayv yitema {s}

Hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֡ה כִּֽי־יָזוּב֩ ז֨וֹב דָּמָ֜הּ יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים בְּלֹא֙ עֶת־נִדָּתָ֔הּ א֥וֹ כִֽי־תָז֖וּב עַל־נִדָּתָ֑הּ כׇּל־יְמֵ֞י ז֣וֹב טֻמְאָתָ֗הּ כִּימֵ֧י נִדָּתָ֛הּ תִּהְיֶ֖ה טְמֵאָ֥ה הִֽוא׃
Translated: When a woman has had a discharge of blood for many days, not at the time of her menstrual separation, or when she has a discharge beyond her period of menstrual separation, she shall be impure, as though at the time of her menstrual separation, as long as her discharge lasts.
Transliteration: veishah khiy-yazuv zvov damah yamiym raviym velo et-nidatah vo khiy-tazuv al-nidatah khׇl-yemey zvov tumeatah khiymey nidatah tiheyeh temeah hiv

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֞ב אֲשֶׁר־תִּשְׁכַּ֤ב עָלָיו֙ כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י זוֹבָ֔הּ כְּמִשְׁכַּ֥ב נִדָּתָ֖הּ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑הּ וְכׇֽל־הַכְּלִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּשֵׁ֣ב עָלָ֔יו טָמֵ֣א יִהְיֶ֔ה כְּטֻמְאַ֖ת נִדָּתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Any bedding on which she lies while her discharge lasts shall be for her like bedding during her menstrual separation; and any object on which she sits shall become impure, as it does during her menstrual separation:
Transliteration: khׇl-hamishekhav asher-tishekhav alayv khׇl-yemey zvovah khemishekhav nidatah yiheyeh-lah vekhׇl-hakheliy asher teshev alayv tame yiheyeh khetumeat nidatah

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַנּוֹגֵ֥עַ בָּ֖ם יִטְמָ֑א וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: All those who touch them shall be impure—and shall wash their clothes, bathe in water, and remain impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanvogea vam yitema vekhives vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְאִֽם־טָהֲרָ֖ה מִזּוֹבָ֑הּ וְסָ֥פְרָה לָּ֛הּ שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים וְאַחַ֥ר תִּטְהָֽר׃
Translated: When she becomes purified of her discharge, she shall count off seven days, and after that she shall be pure.
Transliteration: veim-taharah mizvovah vesaferah lah shiveat yamiym veachar titehar

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י תִּֽקַּֽח־לָהּ֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֔ים א֥וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֑ה וְהֵבִיאָ֤ה אוֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons, and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hashemiyniy tikach-lah shetey toriym vo sheney veney yvonah veheviyah votam el-hakhohen el-fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֤ה הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הָאֶחָ֣ד חַטָּ֔את וְאֶת־הָאֶחָ֖ד עֹלָ֑ה וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלֶ֤יהָ הַכֹּהֵן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה מִזּ֖וֹב טֻמְאָתָֽהּ׃
Translated: The priest shall offer the one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering; and the priest shall make expiation on her behalf, for her impure discharge, before יהוה.
Transliteration: veashah hakhohen et-haechad chatat veet-haechad olah vekhifer aleyha hakhohen lifeney yehovah mizvov tumeatah

Hebrew: וְהִזַּרְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִטֻּמְאָתָ֑ם וְלֹ֤א יָמֻ֙תוּ֙ בְּטֻמְאָתָ֔ם בְּטַמְּאָ֥ם אֶת־מִשְׁכָּנִ֖י אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: You shall put the Israelites on guard against their impurity, lest they die through their impurity by defiling My Tabernacle which is among them.
Transliteration: vehizaretem et-veney-yisherael mitumeatam velo yamutu vetumeatam vetameam et-mishekhaniy asher vetvokham

Hebrew: זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַזָּ֑ב וַאֲשֶׁ֨ר תֵּצֵ֥א מִמֶּ֛נּוּ שִׁכְבַת־זֶ֖רַע לְטׇמְאָה־בָֽהּ׃
Translated: Such is the ritual concerning one who has a discharge: concerning him who has an emission of semen and becomes impure thereby;
Transliteration: zot tvorat hazav vaasher tetse mimenu shikhevat-zera letׇmeah-vah

Hebrew: וְהַדָּוָה֙ בְּנִדָּתָ֔הּ וְהַזָּב֙ אֶת־זוֹב֔וֹ לַזָּכָ֖ר וְלַנְּקֵבָ֑ה וּלְאִ֕ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִשְׁכַּ֖ב עִם־טְמֵאָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and concerning her whose condition is that of menstrual separation; and concerning anyone, male or female, who has a discharge; and concerning a man who lies with an impure woman.
Transliteration: vehadavah venidatah vehazav et-zvovvo lazakhar velanekevah uleiysh asher yishekhav im-temeah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אַחֲרֵ֣י מ֔וֹת שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֑ן בְּקׇרְבָתָ֥ם לִפְנֵי־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיָּמֻֽתוּ׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron who died when they drew too close to the presence of יהוה.
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh acharey mvot sheney veney aharon vekׇrevatam lifeney-yehovah vayamutu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־אַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֒יךָ֒ וְאַל־יָבֹ֤א בְכׇל־עֵת֙ אֶל־הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ מִבֵּ֖ית לַפָּרֹ֑כֶת אֶל־פְּנֵ֨י הַכַּפֹּ֜רֶת אֲשֶׁ֤ר עַל־הָאָרֹן֙ וְלֹ֣א יָמ֔וּת כִּ֚י בֶּֽעָנָ֔ן אֵרָאֶ֖ה עַל־הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: Tell your brother Aaron that he is not to come at will into the Shrine behind the curtain, in front of the cover that is upon the ark, lest he die; for I appear in the cloud over the cover.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh daver el-aharon achiykha veal-yavo vekhׇl-et el-hakodesh miveyt lafarokhet el-feney hakhaforet asher al-haaron velo yamut khiy veanan eraeh al-hakhaforet

Hebrew: בְּזֹ֛את יָבֹ֥א אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶל־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ בְּפַ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר לְחַטָּ֖את וְאַ֥יִל לְעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Thus only shall Aaron enter the Shrine: with a bull of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.—
Transliteration: vezot yavo aharon el-hakodesh vefar ven-vakar lechatat veayiil leolah

Hebrew: כְּתֹֽנֶת־בַּ֨ד קֹ֜דֶשׁ יִלְבָּ֗שׁ וּמִֽכְנְסֵי־בַד֮ יִהְי֣וּ עַל־בְּשָׂרוֹ֒ וּבְאַבְנֵ֥ט בַּד֙ יַחְגֹּ֔ר וּבְמִצְנֶ֥פֶת בַּ֖ד יִצְנֹ֑ף בִּגְדֵי־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הֵ֔ם וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֛יִם אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ וּלְבֵשָֽׁם׃
Translated: He shall be dressed in a sacral linen tunic, with linen breeches next to his flesh, and be girt with a linen sash, and he shall wear a linen turban. They are sacral vestments; he shall bathe his body in water and then put them on.—
Transliteration: khetonet-vad kodesh yilevash umikhenesey-vad yiheyu al-vesharvo uveavenet vad yachegor uvemitsenefet vad yitsenof vigedey-kodesh hem verachats vamayiim et-vesharvo ulevesham

Hebrew: וּמֵאֵ֗ת עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יִקַּ֛ח שְׁנֵֽי־שְׂעִירֵ֥י עִזִּ֖ים לְחַטָּ֑את וְאַ֥יִל אֶחָ֖ד לְעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: And from the Israelite community he shall take two he-goats for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
Transliteration: umeet adat veney yisherael yikach sheney-sheiyrey iziym lechatat veayiil echad leolah

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֧יב אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־פַּ֥ר הַחַטָּ֖את אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ וְכִפֶּ֥ר בַּעֲד֖וֹ וּבְעַ֥ד בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Aaron is to offer his own bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and for his household.
Transliteration: vehikeriyv aharon et-far hachatat asher-lvo vekhifer vaadvo uvead veytvo

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֖ח אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י הַשְּׂעִירִ֑ם וְהֶעֱמִ֤יד אֹתָם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: Aaron shall take the two he-goats and let them stand before יהוה at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;
Transliteration: velakach et-sheney hasheiyrim veheemiyd otam lifeney yehovah fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֧ן אַהֲרֹ֛ן עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י הַשְּׂעִירִ֖ם גֹּרָל֑וֹת גּוֹרָ֤ל אֶחָד֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה וְגוֹרָ֥ל אֶחָ֖ד לַעֲזָאזֵֽל׃
Translated: and he shall place lots upon the two goats, one marked for יהוה and the other marked for Azazel.
Transliteration: venatan aharon al-sheney hasheiyrim goralvot gvoral echad layhovah vegvoral echad laazazel

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֤יב אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־הַשָּׂעִ֔יר אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָלָ֥ה עָלָ֛יו הַגּוֹרָ֖ל לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְעָשָׂ֖הוּ חַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: Aaron shall bring forward the goat designated by lot for יהוה, which he is to offer as a sin offering;
Transliteration: vehikeriyv aharon et-hashaiyr asher alah alayv hagvoral layhovah veashahu chatat

Hebrew: וְהַשָּׂעִ֗יר אֲשֶׁר֩ עָלָ֨ה עָלָ֤יו הַגּוֹרָל֙ לַעֲזָאזֵ֔ל יׇֽעֳמַד־חַ֛י לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְכַפֵּ֣ר עָלָ֑יו לְשַׁלַּ֥ח אֹת֛וֹ לַעֲזָאזֵ֖ל הַמִּדְבָּֽרָה׃
Translated: while the goat designated by lot for Azazel shall be left standing alive before יהוה, to make expiation with it and to send it off to the wilderness for Azazel.
Transliteration: vehashaiyr asher alah alayv hagvoral laazazel yׇomad-chay lifeney yehovah lekhafer alayv leshalach otvo laazazel hamidevarah

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֨יב אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־פַּ֤ר הַֽחַטָּאת֙ אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וְכִפֶּ֥ר בַּֽעֲד֖וֹ וּבְעַ֣ד בֵּית֑וֹ וְשָׁחַ֛ט אֶת־פַּ֥ר הַֽחַטָּ֖את אֲשֶׁר־לֽוֹ׃
Translated: Aaron shall then offer his bull of sin offering, to make expiation for himself and his household. He shall slaughter his bull of sin offering,
Transliteration: vehikeriyv aharon et-far hachatat asher-lvo vekhifer vaadvo uvead veytvo veshachat et-far hachatat asher-lvo

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח מְלֹֽא־הַ֠מַּחְתָּ֠ה גַּֽחֲלֵי־אֵ֞שׁ מֵעַ֤ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וּמְלֹ֣א חׇפְנָ֔יו קְטֹ֥רֶת סַמִּ֖ים דַּקָּ֑ה וְהֵבִ֖יא מִבֵּ֥ית לַפָּרֹֽכֶת׃
Translated: and he shall take a panful of glowing coals scooped from the altar before יהוה, and two handfuls of finely ground aromatic incense, and bring this behind the curtain.
Transliteration: velakach melo-hamachetah gachaley-esh meal hamizevecha milifeney yehovah umelo chׇfenayv ketoret samiym dakah veheviy miveyt lafarokhet

Hebrew: וְנָתַ֧ן אֶֽת־הַקְּטֹ֛רֶת עַל־הָאֵ֖שׁ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכִסָּ֣ה ׀ עֲנַ֣ן הַקְּטֹ֗רֶת אֶת־הַכַּפֹּ֛רֶת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־הָעֵד֖וּת וְלֹ֥א יָמֽוּת׃
Translated: He shall put the incense on the fire before יהוה, so that the cloud from the incense screens the cover that is over [the Ark of] the Pact, lest he die.
Transliteration: venatan et-haketoret al-haesh lifeney yehovah vekhisah anan haketoret et-hakhaforet asher al-haedut velo yamut

Hebrew: וְלָקַח֙ מִדַּ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְהִזָּ֧ה בְאֶצְבָּע֛וֹ עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַכַּפֹּ֖רֶת קֵ֑דְמָה וְלִפְנֵ֣י הַכַּפֹּ֗רֶת יַזֶּ֧ה שֶֽׁבַע־פְּעָמִ֛ים מִן־הַדָּ֖ם בְּאֶצְבָּעֽוֹ׃
Translated: He shall take some of the blood of the bull and sprinkle it with his finger over the cover on the east side; and in front of the cover he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.
Transliteration: velakach midam hafar vehizah veetsevavo al-feney hakhaforet kedemah velifeney hakhaforet yazeh sheva-feamiym min-hadam veetsevavo

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֞ט אֶת־שְׂעִ֤יר הַֽחַטָּאת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָעָ֔ם וְהֵבִיא֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ אֶל־מִבֵּ֖ית לַפָּרֹ֑כֶת וְעָשָׂ֣ה אֶת־דָּמ֗וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר עָשָׂה֙ לְדַ֣ם הַפָּ֔ר וְהִזָּ֥ה אֹת֛וֹ עַל־הַכַּפֹּ֖רֶת וְלִפְנֵ֥י הַכַּפֹּֽרֶת׃
Translated: He shall then slaughter the people’s goat of sin offering, bring its blood behind the curtain, and do with its blood as he has done with the blood of the bull: he shall sprinkle it over the cover and in front of the cover.
Transliteration: veshachat et-sheiyr hachatat asher laam veheviy et-damvo el-miveyt lafarokhet veashah et-damvo khaasher ashah ledam hafar vehizah otvo al-hakhaforet velifeney hakhaforet

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֣ר עַל־הַקֹּ֗דֶשׁ מִטֻּמְאֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִפִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֖ם לְכׇל־חַטֹּאתָ֑ם וְכֵ֤ן יַעֲשֶׂה֙ לְאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד הַשֹּׁכֵ֣ן אִתָּ֔ם בְּת֖וֹךְ טֻמְאֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Thus he shall purge the Shrine of the impurity and transgression of the Israelites, whatever their sins; and he shall do the same for the Tent of Meeting, which abides with them in the midst of their impurity.
Transliteration: vekhifer al-hakodesh mitumeot veney yisherael umifisheeyhem lekhׇl-chatotam vekhen yaasheh leohel mvoed hashokhen itam vetvokhe tumeotam

Hebrew: וְכׇל־אָדָ֞ם לֹא־יִהְיֶ֣ה ׀ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד בְּבֹא֛וֹ לְכַפֵּ֥ר בַּקֹּ֖דֶשׁ עַד־צֵאת֑וֹ וְכִפֶּ֤ר בַּעֲדוֹ֙ וּבְעַ֣ד בֵּית֔וֹ וּבְעַ֖ד כׇּל־קְהַ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: When he goes in to make expiation in the Shrine, nobody else shall be in the Tent of Meeting until he comes out. When he has made expiation for himself and his household, and for the whole congregation of Israel,
Transliteration: vekhׇl-adam lo-yiheyeh veohel mvoed vevovo lekhafer vakodesh ad-tsetvo vekhifer vaadvo uvead veytvo uvead khׇl-kehal yisherael

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֗א אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִפְנֵֽי־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְכִפֶּ֣ר עָלָ֑יו וְלָקַ֞ח מִדַּ֤ם הַפָּר֙ וּמִדַּ֣ם הַשָּׂעִ֔יר וְנָתַ֛ן עַל־קַרְנ֥וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: he shall go out to the altar that is before יהוה and purge it: he shall take some of the blood of the bull and of the goat and apply it to each of the horns of the altar;
Transliteration: veyatsa el-hamizevecha asher lifeney-yehovah vekhifer alayv velakach midam hafar umidam hashaiyr venatan al-karenvot hamizevecha saviyv

Hebrew: וְהִזָּ֨ה עָלָ֧יו מִן־הַדָּ֛ם בְּאֶצְבָּע֖וֹ שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וְטִהֲר֣וֹ וְקִדְּשׁ֔וֹ מִטֻּמְאֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and the rest of the blood he shall sprinkle on it with his finger seven times. Thus he shall purify it of the defilement of the Israelites and consecrate it.
Transliteration: vehizah alayv min-hadam veetsevavo sheva feamiym vetiharvo vekideshvo mitumeot veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְכִלָּה֙ מִכַּפֵּ֣ר אֶת־הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֶת־אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְהִקְרִ֖יב אֶת־הַשָּׂעִ֥יר הֶחָֽי׃
Translated: When he has finished purging the Shrine, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, the live goat shall be brought forward.
Transliteration: vekhilah mikhafer et-hakodesh veet-ohel mvoed veet-hamizevecha vehikeriyv et-hashaiyr hechay

Hebrew: וְסָמַ֨ךְ אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־שְׁתֵּ֣י יָדָ֗ו עַ֣ל רֹ֣אשׁ הַשָּׂעִיר֮ הַחַי֒ וְהִתְוַדָּ֣ה עָלָ֗יו אֶת־כׇּל־עֲוֺנֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־כׇּל־פִּשְׁעֵיהֶ֖ם לְכׇל־חַטֹּאתָ֑ם וְנָתַ֤ן אֹתָם֙ עַל־רֹ֣אשׁ הַשָּׂעִ֔יר וְשִׁלַּ֛ח בְּיַד־אִ֥ישׁ עִתִּ֖י הַמִּדְבָּֽרָה׃
Translated: Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat and confess over it all the iniquities and transgressions of the Israelites, whatever their sins, putting them on the head of the goat; and it shall be sent off to the wilderness through a designated agent.
Transliteration: vesamakhe aharon et-shetey yadav al rosh hashaiyr hachay vehitevadah alayv et-khׇl-avonot veney yisherael veet-khׇl-fisheeyhem lekhׇl-chatotam venatan otam al-rosh hashaiyr veshilach veyad-iysh itiy hamidevarah

Hebrew: וְנָשָׂ֨א הַשָּׂעִ֥יר עָלָ֛יו אֶת־כׇּל־עֲוֺנֹתָ֖ם אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ גְּזֵרָ֑ה וְשִׁלַּ֥ח אֶת־הַשָּׂעִ֖יר בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Thus the goat shall carry on it all their iniquities to an inaccessible region; and the goat shall be set free in the wilderness.
Transliteration: venasha hashaiyr alayv et-khׇl-avonotam el-erets gezerah veshilach et-hashaiyr vamidevar

Hebrew: וּבָ֤א אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וּפָשַׁט֙ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֣י הַבָּ֔ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָבַ֖שׁ בְּבֹא֣וֹ אֶל־הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וְהִנִּיחָ֖ם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: And Aaron shall go into the Tent of Meeting, take off the linen vestments that he put on when he entered the Shrine, and leave them there.
Transliteration: uva aharon el-ohel mvoed ufashat et-vigedey havad asher lavash vevovo el-hakodesh vehiniycham sham

Hebrew: וְרָחַ֨ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֤וֹ בַמַּ֙יִם֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָד֔וֹשׁ וְלָבַ֖שׁ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֑יו וְיָצָ֗א וְעָשָׂ֤ה אֶת־עֹֽלָתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־עֹלַ֣ת הָעָ֔ם וְכִפֶּ֥ר בַּעֲד֖וֹ וּבְעַ֥ד הָעָֽם׃
Translated: He shall bathe his body in water in the holy precinct and put on his vestments; then he shall come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, making expiation for himself and for the people.
Transliteration: verachats et-vesharvo vamayiim vemakvom kadvosh velavash et-vegadayv veyatsa veashah et-olatvo veet-olat haam vekhifer vaadvo uvead haam

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛ת חֵ֥לֶב הַֽחַטָּ֖את יַקְטִ֥יר הַמִּזְבֵּֽחָה׃
Translated: The fat of the sin offering he shall turn into smoke on the altar.
Transliteration: veet chelev hachatat yaketiyr hamizevechah

Hebrew: וְהַֽמְשַׁלֵּ֤חַ אֶת־הַשָּׂעִיר֙ לַֽעֲזָאזֵ֔ל יְכַבֵּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֔יו וְרָחַ֥ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יָב֥וֹא אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: The one who set the Azazel-goat free shall wash those clothes and bathe the body in water—and after that may reenter the camp.
Transliteration: vehameshalecha et-hashaiyr laazazel yekhaves vegadayv verachats et-vesharvo vamayiim veacharey-khen yavvo el-hamachaneh

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ פַּ֨ר הַֽחַטָּ֜את וְאֵ֣ת ׀ שְׂעִ֣יר הַֽחַטָּ֗את אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוּבָ֤א אֶת־דָּמָם֙ לְכַפֵּ֣ר בַּקֹּ֔דֶשׁ יוֹצִ֖יא אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְשָׂרְפ֣וּ בָאֵ֔שׁ אֶת־עֹרֹתָ֥ם וְאֶת־בְּשָׂרָ֖ם וְאֶת־פִּרְשָֽׁם׃
Translated: The bull of sin offering and the goat of sin offering whose blood was brought in to purge the Shrine shall be taken outside the camp; and their hides, flesh, and dung shall be consumed in fire.
Transliteration: veet far hachatat veet sheiyr hachatat asher huva et-damam lekhafer vakodesh yvotsiy el-michuts lamachaneh vesharefu vaesh et-orotam veet-vesharam veet-firesham

Hebrew: וְהַשֹּׂרֵ֣ף אֹתָ֔ם יְכַבֵּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֔יו וְרָחַ֥ץ אֶת־בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֖ן יָב֥וֹא אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: The one who burned them shall wash those clothes and bathe the body in water—and after that may re-enter the camp.
Transliteration: vehashoref otam yekhaves vegadayv verachats et-vesharvo vamayiim veacharey-khen yavvo el-hamachaneh

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַ֠שְּׁבִיעִ֠י בֶּֽעָשׂ֨וֹר לַחֹ֜דֶשׁ תְּעַנּ֣וּ אֶת־נַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶ֗ם וְכׇל־מְלָאכָה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ הָֽאֶזְרָ֔ח וְהַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
Translated: And this shall be to you a law for all time: In the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall practice self-denial; and you shall do no manner of work, neither the citizen nor the alien who resides among you.
Transliteration: vehayetah lakhem lechukat volam vachodesh hasheviyiy veashvor lachodesh teanu et-nafeshoteykhem vekhׇl-melakhah lo taashu haezerach vehager hagar vetvokhekhem

Hebrew: כִּֽי־בַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּ֛ה יְכַפֵּ֥ר עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם לְטַהֵ֣ר אֶתְכֶ֑ם מִכֹּל֙ חַטֹּ֣אתֵיכֶ֔ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה תִּטְהָֽרוּ׃
Translated: For on this day atonement shall be made for you to purify you of all your sins; you shall be pure before יהוה.
Transliteration: khiy-vayyvom hazeh yekhafer aleykhem letaher etekhem mikhol chatoteykhem lifeney yehovah titeharu

Hebrew: שַׁבַּ֨ת שַׁבָּת֥וֹן הִיא֙ לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם חֻקַּ֖ת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; it is a law for all time.
Transliteration: shavat shavatvon hiy lakhem veiniytem et-nafeshoteykhem chukat volam

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֨ר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֲשֶׁר־יִמְשַׁ֣ח אֹת֗וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר יְמַלֵּא֙ אֶת־יָד֔וֹ לְכַהֵ֖ן תַּ֣חַת אָבִ֑יו וְלָבַ֛שׁ אֶת־בִּגְדֵ֥י הַבָּ֖ד בִּגְדֵ֥י הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: The priest who has been anointed and ordained to serve as priest in place of his father shall make expiation. He shall put on the linen vestments, the sacral vestments.
Transliteration: vekhifer hakhohen asher-yimeshach otvo vaasher yemale et-yadvo lekhahen tachat aviyv velavash et-vigedey havad vigedey hakodesh

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּר֙ אֶת־מִקְדַּ֣שׁ הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֶת־אֹ֧הֶל מוֹעֵ֛ד וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ יְכַפֵּ֑ר וְעַ֧ל הַכֹּהֲנִ֛ים וְעַל־כׇּל־עַ֥ם הַקָּהָ֖ל יְכַפֵּֽר׃
Translated: He shall purge the innermost Shrine; he shall purge the Tent of Meeting and the altar; and he shall make expiation for the priests and for all the people of the congregation.
Transliteration: vekhifer et-mikedash hakodesh veet-ohel mvoed veet-hamizevecha yekhafer veal hakhohaniym veal-khׇl-am hakahal yekhafer

Hebrew: וְהָֽיְתָה־זֹּ֨את לָכֶ֜ם לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֗ם לְכַפֵּ֞ר עַל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִכׇּל־חַטֹּאתָ֔ם אַחַ֖ת בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה וַיַּ֕עַשׂ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: This shall be to you a law for all time: to make atonement for the Israelites for all their sins once a year. And Moses did as יהוה had commanded him.
Transliteration: vehayetah-zot lakhem lechukat volam lekhafer al-veney yisherael mikhׇl-chatotam achat vashanah vayaash khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו וְאֶל֙ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Speak to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelite people and say to them: This is what יהוה has commanded:
Transliteration: daver el-aharon veel-vanayv veel khׇl-veney yisherael veamareta aleyhem zeh hadavar asher-tsivah yehovah lemor

Hebrew: אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁחַ֜ט שׁ֥וֹר אוֹ־כֶ֛שֶׂב אוֹ־עֵ֖ז בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה א֚וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִשְׁחַ֔ט מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: if anyone of the house of Israel slaughters an ox or sheep or goat in the camp, or does so outside the camp,
Transliteration: iysh iysh miveyt yisherael asher yishechat shvor vo-kheshev vo-ez vamachaneh vo asher yishechat michuts lamachaneh

Hebrew: וְאֶל־פֶּ֜תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֮ לֹ֣א הֱבִיאוֹ֒ לְהַקְרִ֤יב קׇרְבָּן֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֑ה דָּ֣ם יֵחָשֵׁ֞ב לָאִ֤ישׁ הַהוּא֙ דָּ֣ם שָׁפָ֔ךְ וְנִכְרַ֛ת הָאִ֥ישׁ הַה֖וּא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to present it as an offering to יהוה, before יהוה’s Tabernacle, bloodguilt shall be imputed to that party: having shed blood, that person shall be cut off from among this people.
Transliteration: veel-fetach ohel mvoed lo heviyvo lehakeriyv kׇrevan layhovah lifeney mishekhan yehovah dam eichashev laiysh hahu dam shafakhe venikherat haiysh hahu mikerev amvo

Hebrew: לְמַ֩עַן֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָבִ֜יאוּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶֽת־זִבְחֵיהֶם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֵ֣ם זֹבְחִים֮ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶה֒ וֶֽהֱבִיאֻ֣ם לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה אֶל־פֶּ֛תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְזָ֨בְח֜וּ זִבְחֵ֧י שְׁלָמִ֛ים לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: This is in order that the Israelites may bring the sacrifices which they have been making in the open—that they may bring them before יהוה, to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and offer them as sacrifices of well-being to יהוה;
Transliteration: lemaan asher yaviyu veney yisherael et-zivecheyhem asher hem zovechiym al-feney hashadeh veheviyum layhovah el-fetach ohel mvoed el-hakhohen vezavechu zivechey shelamiym layhovah votam

Hebrew: וְזָרַ֨ק הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֶת־הַדָּם֙ עַל־מִזְבַּ֣ח יְהֹוָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהִקְטִ֣יר הַחֵ֔לֶב לְרֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: that the priest may dash the blood against the altar of יהוה at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and turn the fat into smoke as a pleasing odor to יהוה;
Transliteration: vezarak hakhohen et-hadam al-mizevach yehovah fetach ohel mvoed vehiketiyr hachelev lereycha niychocha layhovah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִזְבְּח֥וּ עוֹד֙ אֶת־זִבְחֵיהֶ֔ם לַשְּׂעִירִ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥ם זֹנִ֖ים אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם תִּֽהְיֶה־זֹּ֥את לָהֶ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and that they may offer their sacrifices no more to the goat-demons after whom they stray. This shall be to them a law for all time, throughout the ages.
Transliteration: velo-yizevechu vod et-zivecheyhem lasheiyrim asher hem zoniym achareyhem chukat volam tiheyeh-zot lahem ledorotam

Hebrew: וַאֲלֵהֶ֣ם תֹּאמַ֔ר אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמִן־הַגֵּ֖ר אֲשֶׁר־יָג֣וּר בְּתוֹכָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲלֶ֥ה עֹלָ֖ה אוֹ־זָֽבַח׃
Translated: Say to them further: If anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them offers a burnt offering or a sacrifice,
Transliteration: vaalehem tomar iysh iysh miveyt yisherael umin-hager asher-yagur vetvokham asher-yaaleh olah vo-zavach

Hebrew: וְאֶל־פֶּ֜תַח אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ לֹ֣א יְבִיאֶ֔נּוּ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת אֹת֖וֹ לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְנִכְרַ֛ת הָאִ֥ישׁ הַה֖וּא מֵעַמָּֽיו׃
Translated: and does not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to offer it to יהוה, that person shall be cut off from this people.
Transliteration: veel-fetach ohel mvoed lo yeviyenu laashvot otvo layhovah venikherat haiysh hahu meamayv

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ אִ֜ישׁ מִבֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּמִן־הַגֵּר֙ הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יֹאכַ֖ל כׇּל־דָּ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֣י פָנַ֗י בַּנֶּ֙פֶשׁ֙ הָאֹכֶ֣לֶת אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י אֹתָ֖הּ מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: And if anyone of the house of Israel or of the strangers who reside among them partakes of any blood, I will set My face against the person who partakes of the blood; I will cut that person off from among kin.
Transliteration: veiysh iysh miveyt yisherael umin-hager hagar vetvokham asher yokhal khׇl-dam venatatiy fanay vanefesh haokhelet et-hadam vehikheratiy otah mikerev amah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י נֶ֣פֶשׁ הַבָּשָׂר֮ בַּדָּ֣ם הִוא֒ וַאֲנִ֞י נְתַתִּ֤יו לָכֶם֙ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־הַדָּ֥ם ה֖וּא בַּנֶּ֥פֶשׁ יְכַפֵּֽר׃
Translated: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have assigned it to you for making expiation for your lives upon the altar; it is the blood, as life, that effects expiation.
Transliteration: khiy nefesh havashar vadam hiv vaaniy netatiyv lakhem al-hamizevecha lekhafer al-nafeshoteykhem khiy-hadam hu vanefesh yekhafer

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כׇּל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ מִכֶּ֖ם לֹא־תֹ֣אכַל דָּ֑ם וְהַגֵּ֛ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶ֖ם לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל דָּֽם׃
Translated: Therefore I say to the Israelite people: No person among you shall partake of blood, nor shall the stranger who resides among you partake of blood.
Transliteration: al-khen amaretiy liveney yisherael khׇl-nefesh mikhem lo-tokhal dam vehager hagar vetvokhekhem lo-yokhal dam

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ישׁ אִ֜ישׁ מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וּמִן־הַגֵּר֙ הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָצ֜וּד צֵ֥יד חַיָּ֛ה אוֹ־ע֖וֹף אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֵאָכֵ֑ל וְשָׁפַךְ֙ אֶת־דָּמ֔וֹ וְכִסָּ֖הוּ בֶּעָפָֽר׃
Translated: And if any Israelite or any stranger who resides among them hunts down an animal or a bird that may be eaten, that person shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth.
Transliteration: veiysh iysh miveney yisherael umin-hager hagar vetvokham asher yatsud tseyd chayah vo-vof asher eiakhel veshafakhe et-damvo vekhisahu veafar

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נֶ֣פֶשׁ כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֗ר דָּמ֣וֹ בְנַפְשׁוֹ֮ הוּא֒ וָֽאֹמַר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל דַּ֥ם כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֖ר לֹ֣א תֹאכֵ֑לוּ כִּ֣י נֶ֤פֶשׁ כׇּל־בָּשָׂר֙ דָּמ֣וֹ הִ֔וא כׇּל־אֹכְלָ֖יו יִכָּרֵֽת׃
Translated: For the life of all flesh—its blood is its life. Therefore I say to the Israelite people: You shall not partake of the blood of any flesh, for the life of all flesh is its blood. Anyone who partakes of it shall be cut off.
Transliteration: khiy-nefesh khׇl-vashar damvo venafeshvo hu vaomar liveney yisherael dam khׇl-vashar lo tokhelu khiy nefesh khׇl-vashar damvo hiv khׇl-okhelayv yikharet

Hebrew: וְכׇל־נֶ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תֹּאכַ֤ל נְבֵלָה֙ וּטְרֵפָ֔ה בָּאֶזְרָ֖ח וּבַגֵּ֑ר וְכִבֶּ֨ס בְּגָדָ֜יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֛יִם וְטָמֵ֥א עַד־הָעֶ֖רֶב וְטָהֵֽר׃
Translated: Any person, whether citizen or stranger, who eats what has died or has been torn by beasts shall wash those clothes, bathe in water, remain impure until evening—and shall then be pure.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-nefesh asher tokhal nevelah uterefah vaezerach uvager vekhives vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetame ad-haerev vetaher

Hebrew: וְאִם֙ לֹ֣א יְכַבֵּ֔ס וּבְשָׂר֖וֹ לֹ֣א יִרְחָ֑ץ וְנָשָׂ֖א עֲוֺנֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: But if the clothes are not washed and the body is not bathed, that person shall bear the guilt.
Transliteration: veim lo yekhaves uvesharvo lo yirechats venasha avonvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֧ה אֶֽרֶץ־מִצְרַ֛יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשַׁבְתֶּם־בָּ֖הּ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ וּכְמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֶֽרֶץ־כְּנַ֡עַן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אֲנִי֩ מֵבִ֨יא אֶתְכֶ֥ם שָׁ֙מָּה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ וּבְחֻקֹּתֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֥א תֵלֵֽכוּ׃
Translated: You shall not copy the practices of the land of Egypt where you dwelt, or of the land of Canaan to which I am taking you; nor shall you follow their laws.
Transliteration: khemaasheh erets-mitserayiim asher yeshavetem-vah lo taashu ukhemaasheh erets-khenaan asher aniy meviy etekhem shamah lo taashu uvechukoteyhem lo telekhu

Hebrew: אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֧י תַּעֲשׂ֛וּ וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֥י תִּשְׁמְר֖וּ לָלֶ֣כֶת בָּהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: My rules alone shall you observe, and faithfully follow My laws: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: et-mishefatay taashu veet-chukotay tishemeru lalekhet vahem aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה אֹתָ֛ם הָאָדָ֖ם וָחַ֣י בָּהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall keep My laws and My rules, by the pursuit of which human beings shall live: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-chukotay veet-mishefatay asher yaasheh otam haadam vachay vahem aniy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ אֶל־כׇּל־שְׁאֵ֣ר בְּשָׂר֔וֹ לֹ֥א תִקְרְב֖וּ לְגַלּ֣וֹת עֶרְוָ֑ה אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: None of you men shall come near anyone of his own flesh to uncover nakedness: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: iysh iysh el-khׇl-sheer vesharvo lo tikerevu legalvot erevah aniy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אָבִ֛יךָ וְעֶרְוַ֥ת אִמְּךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אִמְּךָ֣ הִ֔וא לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Your father’s nakedness, that is, the nakedness of your mother, you shall not uncover; she is your mother—you shall not uncover her nakedness.
Transliteration: erevat aviykha veerevat imekha lo tegaleh imekha hiv lo tegaleh erevatah {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֵֽשֶׁת־אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה עֶרְוַ֥ת אָבִ֖יךָ הִֽוא׃ {ס}
Translated: Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife; it is the nakedness of your father.
Transliteration: erevat eshet-aviykha lo tegaleh erevat aviykha hiv {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֨ת אֲחֽוֹתְךָ֤ בַת־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ א֣וֹ בַת־אִמֶּ֔ךָ מוֹלֶ֣דֶת בַּ֔יִת א֖וֹ מוֹלֶ֣דֶת ח֑וּץ לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: The nakedness of your sister—your father’s daughter or your mother’s, whether born into the household or outside—do not uncover their nakedness.
Transliteration: erevat achvotekha vat-aviykha vo vat-imekha mvoledet vayiit vo mvoledet chuts lo tegaleh erevatan {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֤ת בַּת־בִּנְךָ֙ א֣וֹ בַֽת־בִּתְּךָ֔ לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָ֑ן כִּ֥י עֶרְוָתְךָ֖ הֵֽנָּה׃ {ס}
Translated: The nakedness of your son’s daughter, or of your daughter’s daughter—do not uncover their nakedness; for their nakedness is yours.
Transliteration: erevat vat-vinekha vo vat-vitekha lo tegaleh erevatan khiy erevatekha henah {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֨ת בַּת־אֵ֤שֶׁת אָבִ֙יךָ֙ מוֹלֶ֣דֶת אָבִ֔יךָ אֲחוֹתְךָ֖ הִ֑וא לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, who was born into your father’s household—she is your sister; do not uncover her nakedness.
Transliteration: erevat vat-eshet aviykha mvoledet aviykha achvotekha hiv lo tegaleh erevatah {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֲחוֹת־אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה שְׁאֵ֥ר אָבִ֖יךָ הִֽוא׃ {ס}
Translated: Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister; she is your father’s flesh.
Transliteration: erevat achvot-aviykha lo tegaleh sheer aviykha hiv {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֲחֽוֹת־אִמְּךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה כִּֽי־שְׁאֵ֥ר אִמְּךָ֖ הִֽוא׃ {ס}
Translated: Do not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister; for she is your mother’s flesh.
Transliteration: erevat achvot-imekha lo tegaleh khiy-sheer imekha hiv {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֲחִֽי־אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אֶל־אִשְׁתּוֹ֙ לֹ֣א תִקְרָ֔ב דֹּדָֽתְךָ֖ הִֽוא׃ {ס}
Translated: Do not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother: do not approach his wife; she is your aunt.
Transliteration: erevat achiy-aviykha lo tegaleh el-ishetvo lo tikerav dodatekha hiv {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת כַּלָּֽתְךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אֵ֤שֶׁת בִּנְךָ֙ הִ֔וא לֹ֥א תְגַלֶּ֖ה עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Do not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law: she is your son’s wife; you shall not uncover her nakedness.
Transliteration: erevat khalatekha lo tegaleh eshet vinekha hiv lo tegaleh erevatah {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אֵֽשֶׁת־אָחִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה עֶרְוַ֥ת אָחִ֖יךָ הִֽוא׃ {ס}
Translated: Do not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife; it is the nakedness of your brother.
Transliteration: erevat eshet-achiykha lo tegaleh erevat achiykha hiv {s}

Hebrew: עֶרְוַ֥ת אִשָּׁ֛ה וּבִתָּ֖הּ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה אֶֽת־בַּת־בְּנָ֞הּ וְאֶת־בַּת־בִּתָּ֗הּ לֹ֤א תִקַּח֙ לְגַלּ֣וֹת עֶרְוָתָ֔הּ שַׁאֲרָ֥ה הֵ֖נָּה זִמָּ֥ה הִֽוא׃
Translated: Do not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter; nor shall you take [into your household as a wife] her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter and uncover her nakedness: they are kindred; it is depravity.
Transliteration: erevat ishah uvitah lo tegaleh et-vat-venah veet-vat-vitah lo tikach legalvot erevatah shaarah henah zimah hiv

Hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֥ה אֶל־אֲחֹתָ֖הּ לֹ֣א תִקָּ֑ח לִצְרֹ֗ר לְגַלּ֧וֹת עֶרְוָתָ֛הּ עָלֶ֖יהָ בְּחַיֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated: Do not take [into your household as a wife] a woman as a rival to her sister and uncover her nakedness in the other’s lifetime.
Transliteration: veishah el-achotah lo tikach litseror legalvot erevatah aleyha vechayeyha

Hebrew: וְאֶל־אִשָּׁ֖ה בְּנִדַּ֣ת טֻמְאָתָ֑הּ לֹ֣א תִקְרַ֔ב לְגַלּ֖וֹת עֶרְוָתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Do not come near a woman during her menstrual period of impurity to uncover her nakedness.
Transliteration: veel-ishah venidat tumeatah lo tikerav legalvot erevatah

Hebrew: וְאֶל־אֵ֙שֶׁת֙ עֲמִֽיתְךָ֔ לֹא־תִתֵּ֥ן שְׁכׇבְתְּךָ֖ לְזָ֑רַע לְטׇמְאָה־בָֽהּ׃
Translated: Do not have carnal relations with your neighbor’s wife and defile yourself with her.
Transliteration: veel-eshet amiytekha lo-titen shekhׇvetekha lezara letׇmeah-vah

Hebrew: וּמִֽזַּרְעֲךָ֥ לֹא־תִתֵּ֖ן לְהַעֲבִ֣יר לַמֹּ֑לֶךְ וְלֹ֧א תְחַלֵּ֛ל אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Do not allow any of your offspring to be offered up to Molech, and do not profane the name of your God: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: umizareakha lo-titen lehaaviyr lamolekhe velo techalel et-shem eloheykha aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְאֶ֨ת־זָכָ֔ר לֹ֥א תִשְׁכַּ֖ב מִשְׁכְּבֵ֣י אִשָּׁ֑ה תּוֹעֵבָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
Translated: Do not lie with a male as one lies with a woman; it is an abhorrence.
Transliteration: veet-zakhar lo tishekhav mishekhevey ishah tvoevah hiv

Hebrew: וּבְכׇל־בְּהֵמָ֛ה לֹא־תִתֵּ֥ן שְׁכׇבְתְּךָ֖ לְטׇמְאָה־בָ֑הּ וְאִשָּׁ֗ה לֹֽא־תַעֲמֹ֞ד לִפְנֵ֧י בְהֵמָ֛ה לְרִבְעָ֖הּ תֶּ֥בֶל הֽוּא׃
Translated: Do not have carnal relations with any beast and defile yourself thereby. Likewise for a woman: she shall not lend herself to a beast to mate with it; it is perversion.
Transliteration: uvekhׇl-vehemah lo-titen shekhׇvetekha letׇmeah-vah veishah lo-taamod lifeney vehemah leriveah tevel hu

Hebrew: אַל־תִּֽטַּמְּא֖וּ בְּכׇל־אֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֤י בְכׇל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ נִטְמְא֣וּ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י מְשַׁלֵּ֖חַ מִפְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not defile yourselves in any of those ways, for it is by such that the nations that I am casting out before you defiled themselves.
Transliteration: al-titameu vekhׇl-eleh khiy vekhׇl-eleh nitemeu hagvoyim asher-aniy meshalecha mifeneykhem

Hebrew: וַתִּטְמָ֣א הָאָ֔רֶץ וָאֶפְקֹ֥ד עֲוֺנָ֖הּ עָלֶ֑יהָ וַתָּקִ֥א הָאָ֖רֶץ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Thus the land became defiled; and I called it to account for its iniquity, and the land spewed out its inhabitants.
Transliteration: vatitema haarets vaefekod avonah aleyha vataki haarets et-yosheveyha

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם אַתֶּ֗ם אֶת־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י וְלֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ מִכֹּ֥ל הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה הָֽאֶזְרָ֔ח וְהַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
Translated: But you must keep My laws and My rules, and you must not do any of those abhorrent things, neither the citizen nor the stranger who resides among you;
Transliteration: ushemaretem atem et-chukotay veet-mishefatay velo taashu mikhol hatvoevot haeleh haezerach vehager hagar vetvokhekhem

Hebrew: כִּ֚י אֶת־כׇּל־הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֣ת הָאֵ֔ל עָשׂ֥וּ אַנְשֵֽׁי־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וַתִּטְמָ֖א הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: for all those abhorrent things were done by the people who were in the land before you, and the land became defiled.
Transliteration: khiy et-khׇl-hatvoevot hael ashu aneshey-haarets asher lifeneykhem vatitema haarets

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תָקִ֤יא הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם בְּטַֽמַּאֲכֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר קָאָ֛ה אֶת־הַגּ֖וֹי אֲשֶׁ֥ר לִפְנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: So let not the land spew you out for defiling it, as it spewed out the nation that came before you.
Transliteration: velo-takiy haarets etekhem vetamaakhem otah khaasher kaah et-hagvoy asher lifeneykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֚י כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה מִכֹּ֥ל הַתּוֹעֵבֹ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה וְנִכְרְת֛וּ הַנְּפָשׁ֥וֹת הָעֹשֹׂ֖ת מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽם׃
Translated: All who do any of those abhorrent things—such persons shall be cut off from their people.
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-asher yaasheh mikhol hatvoevot haeleh venikheretu hanefashvot haoshot mikerev amam

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֗י לְבִלְתִּ֨י עֲשׂ֜וֹת מֵחֻקּ֤וֹת הַתּֽוֹעֵבֹת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נַעֲשׂ֣וּ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תִֽטַּמְּא֖וּ בָּהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall keep My charge not to engage in any of the abhorrent practices that were carried on before you, and you shall not defile yourselves through them: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-mishemaretiy leviletiy ashvot mechukvot hatvoevot asher naashu lifeneykhem velo titameu vahem aniy yehovah eloheykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֥ אֲלֵהֶ֖ם קְדֹשִׁ֣ים תִּהְי֑וּ כִּ֣י קָד֔וֹשׁ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Speak to the whole Israelite community and say to them: You shall be holy, for I, your God יהוה, am holy.
Transliteration: daver el-khׇl-adat veney-yisherael veamareta alehem kedoshiym tiheyu khiy kadvosh aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ אִמּ֤וֹ וְאָבִיו֙ תִּירָ֔אוּ וְאֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֖י תִּשְׁמֹ֑רוּ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall each revere your mother and your father, and keep My sabbaths: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: iysh imvo veaviyv tiyrau veet-shavetotay tishemoru aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: אַל־תִּפְנוּ֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֱלִילִ֔ם וֵֽאלֹהֵי֙ מַסֵּכָ֔ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשׂ֖וּ לָכֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not turn to idols or make molten gods for yourselves: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: al-tifenu el-haeliylim velohey masekhah lo taashu lakhem aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וְכִ֧י תִזְבְּח֛וּ זֶ֥בַח שְׁלָמִ֖ים לַיהֹוָ֑ה לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֖ם תִּזְבָּחֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: When you sacrifice an offering of well-being to יהוה, sacrifice it so that it may be accepted on your behalf.
Transliteration: vekhiy tizevechu zevach shelamiym layhovah liretsonekhem tizevachuhu

Hebrew: בְּי֧וֹם זִבְחֲכֶ֛ם יֵאָכֵ֖ל וּמִֽמׇּחֳרָ֑ת וְהַנּוֹתָר֙ עַד־י֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י בָּאֵ֖שׁ יִשָּׂרֵֽף׃
Translated: It shall be eaten on the day you sacrifice it, or on the day following; but what is left by the third day must be consumed in fire.
Transliteration: veyvom zivechakhem eiakhel umimׇchorat vehanvotar ad-yvom hasheliyshiy vaesh yisharef

Hebrew: וְאִ֛ם הֵאָכֹ֥ל יֵאָכֵ֖ל בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י פִּגּ֥וּל ה֖וּא לֹ֥א יֵרָצֶֽה׃
Translated: If it should be eaten on the third day, it is an offensive thing, it will not be acceptable.
Transliteration: veim heakhol eiakhel vayyvom hasheliyshiy figul hu lo eiratseh

Hebrew: וְאֹֽכְלָיו֙ עֲוֺנ֣וֹ יִשָּׂ֔א כִּֽי־אֶת־קֹ֥דֶשׁ יְהֹוָ֖ה חִלֵּ֑ל וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated: And one who eats of it shall bear the guilt for having profaned what is sacred to יהוה; that person shall be cut off from kin.
Transliteration: veokhelayv avonvo yisha khiy-et-kodesh yehovah chilel venikheretah hanefesh hahiv meameyha

Hebrew: וּֽבְקֻצְרְכֶם֙ אֶת־קְצִ֣יר אַרְצְכֶ֔ם לֹ֧א תְכַלֶּ֛ה פְּאַ֥ת שָׂדְךָ֖ לִקְצֹ֑ר וְלֶ֥קֶט קְצִֽירְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תְלַקֵּֽט׃
Translated: When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest.
Transliteration: uvekutserekhem et-ketsiyr aretsekhem lo tekhaleh feat shadekha liketsor veleket ketsiyrekha lo telaket

Hebrew: וְכַרְמְךָ֙ לֹ֣א תְעוֹלֵ֔ל וּפֶ֥רֶט כַּרְמְךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְלַקֵּ֑ט לֶֽעָנִ֤י וְלַגֵּר֙ תַּעֲזֹ֣ב אֹתָ֔ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not pick your vineyard bare, or gather the fallen fruit of your vineyard; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: vekharemekha lo tevolel uferet kharemekha lo telaket leaniy velager taazov otam aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: לֹ֖א תִּגְנֹ֑בוּ וְלֹא־תְכַחֲשׁ֥וּ וְלֹֽא־תְשַׁקְּר֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ בַּעֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall not steal; you shall not deal deceitfully or falsely with one another.
Transliteration: lo tigenovu velo-tekhachashu velo-teshakeru iysh vaamiytvo

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִשָּׁבְע֥וּ בִשְׁמִ֖י לַשָּׁ֑קֶר וְחִלַּלְתָּ֛ אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall not swear falsely by My name, profaning the name of your God: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: velo-tishaveu vishemiy lashaker vechilaleta et-shem eloheykha aniy yehovah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תַעֲשֹׁ֥ק אֶת־רֵֽעֲךָ֖ וְלֹ֣א תִגְזֹ֑ל לֹֽא־תָלִ֞ין פְּעֻלַּ֥ת שָׂכִ֛יר אִתְּךָ֖ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: You shall not defraud your fellow [Israelite]. You shall not commit robbery. The wages of a laborer shall not remain with you until morning.
Transliteration: lo-taashok et-reakha velo tigezol lo-taliyn feulat shakhiyr itekha ad-voker

Hebrew: לֹא־תְקַלֵּ֣ל חֵרֵ֔שׁ וְלִפְנֵ֣י עִוֵּ֔ר לֹ֥א תִתֵּ֖ן מִכְשֹׁ֑ל וְיָרֵ֥אתָ מֵּאֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall not insult the deaf, or place a stumbling block before the blind. You shall fear your God: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-tekalel cheresh velifeney iver lo titen mikheshol veyareta meeloheykha aniy yehovah

Hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשׂ֥וּ עָ֙וֶל֙ בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֔ט לֹא־תִשָּׂ֣א פְנֵי־דָ֔ל וְלֹ֥א תֶהְדַּ֖ר פְּנֵ֣י גָד֑וֹל בְּצֶ֖דֶק תִּשְׁפֹּ֥ט עֲמִיתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You shall not render an unfair decision: do not favor the poor or show deference to the rich; judge your kin fairly.
Transliteration: lo-taashu avel vamishefat lo-tisha feney-dal velo tehedar feney gadvol vetsedek tishefot amiytekha

Hebrew: לֹא־תֵלֵ֤ךְ רָכִיל֙ בְּעַמֶּ֔יךָ לֹ֥א תַעֲמֹ֖ד עַל־דַּ֣ם רֵעֶ֑ךָ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Do not deal basely with members of your people. Do not profit by the blood of your fellow [Israelite]: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-telekhe rakhiyl veameykha lo taamod al-dam reekha aniy yehovah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִשְׂנָ֥א אֶת־אָחִ֖יךָ בִּלְבָבֶ֑ךָ הוֹכֵ֤חַ תּוֹכִ֙יחַ֙ אֶת־עֲמִיתֶ֔ךָ וְלֹא־תִשָּׂ֥א עָלָ֖יו חֵֽטְא׃
Translated: You shall not hate your kinsfolk in your heart. Reprove your kin but incur no guilt on their account.
Transliteration: lo-tishena et-achiykha vilevavekha hvokhecha tvokhiycha et-amiytekha velo-tisha alayv chete

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תִקֹּ֤ם וְלֹֽא־תִטֹּר֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֔ךָ וְאָֽהַבְתָּ֥ לְרֵעֲךָ֖ כָּמ֑וֹךָ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall not take vengeance or bear a grudge against members of your people. Love your fellow [Israelite] as yourself: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: lo-tikom velo-titor et-veney amekha veahaveta lereakha khamvokha aniy yehovah

Hebrew: אֶֽת־חֻקֹּתַי֮ תִּשְׁמֹ֒רוּ֒ בְּהֶמְתְּךָ֙ לֹא־תַרְבִּ֣יעַ כִּלְאַ֔יִם שָׂדְךָ֖ לֹא־תִזְרַ֣ע כִּלְאָ֑יִם וּבֶ֤גֶד כִּלְאַ֙יִם֙ שַֽׁעַטְנֵ֔ז לֹ֥א יַעֲלֶ֖ה עָלֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: You shall observe My laws. You shall not let your cattle mate with a different kind; you shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed; you shall not put on cloth from a mixture of two kinds of material.
Transliteration: et-chukotay tishemoru vehemetekha lo-tareviya khileayiim shadekha lo-tizera khileayiim uveged khileayiim shaatenez lo yaaleh aleykha

Hebrew: וְ֠אִ֠ישׁ כִּֽי־יִשְׁכַּ֨ב אֶת־אִשָּׁ֜ה שִׁכְבַת־זֶ֗רַע וְהִ֤וא שִׁפְחָה֙ נֶחֱרֶ֣פֶת לְאִ֔ישׁ וְהׇפְדֵּה֙ לֹ֣א נִפְדָּ֔תָה א֥וֹ חֻפְשָׁ֖הֿ לֹ֣א נִתַּן־לָ֑הּ בִּקֹּ֧רֶת תִּהְיֶ֛ה לֹ֥א יוּמְת֖וּ כִּי־לֹ֥א חֻפָּֽשָׁה׃
Translated: If a man has carnal relations with a woman who is a slave and has been designated for another man, but has not been redeemed or given her freedom, there shall be an indemnity; they shall not, however, be put to death, since she has not been freed.
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-yishekhav et-ishah shikhevat-zera vehiv shifechah necherefet leiysh vehׇfedeh lo nifedatah vo chufeshahֿ lo nitan-lah vikoret tiheyeh lo yumetu khiy-lo chufashah

Hebrew: וְהֵבִ֤יא אֶת־אֲשָׁמוֹ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד אֵ֖יל אָשָֽׁם׃
Translated: But he must bring to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as his guilt offering to יהוה, a ram of guilt offering.
Transliteration: veheviy et-ashamvo layhovah el-fetach ohel mvoed eyl asham

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּר֩ עָלָ֨יו הַכֹּהֵ֜ן בְּאֵ֤יל הָֽאָשָׁם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־חַטָּאת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֣ר חָטָ֑א וְנִסְלַ֣ח ל֔וֹ מֵחַטָּאת֖וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: With the ram of guilt offering the priest shall make expiation for him before יהוה for the sin that he committed; and the sin that he committed will be forgiven him.
Transliteration: vekhifer alayv hakhohen veeyl haasham lifeney yehovah al-chatatvo asher chata veniselach lvo mechatatvo asher chata {f}

Hebrew: וְכִי־תָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ וּנְטַעְתֶּם֙ כׇּל־עֵ֣ץ מַאֲכָ֔ל וַעֲרַלְתֶּ֥ם עׇרְלָת֖וֹ אֶת־פִּרְי֑וֹ שָׁלֹ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֗ים יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם עֲרֵלִ֖ים לֹ֥א יֵאָכֵֽל׃
Translated: When you enter the land and plant any tree for food, you shall regard its fruit as forbidden. Three years it shall be forbidden for you, not to be eaten.
Transliteration: vekhiy-tavou el-haarets unetaetem khׇl-ets maakhal vaaraletem ׇrelatvo et-fireyvo shalosh shaniym yiheyeh lakhem areliym lo eiakhel

Hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָה֙ הָרְבִיעִ֔ת יִהְיֶ֖ה כׇּל־פִּרְי֑וֹ קֹ֥דֶשׁ הִלּוּלִ֖ים לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the fourth year all its fruit shall be set aside for jubilation before יהוה;
Transliteration: uvashanah hareviyit yiheyeh khׇl-fireyvo kodesh hiluliym layhovah

Hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַחֲמִישִׁ֗ת תֹּֽאכְלוּ֙ אֶת־פִּרְי֔וֹ לְהוֹסִ֥יף לָכֶ֖ם תְּבוּאָת֑וֹ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: and only in the fifth year may you use its fruit—that its yield to you may be increased: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: uvashanah hachamiyshit tokhelu et-fireyvo lehvosiyf lakhem tevuatvo aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: לֹ֥א תֹאכְל֖וּ עַל־הַדָּ֑ם לֹ֥א תְנַחֲשׁ֖וּ וְלֹ֥א תְעוֹנֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: You shall not eat anything with its blood. You shall not practice divination or soothsaying.
Transliteration: lo tokhelu al-hadam lo tenachashu velo tevonenu

Hebrew: לֹ֣א תַקִּ֔פוּ פְּאַ֖ת רֹאשְׁכֶ֑ם וְלֹ֣א תַשְׁחִ֔ית אֵ֖ת פְּאַ֥ת זְקָנֶֽךָ׃
Translated: You [men] shall not round off the side-growth on your head, or destroy the side-growth of your beard.
Transliteration: lo takifu feat roshekhem velo tashechiyt et feat zekanekha

Hebrew: וְשֶׂ֣רֶט לָנֶ֗פֶשׁ לֹ֤א תִתְּנוּ֙ בִּבְשַׂרְכֶ֔ם וּכְתֹ֣בֶת קַֽעֲקַ֔ע לֹ֥א תִתְּנ֖וּ בָּכֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall not make gashes in your flesh for the dead, or incise any marks on yourselves: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: vesheret lanefesh lo titenu vivesharekhem ukhetovet kaaka lo titenu vakhem aniy yehovah

Hebrew: אַל־תְּחַלֵּ֥ל אֶֽת־בִּתְּךָ֖ לְהַזְנוֹתָ֑הּ וְלֹא־תִזְנֶ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ וּמָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ זִמָּֽה׃
Translated: Do not degrade your daughter and make her a harlot, lest the land fall into harlotry and the land be filled with depravity.
Transliteration: al-techalel et-vitekha lehazenvotah velo-tizeneh haarets umaleah haarets zimah

Hebrew: אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֣י תִּשְׁמֹ֔רוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁ֖י תִּירָ֑אוּ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: et-shavetotay tishemoru umikedashiy tiyrau aniy yehovah

Hebrew: אַל־תִּפְנ֤וּ אֶל־הָאֹבֹת֙ וְאֶל־הַיִּדְּעֹנִ֔ים אַל־תְּבַקְשׁ֖וּ לְטׇמְאָ֣ה בָהֶ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not turn to ghosts and do not inquire of familiar spirits, to be defiled by them: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: al-tifenu el-haovot veel-hayideoniym al-tevakeshu letׇmeah vahem aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: מִפְּנֵ֤י שֵׂיבָה֙ תָּק֔וּם וְהָדַרְתָּ֖ פְּנֵ֣י זָקֵ֑ן וְיָרֵ֥אתָ מֵּאֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall rise before the aged and show deference to the old; you shall fear your God: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: mifeney sheyvah takum vehadareta feney zaken veyareta meeloheykha aniy yehovah {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָג֧וּר אִתְּךָ֛ גֵּ֖ר בְּאַרְצְכֶ֑ם לֹ֥א תוֹנ֖וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: When strangers reside with you in your land, you shall not wrong them.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yagur itekha ger vearetsekhem lo tvonu otvo

Hebrew: כְּאֶזְרָ֣ח מִכֶּם֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֜ם הַגֵּ֣ר ׀ הַגָּ֣ר אִתְּכֶ֗ם וְאָהַבְתָּ֥ לוֹ֙ כָּמ֔וֹךָ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֥ים הֱיִיתֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: The strangers who reside with you shall be to you as your citizens; you shall love each one as yourself, for you were strangers in the land of Egypt: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: kheezerach mikhem yiheyeh lakhem hager hagar itekhem veahaveta lvo khamvokha khiy-geriym heyiytem veerets mitserayiim aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: לֹא־תַעֲשׂ֥וּ עָ֖וֶל בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט בַּמִּדָּ֕ה בַּמִּשְׁקָ֖ל וּבַמְּשׂוּרָֽה׃
Translated: You shall not falsify measures of length, weight, or capacity.
Transliteration: lo-taashu avel vamishefat vamidah vamishekal uvameshurah

Hebrew: מֹ֧אזְנֵי צֶ֣דֶק אַבְנֵי־צֶ֗דֶק אֵ֥יפַת צֶ֛דֶק וְהִ֥ין צֶ֖דֶק יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם אֲנִי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall have an honest balance, honest weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin. I יהוה am your God who freed you from the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: mozeney tsedek aveney-tsedek eyfat tsedek vehiyn tsedek yiheyeh lakhem aniy yehovah eloheykhem asher-hvotsetiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־כׇּל־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall faithfully observe all My laws and all My rules: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-khׇl-chukotay veet-khׇl-mishefatay vaashiytem otam aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה spoke to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ תֹּאמַר֒ אִ֣ישׁ אִישׁ֩ מִבְּנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּמִן־הַגֵּ֣ר ׀ הַגָּ֣ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֧ן מִזַּרְע֛וֹ לַמֹּ֖לֶךְ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑ת עַ֥ם הָאָ֖רֶץ יִרְגְּמֻ֥הוּ בָאָֽבֶן׃
Translated: Say further to the Israelite people: Anyone among the Israelites, or among the strangers residing in Israel, who gives any offspring to Molech, shall be put to death; the people of the land shall pelt the person with stones.
Transliteration: veel-veney yisherael tomar iysh iysh miveney yisherael umin-hager hagar veyisherael asher yiten mizarevo lamolekhe mvot yumat am haarets yiregemuhu vaaven

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י אֶתֵּ֤ן אֶת־פָּנַי֙ בָּאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י אֹת֖וֹ מִקֶּ֣רֶב עַמּ֑וֹ כִּ֤י מִזַּרְעוֹ֙ נָתַ֣ן לַמֹּ֔לֶךְ לְמַ֗עַן טַמֵּא֙ אֶת־מִקְדָּשִׁ֔י וּלְחַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם קׇדְשִֽׁי׃
Translated: And I will set My face against that party, whom I will cut off from among the people for having given offspring to Molech and so defiled My sanctuary and profaned My holy name.
Transliteration: vaaniy eten et-fanay vaiysh hahu vehikheratiy otvo mikerev amvo khiy mizarevo natan lamolekhe lemaan tame et-mikedashiy ulechalel et-shem kׇdeshiy

Hebrew: וְאִ֡ם הַעְלֵ֣ם יַעְלִ֩ימֽוּ֩ עַ֨ם הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־עֵֽינֵיהֶם֙ מִן־הָאִ֣ישׁ הַה֔וּא בְּתִתּ֥וֹ מִזַּרְע֖וֹ לַמֹּ֑לֶךְ לְבִלְתִּ֖י הָמִ֥ית אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: And if the people of the land should shut their eyes to that party’s giving offspring to Molech, and should not put the person to death,
Transliteration: veim haelem yaeliymu am haarets et-eyneyhem min-haiysh hahu vetitvo mizarevo lamolekhe leviletiy hamiyt otvo

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י אֲנִ֧י אֶת־פָּנַ֛י בָּאִ֥ישׁ הַה֖וּא וּבְמִשְׁפַּחְתּ֑וֹ וְהִכְרַתִּ֨י אֹת֜וֹ וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־הַזֹּנִ֣ים אַחֲרָ֗יו לִזְנ֛וֹת אַחֲרֵ֥י הַמֹּ֖לֶךְ מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽם׃
Translated: I Myself will set My face against that party’s kin as well; and I will cut off from among their people both that person and all who follow in going astray after Molech.
Transliteration: veshametiy aniy et-fanay vaiysh hahu uvemishefachetvo vehikheratiy otvo veet khׇl-hazoniym acharayv lizenvot acharey hamolekhe mikerev amam

Hebrew: וְהַנֶּ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּפְנֶ֤ה אֶל־הָֽאֹבֹת֙ וְאֶל־הַיִּדְּעֹנִ֔ים לִזְנֹ֖ת אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־פָּנַי֙ בַּנֶּ֣פֶשׁ הַהִ֔וא וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י אֹת֖וֹ מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And if any person turns to ghosts and familiar spirits and goes astray after them, I will set My face against that person, whom I will cut off from among the people.
Transliteration: vehanefesh asher tifeneh el-haovot veel-hayideoniym lizenot achareyhem venatatiy et-fanay vanefesh hahiv vehikheratiy otvo mikerev amvo

Hebrew: וְהִ֨תְקַדִּשְׁתֶּ֔ם וִהְיִיתֶ֖ם קְדֹשִׁ֑ים כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall sanctify yourselves and be holy, for I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: vehitekadishetem viheyiytem kedoshiym khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall faithfully observe My laws: I יהוה make you holy.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-chukotay vaashiytem otam aniy yehovah mekadishekhem

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אִ֣ישׁ אִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יְקַלֵּ֧ל אֶת־אָבִ֛יו וְאֶת־אִמּ֖וֹ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑ת אָבִ֧יו וְאִמּ֛וֹ קִלֵּ֖ל דָּמָ֥יו בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If anyone insults either father or mother, that person shall be put to death; that person has insulted father and mother—and retains the bloodguilt.
Transliteration: khiy-iysh iysh asher yekalel et-aviyv veet-imvo mvot yumat aviyv veimvo kilel damayv vvo

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִנְאַף֙ אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִנְאַ֖ף אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת רֵעֵ֑הוּ מֽוֹת־יוּמַ֥ת הַנֹּאֵ֖ף וְהַנֹּאָֽפֶת׃
Translated: If a man commits adultery with a married woman—committing adultery with another man’s wife—the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yineaf et-eshet iysh asher yineaf et-eshet reehu mvot-yumat hanoef vehanoafet

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־אֵ֣שֶׁת אָבִ֔יו עֶרְוַ֥ת אָבִ֖יו גִּלָּ֑ה מֽוֹת־יוּמְת֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
Translated: If a man lies with his father’s wife, it is the nakedness of his father that he has uncovered; the two shall be put to death—and they retain the bloodguilt.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yishekhav et-eshet aviyv erevat aviyv gilah mvot-yumetu sheneyhem demeyhem vam

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־כַּלָּת֔וֹ מ֥וֹת יוּמְת֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם תֶּ֥בֶל עָשׂ֖וּ דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
Translated: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall be put to death; they have committed incest—and they retain the bloodguilt.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yishekhav et-khalatvo mvot yumetu sheneyhem tevel ashu demeyhem vam

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכַּ֤ב אֶת־זָכָר֙ מִשְׁכְּבֵ֣י אִשָּׁ֔ה תּוֹעֵבָ֥ה עָשׂ֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֑ם מ֥וֹת יוּמָ֖תוּ דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
Translated: If a man lies with a male as one lies with a woman, the two of them have done an abhorrent thing; they shall be put to death—and they retain the bloodguilt.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yishekhav et-zakhar mishekhevey ishah tvoevah ashu sheneyhem mvot yumatu demeyhem vam

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִקַּ֧ח אֶת־אִשָּׁ֛ה וְאֶת־אִמָּ֖הּ זִמָּ֣ה הִ֑וא בָּאֵ֞שׁ יִשְׂרְפ֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ וְאֶתְהֶ֔ן וְלֹא־תִהְיֶ֥ה זִמָּ֖ה בְּתוֹכְכֶֽם׃
Translated: If a man takes a woman and her mother [into his household as his wives], it is depravity; both he and they shall be put to the fire, that there be no depravity among you.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yikach et-ishah veet-imah zimah hiv vaesh yisherefu otvo veetehen velo-tiheyeh zimah vetvokhekhem

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֧ן שְׁכׇבְתּ֛וֹ בִּבְהֵמָ֖ה מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑ת וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה תַּהֲרֹֽגוּ׃
