Translated: If a man has carnal relations with a beast, he shall be put to death; and you shall kill the beast.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yiten shekhׇvetvo vivehemah mvot yumat veet-havehemah taharogu

Hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּקְרַ֤ב אֶל־כׇּל־בְּהֵמָה֙ לְרִבְעָ֣הֿ אֹתָ֔הּ וְהָרַגְתָּ֥ אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה וְאֶת־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה מ֥וֹת יוּמָ֖תוּ דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃
Translated: If a woman approaches any beast to mate with it, you shall kill the woman and the beast; they shall be put to death—and they retain the bloodguilt.
Transliteration: veishah asher tikerav el-khׇl-vehemah leriveahֿ otah veharageta et-haishah veet-havehemah mvot yumatu demeyhem vam

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִקַּ֣ח אֶת־אֲחֹת֡וֹ בַּת־אָבִ֣יו א֣וֹ בַת־אִ֠מּ֠וֹ וְרָאָ֨ה אֶת־עֶרְוָתָ֜הּ וְהִֽיא־תִרְאֶ֤ה אֶת־עֶרְוָתוֹ֙ חֶ֣סֶד ה֔וּא וְנִ֨כְרְת֔וּ לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י עַמָּ֑ם עֶרְוַ֧ת אֲחֹת֛וֹ גִּלָּ֖ה עֲוֺנ֥וֹ יִשָּֽׂא׃
Translated: If a man takes his sister [into his household as a wife], the daughter of either his father or his mother, so that he sees her nakedness and she sees his nakedness, it is a disgrace; they shall be excommunicated in the sight of their kinsfolk. He has uncovered the nakedness of his sister, he shall bear the guilt.
Transliteration: veiysh asher-yikach et-achotvo vat-aviyv vo vat-imvo veraah et-erevatah vehiy-tireeh et-erevatvo chesed hu venikheretu leeyney veney amam erevat achotvo gilah avonvo yisha

Hebrew: וְ֠אִ֠ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִשְׁכַּ֨ב אֶת־אִשָּׁ֜ה דָּוָ֗ה וְגִלָּ֤ה אֶת־עֶרְוָתָהּ֙ אֶת־מְקֹרָ֣הּ הֶֽעֱרָ֔ה וְהִ֕וא גִּלְּתָ֖ה אֶת־מְק֣וֹר דָּמֶ֑יהָ וְנִכְרְת֥וּ שְׁנֵיהֶ֖ם מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽם׃
Translated: If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual condition and uncovers her nakedness, he has laid bare her flow and she has exposed her blood flow; both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
Transliteration: veiysh asher-yishekhav et-ishah davah vegilah et-erevatah et-mekorah heerah vehiv giletah et-mekvor dameyha venikheretu sheneyhem mikerev amam

Hebrew: וְעֶרְוַ֨ת אֲח֧וֹת אִמְּךָ֛ וַאֲח֥וֹת אָבִ֖יךָ לֹ֣א תְגַלֵּ֑ה כִּ֧י אֶת־שְׁאֵר֛וֹ הֶעֱרָ֖ה עֲוֺנָ֥ם יִשָּֽׂאוּ׃
Translated: You [males] shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister or of your father’s sister, for that is laying bare one’s own flesh; they shall bear their guilt.
Transliteration: veerevat achvot imekha vaachvot aviykha lo tegaleh khiy et-sheervo heerah avonam yishau

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכַּב֙ אֶת־דֹּ֣דָת֔וֹ עֶרְוַ֥ת דֹּד֖וֹ גִּלָּ֑ה חֶטְאָ֥ם יִשָּׂ֖אוּ עֲרִירִ֥ים יָמֻֽתוּ׃
Translated: If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, it is his uncle’s nakedness that he has uncovered. They shall bear their guilt: they shall die childless.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yishekhav et-dodatvo erevat dodvo gilah cheteam yishau ariyriym yamutu

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִקַּ֛ח אֶת־אֵ֥שֶׁת אָחִ֖יו נִדָּ֣ה הִ֑וא עֶרְוַ֥ת אָחִ֛יו גִּלָּ֖ה עֲרִירִ֥ים יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: If a man takes the wife of his brother [into his household as a wife], it is indecency. It is the nakedness of his brother that he has uncovered; they shall remain childless.
Transliteration: veiysh asher yikach et-eshet achiyv nidah hiv erevat achiyv gilah ariyriym yiheyu

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־כׇּל־חֻקֹּתַי֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־מִשְׁפָּטַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־תָקִ֤יא אֶתְכֶם֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֲנִ֜י מֵבִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֛ם שָׁ֖מָּה לָשֶׁ֥בֶת בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: You shall faithfully observe all My laws and all My regulations, lest the land to which I bring you to settle in spew you out.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et-khׇl-chukotay veet-khׇl-mishefatay vaashiytem otam velo-takiy etekhem haarets asher aniy meviy etekhem shamah lashevet vah

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א תֵֽלְכוּ֙ בְּחֻקֹּ֣ת הַגּ֔וֹי אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י מְשַׁלֵּ֖חַ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֤י אֶת־כׇּל־אֵ֙לֶּה֙ עָשׂ֔וּ וָאָקֻ֖ץ בָּֽם׃
Translated: You shall not follow the practices of the nation that I am driving out before you. For it is because they did all these things that I abhorred them
Transliteration: velo telekhu vechukot hagvoy asher-aniy meshalecha mifeneykhem khiy et-khׇl-eleh ashu vaakuts vam

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֣ר לָכֶ֗ם אַתֶּם֮ תִּֽירְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־אַדְמָתָם֒ וַאֲנִ֞י אֶתְּנֶ֤נָּה לָכֶם֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֹתָ֔הּ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָ֑שׁ אֲנִי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הִבְדַּ֥לְתִּי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִן־הָֽעַמִּֽים׃
Translated: and said to you: You shall possess their land, for I will give it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey. I יהוה am your God who has set you apart from other peoples.
Transliteration: vaomar lakhem atem tiyreshu et-adematam vaaniy etenenah lakhem lareshet otah erets zavat chalav udevash aniy yehovah eloheykhem asher-hivedaletiy etekhem min-haamiym

Hebrew: וְהִבְדַּלְתֶּ֞ם בֵּֽין־הַבְּהֵמָ֤ה הַטְּהֹרָה֙ לַטְּמֵאָ֔ה וּבֵין־הָע֥וֹף הַטָּמֵ֖א לַטָּהֹ֑ר וְלֹֽא־תְשַׁקְּצ֨וּ אֶת־נַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶ֜ם בַּבְּהֵמָ֣ה וּבָע֗וֹף וּבְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּרְמֹ֣שׂ הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הִבְדַּ֥לְתִּי לָכֶ֖ם לְטַמֵּֽא׃
Translated: So you shall set apart the pure beast from the impure, the impure bird from the pure. You shall not draw abomination upon yourselves through beast or bird or anything with which the ground is alive, which I have set apart for you to treat as impure.
Transliteration: vehivedaletem veyn-havehemah hatehorah latemeah uveyn-havof hatame latahor velo-teshaketsu et-nafeshoteykhem vavehemah uvavof uvekhol asher tiremosh haadamah asher-hivedaletiy lakhem letame

Hebrew: וִהְיִ֤יתֶם לִי֙ קְדֹשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י קָד֖וֹשׁ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וָאַבְדִּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִן־הָֽעַמִּ֖ים לִהְי֥וֹת לִֽי׃
Translated: You shall be holy to Me, for I יהוה am holy, and I have set you apart from other peoples to be Mine.
Transliteration: viheyiytem liy kedoshiym khiy kadvosh aniy yehovah vaavedil etekhem min-haamiym liheyvot liy

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ישׁ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה כִּי־יִהְיֶ֨ה בָהֶ֥ם א֛וֹב א֥וֹ יִדְּעֹנִ֖י מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֑תוּ בָּאֶ֛בֶן יִרְגְּמ֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם דְּמֵיהֶ֥ם בָּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: A man or a woman who has a ghost or a familiar spirit shall be put to death; they shall be pelted with stones—and they shall retain the bloodguilt.
Transliteration: veiysh vo-ishah khiy-yiheyeh vahem vov vo yideoniy mvot yumatu vaeven yiregemu otam demeyhem vam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֱמֹ֥ר אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֑ן וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם לְנֶ֥פֶשׁ לֹֽא־יִטַּמָּ֖א בְּעַמָּֽיו׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them: None shall defile himself for any [dead] person among his kin,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh emor el-hakhohaniym veney aharon veamareta alehem lenefesh lo-yitama veamayv

Hebrew: כִּ֚י אִם־לִשְׁאֵר֔וֹ הַקָּרֹ֖ב אֵלָ֑יו לְאִמּ֣וֹ וּלְאָבִ֔יו וְלִבְנ֥וֹ וּלְבִתּ֖וֹ וּלְאָחִֽיו׃
Translated: except for the relatives that are closest to him: his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, and his brother;
Transliteration: khiy im-lisheervo hakarov elayv leimvo uleaviyv velivenvo ulevitvo uleachiyv

Hebrew: וְלַאֲחֹת֤וֹ הַבְּתוּלָה֙ הַקְּרוֹבָ֣ה אֵלָ֔יו אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־הָיְתָ֖ה לְאִ֑ישׁ לָ֖הּ יִטַּמָּֽא׃
Translated: also for a virgin sister, close to him because she has not become someone’s [wife], for her he may defile himself.
Transliteration: velaachotvo havetulah hakervovah elayv asher lo-hayetah leiysh lah yitama

Hebrew: לֹ֥א יִטַּמָּ֖א בַּ֣עַל בְּעַמָּ֑יו לְהֵ֖חַלּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But he shall not defile himself as a kinsman by marriage, and so profane himself.
Transliteration: lo yitama vaal veamayv lehechalvo

Hebrew: לֹֽא־[יִקְרְח֤וּ] (יקרחה) קׇרְחָה֙ בְּרֹאשָׁ֔ם וּפְאַ֥ת זְקָנָ֖ם לֹ֣א יְגַלֵּ֑חוּ וּבִ֨בְשָׂרָ֔ם לֹ֥א יִשְׂרְט֖וּ שָׂרָֽטֶת׃
Translated: They shall not shave smooth any part of their heads, or cut the side-growth of their beards, or make gashes in their flesh.
Transliteration: lo-[yikerechu] (ykrchh) kׇrechah verosham ufeat zekanam lo yegalechu uvivesharam lo yisheretu sharatet

Hebrew: קְדֹשִׁ֤ים יִהְיוּ֙ לֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם וְלֹ֣א יְחַלְּל֔וּ שֵׁ֖ם אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ם כִּי֩ אֶת־אִשֵּׁ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה לֶ֧חֶם אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֛ם הֵ֥ם מַקְרִיבִ֖ם וְהָ֥יוּ קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: They shall be holy to their God and not profane the name of their God; for they offer יהוה’s offerings by fire, the food of their God, and so must be holy.
Transliteration: kedoshiym yiheyu leloheyhem velo yechalelu shem eloheyhem khiy et-ishey yehovah lechem eloheyhem hem makeriyvim vehayu kodesh

Hebrew: אִשָּׁ֨ה זֹנָ֤ה וַחֲלָלָה֙ לֹ֣א יִקָּ֔חוּ וְאִשָּׁ֛ה גְּרוּשָׁ֥ה מֵאִישָׁ֖הּ לֹ֣א יִקָּ֑חוּ כִּֽי־קָדֹ֥שׁ ה֖וּא לֵאלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: They shall not take [into their household as their wife] a woman defiled by harlotry, nor shall they take one divorced from her husband. For they are holy to their God
Transliteration: ishah zonah vachalalah lo yikachu veishah gerushah meiyshah lo yikachu khiy-kadosh hu lelohayv

Hebrew: וְקִ֨דַּשְׁתּ֔וֹ כִּֽי־אֶת־לֶ֥חֶם אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ ה֣וּא מַקְרִ֑יב קָדֹשׁ֙ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֔ךְ כִּ֣י קָד֔וֹשׁ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: and you must treat them as holy, since they offer the food of your God; they shall be holy to you, for I יהוה who sanctify you am holy.
Transliteration: vekidashetvo khiy-et-lechem eloheykha hu makeriyv kadosh yiheyeh-lakhe khiy kadvosh aniy yehovah mekadishekhem

Hebrew: וּבַת֙ אִ֣ישׁ כֹּהֵ֔ן כִּ֥י תֵחֵ֖ל לִזְנ֑וֹת אֶת־אָבִ֙יהָ֙ הִ֣יא מְחַלֶּ֔לֶת בָּאֵ֖שׁ תִּשָּׂרֵֽף׃ {ס}
Translated: When the daughter of a priest defiles herself through harlotry, it is her father whom she defiles; she shall be put to the fire.
Transliteration: uvat iysh khohen khiy techel lizenvot et-aviyha hiy mechalelet vaesh tisharef {s}

Hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֵן֩ הַגָּד֨וֹל מֵאֶחָ֜יו אֲֽשֶׁר־יוּצַ֥ק עַל־רֹאשׁ֣וֹ ׀ שֶׁ֤מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה֙ וּמִלֵּ֣א אֶת־יָד֔וֹ לִלְבֹּ֖שׁ אֶת־הַבְּגָדִ֑ים אֶת־רֹאשׁוֹ֙ לֹ֣א יִפְרָ֔ע וּבְגָדָ֖יו לֹ֥א יִפְרֹֽם׃
Translated: The priest who is exalted above his fellows, on whose head the anointing oil has been poured and who has been ordained to wear the vestments, shall not bare his head or rend his vestments.
Transliteration: vehakhohen hagadvol meechayv asher-yutsak al-roshvo shemen hamishechah umile et-yadvo lilevosh et-havegadiym et-roshvo lo yifera uvegadayv lo yiferom

Hebrew: וְעַ֛ל כׇּל־נַפְשֹׁ֥ת מֵ֖ת לֹ֣א יָבֹ֑א לְאָבִ֥יו וּלְאִמּ֖וֹ לֹ֥א יִטַּמָּֽא׃
Translated: He shall not go in where there is any dead body; he shall not defile himself even for his father or mother.
Transliteration: veal khׇl-nafeshot met lo yavo leaviyv uleimvo lo yitama

Hebrew: וּמִן־הַמִּקְדָּשׁ֙ לֹ֣א יֵצֵ֔א וְלֹ֣א יְחַלֵּ֔ל אֵ֖ת מִקְדַּ֣שׁ אֱלֹהָ֑יו כִּ֡י נֵ֠זֶר שֶׁ֣מֶן מִשְׁחַ֧ת אֱלֹהָ֛יו עָלָ֖יו אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He shall not go outside the sanctuary and profane the sanctuary of his God, for upon him is the distinction of the anointing oil of his God, Mine יהוה’s.
Transliteration: umin-hamikedash lo eitse velo yechalel et mikedash elohayv khiy nezer shemen mishechat elohayv alayv aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְה֕וּא אִשָּׁ֥ה בִבְתוּלֶ֖יהָ יִקָּֽח׃
Translated: He may take [into his household as his wife] only a woman who is a virgin.
Transliteration: vehu ishah vivetuleyha yikach

Hebrew: אַלְמָנָ֤ה וּגְרוּשָׁה֙ וַחֲלָלָ֣ה זֹנָ֔ה אֶת־אֵ֖לֶּה לֹ֣א יִקָּ֑ח כִּ֛י אִם־בְּתוּלָ֥ה מֵעַמָּ֖יו יִקַּ֥ח אִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: A widow, or a divorced woman, or one who is degraded by harlotry—such he may not take. Only a virgin of his own kin may he take as his wife—
Transliteration: alemanah ugerushah vachalalah zonah et-eleh lo yikach khiy im-vetulah meamayv yikach ishah

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־יְחַלֵּ֥ל זַרְע֖וֹ בְּעַמָּ֑יו כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: that he may not profane his offspring among his kin, for I יהוה have sanctified him.
Transliteration: velo-yechalel zarevo veamayv khiy aniy yehovah mekadeshvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke further to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֣ישׁ מִֽזַּרְעֲךָ֞ לְדֹרֹתָ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֥ה בוֹ֙ מ֔וּם לֹ֣א יִקְרַ֔ב לְהַקְרִ֖יב לֶ֥חֶם אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
Translated: Speak to Aaron and say: No man of your offspring throughout the ages who has a defect shall be qualified to offer the food of his God.
Transliteration: daver el-aharon lemor iysh mizareakha ledorotam asher yiheyeh vvo mum lo yikerav lehakeriyv lechem elohayv

Hebrew: כִּ֥י כׇל־אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ מ֖וּם לֹ֣א יִקְרָ֑ב אִ֤ישׁ עִוֵּר֙ א֣וֹ פִסֵּ֔חַ א֥וֹ חָרֻ֖ם א֥וֹ שָׂרֽוּעַ׃
Translated: No one at all who has a defect shall be qualified: no man who is blind, or lame, or has a limb too short or too long;
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-iysh asher-vvo mum lo yikerav iysh iver vo fisecha vo charum vo sharua

Hebrew: א֣וֹ אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֥ה ב֖וֹ שֶׁ֣בֶר רָ֑גֶל א֖וֹ שֶׁ֥בֶר יָֽד׃
Translated: no man who has a broken leg or a broken arm;
Transliteration: vo iysh asher-yiheyeh vvo shever ragel vo shever yad

Hebrew: אֽוֹ־גִבֵּ֣ן אוֹ־דַ֔ק א֖וֹ תְּבַלֻּ֣ל בְּעֵינ֑וֹ א֤וֹ גָרָב֙ א֣וֹ יַלֶּ֔פֶת א֖וֹ מְר֥וֹחַ אָֽשֶׁךְ׃
Translated: or who is a hunchback, or a dwarf, or who has a growth in his eye, or who has a boil-scar, or scurvy, or crushed testes.
Transliteration: vo-given vo-dak vo tevalul veeynvo vo garav vo yalefet vo mervocha ashekhe

Hebrew: כׇּל־אִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־בּ֣וֹ מ֗וּם מִזֶּ֙רַע֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֔ן לֹ֣א יִגַּ֔שׁ לְהַקְרִ֖יב אֶת־אִשֵּׁ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה מ֣וּם בּ֔וֹ אֵ֚ת לֶ֣חֶם אֱלֹהָ֔יו לֹ֥א יִגַּ֖שׁ לְהַקְרִֽיב׃
Translated: No man among the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall be qualified to offer יהוה’s offering by fire; having a defect, he shall not be qualified to offer the food of his God.
Transliteration: khׇl-iysh asher-vvo mum mizera aharon hakhohen lo yigash lehakeriyv et-ishey yehovah mum vvo et lechem elohayv lo yigash lehakeriyv

Hebrew: לֶ֣חֶם אֱלֹהָ֔יו מִקׇּדְשֵׁ֖י הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים וּמִן־הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים יֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated: He may eat of the food of his God, of the most holy as well as of the holy;
Transliteration: lechem elohayv mikׇdeshey hakodashiym umin-hakodashiym yokhel

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶל־הַפָּרֹ֜כֶת לֹ֣א יָבֹ֗א וְאֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ לֹ֥א יִגַּ֖שׁ כִּֽי־מ֣וּם בּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֤א יְחַלֵּל֙ אֶת־מִקְדָּשַׁ֔י כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃
Translated: but he shall not enter behind the curtain or come near the altar, for he has a defect. He shall not profane these places sacred to Me, for I יהוה have sanctified them.
Transliteration: akhe el-hafarokhet lo yavo veel-hamizevecha lo yigash khiy-mum vvo velo yechalel et-mikedashay khiy aniy yehovah mekadesham

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֑יו וְאֶֽל־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus Moses spoke to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-aharon veel-vanayv veel-khׇl-veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו וְיִנָּֽזְרוּ֙ מִקׇּדְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלֹ֥א יְחַלְּל֖וּ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשִׁ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵ֧ם מַקְדִּשִׁ֛ים לִ֖י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Instruct Aaron and his sons to be scrupulous about the sacred donations that the Israelite people consecrate to Me, lest they profane My holy name, Mine, יהוה’s.
Transliteration: daver el-aharon veel-vanayv veyinazeru mikׇdeshey veney-yisherael velo yechalelu et-shem kׇdeshiy asher hem makedishiym liy aniy yehovah

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם לְדֹרֹ֨תֵיכֶ֜ם כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ ׀ אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרַ֣ב מִכׇּל־זַרְעֲכֶ֗ם אֶל־הַקֳּדָשִׁים֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְדִּ֤ישׁוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְטֻמְאָת֖וֹ עָלָ֑יו וְנִכְרְתָ֞ה הַנֶּ֧פֶשׁ הַהִ֛וא מִלְּפָנַ֖י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Say to them: Throughout the ages, if any man among your offspring, while in a state of impurity, partakes of any sacred donation that the Israelite people may consecrate to יהוה, that person shall be cut off from before Me: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: emor alehem ledoroteykhem khׇl-iysh asher-yikerav mikhׇl-zareakhem el-hakodashiym asher yakediyshu veney-yisherael layhovah vetumeatvo alayv venikheretah hanefesh hahiv milefanay aniy yehovah

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ אִ֞ישׁ מִזֶּ֣רַע אַהֲרֹ֗ן וְה֤וּא צָר֙וּעַ֙ א֣וֹ זָ֔ב בַּקֳּדָשִׁים֙ לֹ֣א יֹאכַ֔ל עַ֖ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִטְהָ֑ר וְהַנֹּגֵ֙עַ֙ בְּכׇל־טְמֵא־נֶ֔פֶשׁ א֣וֹ אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־תֵּצֵ֥א מִמֶּ֖נּוּ שִׁכְבַת־זָֽרַע׃
Translated: No man of Aaron’s offspring who has an eruption or a discharge shall eat of the sacred donations until he is pure. If one touches anything made impure by a corpse, or if a man has an emission of semen,
Transliteration: iysh iysh mizera aharon vehu tsarua vo zav vakodashiym lo yokhal ad asher yitehar vehanogea vekhׇl-teme-nefesh vo iysh asher-tetse mimenu shikhevat-zara

Hebrew: אוֹ־אִישׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִגַּ֔ע בְּכׇל־שֶׁ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִטְמָא־ל֑וֹ א֤וֹ בְאָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִטְמָא־ל֔וֹ לְכֹ֖ל טֻמְאָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: or if a man touches any swarming thing by which he is made impure or any human being by whom he is made impure—whatever his impurity—
Transliteration: vo-iysh asher yiga vekhׇl-sherets asher yitema-lvo vo veadam asher yitema-lvo lekhol tumeatvo

Hebrew: נֶ֚פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּגַּע־בּ֔וֹ וְטָמְאָ֖ה עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְלֹ֤א יֹאכַל֙ מִן־הַקֳּדָשִׁ֔ים כִּ֛י אִם־רָחַ֥ץ בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: the person who touches such shall be impure until evening and shall not eat of the sacred donations unless he has washed his body in water.
Transliteration: nefesh asher tiga-vvo vetameah ad-haarev velo yokhal min-hakodashiym khiy im-rachats vesharvo vamayiim

Hebrew: וּבָ֥א הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ וְטָהֵ֑ר וְאַחַר֙ יֹאכַ֣ל מִן־הַקֳּדָשִׁ֔ים כִּ֥י לַחְמ֖וֹ הֽוּא׃
Translated: As soon as the sun sets, he shall be pure; and afterward he may eat of the sacred donations, for they are his food.
Transliteration: uva hashemesh vetaher veachar yokhal min-hakodashiym khiy lachemvo hu

Hebrew: נְבֵלָ֧ה וּטְרֵפָ֛ה לֹ֥א יֹאכַ֖ל לְטׇמְאָה־בָ֑הּ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He shall not eat anything that died or was torn by beasts, thereby becoming impure: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: nevelah uterefah lo yokhal letׇmeah-vah aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֣וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמַרְתִּ֗י וְלֹֽא־יִשְׂא֤וּ עָלָיו֙ חֵ֔טְא וּמֵ֥תוּ ב֖וֹ כִּ֣י יְחַלְּלֻ֑הוּ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃
Translated: They shall keep My charge, lest they incur guilt thereby and die for it, having committed profanation: I יהוה consecrate them.
Transliteration: veshameru et-mishemaretiy velo-yisheu alayv chete umetu vvo khiy yechaleluhu aniy yehovah mekadesham

Hebrew: וְכׇל־זָ֖ר לֹא־יֹ֣אכַל קֹ֑דֶשׁ תּוֹשַׁ֥ב כֹּהֵ֛ן וְשָׂכִ֖יר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: No lay person shall eat of the sacred donations. No bound or hired laborer of a priest shall eat of the sacred donations;
Transliteration: vekhׇl-zar lo-yokhal kodesh tvoshav khohen veshakhiyr lo-yokhal kodesh

Hebrew: וְכֹהֵ֗ן כִּֽי־יִקְנֶ֥ה נֶ֙פֶשׁ֙ קִנְיַ֣ן כַּסְפּ֔וֹ ה֖וּא יֹ֣אכַל בּ֑וֹ וִילִ֣יד בֵּית֔וֹ הֵ֖ם יֹאכְל֥וּ בְלַחְמֽוֹ׃
Translated: but a person who is a priest’s property by purchase may eat of them; and those that are born into his household may eat of his food.
Transliteration: vekhohen khiy-yikeneh nefesh kineyan khasefvo hu yokhal vvo viyliyd veytvo hem yokhelu velachemvo

Hebrew: וּבַ֨ת־כֹּהֵ֔ן כִּ֥י תִהְיֶ֖ה לְאִ֣ישׁ זָ֑ר הִ֕וא בִּתְרוּמַ֥ת הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים לֹ֥א תֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated: If a priest’s daughter becomes a layman’s [wife], she may not eat of the sacred gifts;
Transliteration: uvat-khohen khiy tiheyeh leiysh zar hiv viterumat hakodashiym lo tokhel

Hebrew: וּבַת־כֹּהֵן֩ כִּ֨י תִהְיֶ֜ה אַלְמָנָ֣ה וּגְרוּשָׁ֗ה וְזֶ֘רַע֮ אֵ֣ין לָהּ֒ וְשָׁבָ֞ה אֶל־בֵּ֤ית אָבִ֙יהָ֙ כִּנְעוּרֶ֔יהָ מִלֶּ֥חֶם אָבִ֖יהָ תֹּאכֵ֑ל וְכׇל־זָ֖ר לֹא־יֹ֥אכַל בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: but if the priest’s daughter is widowed or divorced and without offspring, and is back in her father’s house as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s food. No lay person may eat of it:
Transliteration: uvat-khohen khiy tiheyeh alemanah ugerushah vezera eyn lah veshavah el-veyt aviyha khineureyha milechem aviyha tokhel vekhׇl-zar lo-yokhal vvo

Hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּֽי־יֹאכַ֥ל קֹ֖דֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָ֑ה וְיָסַ֤ף חֲמִֽשִׁיתוֹ֙ עָלָ֔יו וְנָתַ֥ן לַכֹּהֵ֖ן אֶת־הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: but if any such party eats of a sacred donation unwittingly, the priest shall be paid for the sacred donation, adding one-fifth of its value.
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-yokhal kodesh vishegagah veyasaf chamishiytvo alayv venatan lakhohen et-hakodesh

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א יְחַלְּל֔וּ אֶת־קׇדְשֵׁ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־יָרִ֖ימוּ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But [the priests] must not allow the Israelites to profane the sacred donations that they set aside for יהוה,
Transliteration: velo yechalelu et-kׇdeshey veney yisherael et asher-yariymu layhovah

Hebrew: וְהִשִּׂ֤יאוּ אוֹתָם֙ עֲוֺ֣ן אַשְׁמָ֔ה בְּאׇכְלָ֖ם אֶת־קׇדְשֵׁיהֶ֑ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדְּשָֽׁם׃ {פ}
Translated: or to incur guilt requiring a penalty payment, by eating such sacred donations: for it is I יהוה who make them sacred.
Transliteration: vehishiyu votam avon ashemah veׇkhelam et-kׇdesheyhem khiy aniy yehovah mekadesham {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֨ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־בָּנָ֗יו וְאֶל֙ כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֣ישׁ אִישׁ֩ מִבֵּ֨ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּמִן־הַגֵּ֣ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְרִ֤יב קׇרְבָּנוֹ֙ לְכׇל־נִדְרֵיהֶם֙ וּלְכׇל־נִדְבוֹתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֥יבוּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה לְעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Speak to Aaron and his sons, and to all the Israelite people, and say to them: When any person of the house of Israel or of the strangers in Israel presents a burnt offering as the offering for any of the votive or any of the freewill offerings that they offer to יהוה,
Transliteration: daver el-aharon veel-vanayv veel khׇl-veney yisherael veamareta alehem iysh iysh miveyt yisherael umin-hager veyisherael asher yakeriyv kׇrevanvo lekhׇl-nidereyhem ulekhׇl-nidevvotam asher-yakeriyvu layhovah leolah

Hebrew: לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֑ם תָּמִ֣ים זָכָ֔ר בַּבָּקָ֕ר בַּכְּשָׂבִ֖ים וּבָֽעִזִּֽים׃
Translated: it must, to be acceptable in your favor, be a male without blemish, from cattle or sheep or goats.
Transliteration: liretsonekhem tamiym zakhar vavakar vakheshaviym uvaiziym

Hebrew: כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־בּ֥וֹ מ֖וּם לֹ֣א תַקְרִ֑יבוּ כִּי־לֹ֥א לְרָצ֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not offer any that has a defect, for it will not be accepted in your favor.
Transliteration: khol asher-vvo mum lo takeriyvu khiy-lo leratsvon yiheyeh lakhem

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ כִּֽי־יַקְרִ֤יב זֶֽבַח־שְׁלָמִים֙ לַיהֹוָ֔ה לְפַלֵּא־נֶ֙דֶר֙ א֣וֹ לִנְדָבָ֔ה בַּבָּקָ֖ר א֣וֹ בַצֹּ֑אן תָּמִ֤ים יִֽהְיֶה֙ לְרָצ֔וֹן כׇּל־מ֖וּם לֹ֥א יִהְיֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when any party offers, from the herd or the flock, a sacrifice of well-being to יהוה for an explicit vow or as a freewill offering, it must, to be acceptable, be without blemish; there must be no defect in it.
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-yakeriyv zevach-shelamiym layhovah lefale-neder vo linedavah vavakar vo vatson tamiym yiheyeh leratsvon khׇl-mum lo yiheyeh-vvo

Hebrew: עַוֶּ֩רֶת֩ א֨וֹ שָׁב֜וּר אוֹ־חָר֣וּץ אֽוֹ־יַבֶּ֗לֶת א֤וֹ גָרָב֙ א֣וֹ יַלֶּ֔פֶת לֹא־תַקְרִ֥יבוּ אֵ֖לֶּה לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְאִשֶּׁ֗ה לֹא־תִתְּנ֥וּ מֵהֶ֛ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Anything blind, or injured, or maimed, or with a wen, boil-scar, or scurvy—such you shall not offer to יהוה; you shall not put any of them on the altar as offerings by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: averet vo shavur vo-charuts vo-yavelet vo garav vo yalefet lo-takeriyvu eleh layhovah veisheh lo-titenu mehem al-hamizevecha layhovah

Hebrew: וְשׁ֥וֹר וָשֶׂ֖ה שָׂר֣וּעַ וְקָל֑וּט נְדָבָה֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ וּלְנֵ֖דֶר לֹ֥א יֵרָצֶֽה׃
Translated: You may, however, present as a freewill offering an ox or a sheep with a limb extended or contracted; but it will not be accepted for a vow.
Transliteration: veshvor vasheh sharua vekalut nedavah taasheh otvo uleneder lo eiratseh

Hebrew: וּמָע֤וּךְ וְכָתוּת֙ וְנָת֣וּק וְכָר֔וּת לֹ֥א תַקְרִ֖יבוּ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וּֽבְאַרְצְכֶ֖ם לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: You shall not offer to יהוה anything [with its testes] bruised or crushed or torn or cut. You shall have no such practices in your own land,
Transliteration: umaukhe vekhatut venatuk vekharut lo takeriyvu layhovah uvearetsekhem lo taashu

Hebrew: וּמִיַּ֣ד בֶּן־נֵכָ֗ר לֹ֥א תַקְרִ֛יבוּ אֶת־לֶ֥חֶם אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם מִכׇּל־אֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֣י מׇשְׁחָתָ֤ם בָּהֶם֙ מ֣וּם בָּ֔ם לֹ֥א יֵרָצ֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: nor shall you accept such [animals] from a foreigner for offering as food for your God, for they are mutilated, they have a defect; they shall not be accepted in your favor.
Transliteration: umiyad ven-nekhar lo takeriyvu et-lechem eloheykhem mikhׇl-eleh khiy mׇshechatam vahem mum vam lo eiratsu lakhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: שׁ֣וֹר אוֹ־כֶ֤שֶׂב אוֹ־עֵז֙ כִּ֣י יִוָּלֵ֔ד וְהָיָ֛ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים תַּ֣חַת אִמּ֑וֹ וּמִיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִי֙ וָהָ֔לְאָה יֵרָצֶ֕ה לְקׇרְבַּ֥ן אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: When an ox or a sheep or a goat is born, it shall stay seven days with its mother, and from the eighth day on it shall be acceptable as an offering by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: shvor vo-kheshev vo-ez khiy yivaled vehayah shiveat yamiym tachat imvo umiyyvom hashemiyniy vahaleah eiratseh lekׇrevan isheh layhovah

Hebrew: וְשׁ֖וֹר אוֹ־שֶׂ֑ה אֹת֣וֹ וְאֶת־בְּנ֔וֹ לֹ֥א תִשְׁחֲט֖וּ בְּי֥וֹם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: However, no animal from the herd or from the flock shall be slaughtered on the same day with its young.
Transliteration: veshvor vo-sheh otvo veet-venvo lo tishechatu veyvom echad

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־תִזְבְּח֥וּ זֶֽבַח־תּוֹדָ֖ה לַיהֹוָ֑ה לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֖ם תִּזְבָּֽחוּ׃
Translated: When you sacrifice a thanksgiving offering to יהוה, sacrifice it so that it may be acceptable in your favor.
Transliteration: vekhiy-tizevechu zevach-tvodah layhovah liretsonekhem tizevachu

Hebrew: בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ יֵאָכֵ֔ל לֹֽא־תוֹתִ֥ירוּ מִמֶּ֖נּוּ עַד־בֹּ֑קֶר אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: It shall be eaten on the same day; you shall not leave any of it until morning: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu eiakhel lo-tvotiyru mimenu ad-voker aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם֙ מִצְוֺתַ֔י וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall faithfully observe My commandments: I am יהוה.
Transliteration: ushemaretem mitsevotay vaashiytem otam aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א תְחַלְּלוּ֙ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשִׁ֔י וְנִ֨קְדַּשְׁתִּ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה מְקַדִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not profane My holy name, that I may be sanctified in the midst of the Israelite people—I יהוה who sanctify you,
Transliteration: velo techalelu et-shem kׇdeshiy venikedashetiy vetvokhe veney yisherael aniy yehovah mekadishekhem

Hebrew: הַמּוֹצִ֤יא אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: I who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God, I יהוה.
Transliteration: hamvotsiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim liheyvot lakhem lelohiym aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם מוֹעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־תִּקְרְא֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם מִקְרָאֵ֣י קֹ֑דֶשׁ אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֖ם מוֹעֲדָֽי׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: These are My fixed times, the fixed times of יהוה, which you shall proclaim as sacred occasions.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem mvoadey yehovah asher-tikereu otam mikeraey kodesh eleh hem mvoaday

Hebrew: שֵׁ֣שֶׁת יָמִים֮ תֵּעָשֶׂ֣ה מְלָאכָה֒ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י שַׁבַּ֤ת שַׁבָּתוֹן֙ מִקְרָא־קֹ֔דֶשׁ כׇּל־מְלָאכָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ שַׁבָּ֥ת הִוא֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה בְּכֹ֖ל מוֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: On six days work may be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a sabbath of complete rest, a sacred occasion. You shall do no work; it shall be a sabbath of יהוה throughout your settlements.
Transliteration: sheshet yamiym teasheh melakhah uvayyvom hasheviyiy shavat shavatvon mikera-kodesh khׇl-melakhah lo taashu shavat hiv layhovah vekhol mvoshevoteykhem {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה מוֹעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה מִקְרָאֵ֖י קֹ֑דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־תִּקְרְא֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם בְּמוֹעֲדָֽם׃
Translated: These are the set times of יהוה, the sacred occasions, which you shall celebrate each at its appointed time:
Transliteration: eleh mvoadey yehovah mikeraey kodesh asher-tikereu otam vemvoadam

Hebrew: בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר לַחֹ֖דֶשׁ בֵּ֣ין הָעַרְבָּ֑יִם פֶּ֖סַח לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, there shall be a passover offering to יהוה,
Transliteration: vachodesh harishvon vearevaah ashar lachodesh veyn haarevayiim fesach layhovah

Hebrew: וּבַחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר יוֹם֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֔ה חַ֥ג הַמַּצּ֖וֹת לַיהֹוָ֑ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים מַצּ֥וֹת תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: and on the fifteenth day of that month יהוה’s Feast of Unleavened Bread. You shall eat unleavened bread for seven days.
Transliteration: uvachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh hazeh chag hamatsvot layhovah shiveat yamiym matsvot tokhelu

Hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן מִקְרָא־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: On the first day you shall celebrate a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.
Transliteration: vayyvom harishvon mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֥ם אִשֶּׁ֛ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים בַּיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי֙ מִקְרָא־קֹ֔דֶשׁ כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Seven days you shall make offerings by fire to יהוה. The seventh day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.
Transliteration: vehikeravetem isheh layhovah shiveat yamiym vayyvom hasheviyiy mikera-kodesh khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־תָבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֲנִי֙ נֹתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם וּקְצַרְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־קְצִירָ֑הּ וַהֲבֵאתֶ֥ם אֶת־עֹ֛מֶר רֵאשִׁ֥ית קְצִירְכֶ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving to you and you reap its harvest, you shall bring the first sheaf of your harvest to the priest.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem khiy-tavou el-haarets asher aniy noten lakhem uketsaretem et-ketsiyrah vahavetem et-omer reshiyt ketsiyrekhem el-hakhohen

Hebrew: וְהֵנִ֧יף אֶת־הָעֹ֛מֶר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לִֽרְצֹנְכֶ֑ם מִֽמׇּחֳרַת֙ הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת יְנִיפֶ֖נּוּ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: He shall elevate the sheaf before יהוה for acceptance in your behalf; the priest shall elevate it on the day after the sabbath.
Transliteration: veheniyf et-haomer lifeney yehovah liretsonekhem mimׇchorat hashavat yeniyfenu hakhohen

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֕ם בְּי֥וֹם הֲנִֽיפְכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָעֹ֑מֶר כֶּ֣בֶשׂ תָּמִ֧ים בֶּן־שְׁנָת֛וֹ לְעֹלָ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: On the day that you elevate the sheaf, you shall offer as a burnt offering to יהוה a lamb of the first year without blemish.
Transliteration: vaashiytem veyvom haniyfekhem et-haomer khevesh tamiym ven-shenatvo leolah layhovah

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָתוֹ֩ שְׁנֵ֨י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֜ים סֹ֣לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֛מֶן אִשֶּׁ֥ה לַיהֹוָ֖ה רֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֑חַ וְנִסְכֹּ֥ה יַ֖יִן רְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִֽין׃
Translated: The meal offering with it shall be two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה; and the libation with it shall be of wine, a quarter of a hin.
Transliteration: uminechatvo sheney esheroniym solet velulah vashemen isheh layhovah reycha niychocha venisekhoh yayiin reviyit hahiyn

Hebrew: וְלֶ֩חֶם֩ וְקָלִ֨י וְכַרְמֶ֜ל לֹ֣א תֹֽאכְל֗וּ עַד־עֶ֙צֶם֙ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה עַ֚ד הֲבִ֣יאֲכֶ֔ם אֶת־קׇרְבַּ֖ן אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֑ם חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכֹ֖ל מֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Until that very day, until you have brought the offering of your God, you shall eat no bread or parched grain or fresh ears; it is a law for all time throughout the ages in all your settlements.
Transliteration: velechem vekaliy vekharemel lo tokhelu ad-etsem hayyvom hazeh ad haviyakhem et-kׇrevan eloheykhem chukat volam ledoroteykhem vekhol moshevoteykhem {s}

Hebrew: וּסְפַרְתֶּ֤ם לָכֶם֙ מִמׇּחֳרַ֣ת הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת מִיּוֹם֙ הֲבִ֣יאֲכֶ֔ם אֶת־עֹ֖מֶר הַתְּנוּפָ֑ה שֶׁ֥בַע שַׁבָּת֖וֹת תְּמִימֹ֥ת תִּהְיֶֽינָה׃
Translated: And from the day on which you bring the sheaf of elevation offering—the day after the sabbath—you shall count off seven weeks. They must be complete:
Transliteration: usefaretem lakhem mimׇchorat hashavat miyyvom haviyakhem et-omer hatenufah sheva shavatvot temiymot tiheyeynah

Hebrew: עַ֣ד מִֽמׇּחֳרַ֤ת הַשַּׁבָּת֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔ת תִּסְפְּר֖וּ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים י֑וֹם וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֛ם מִנְחָ֥ה חֲדָשָׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: you must count until the day after the seventh week—fifty days; then you shall bring an offering of new grain to יהוה.
Transliteration: ad mimׇchorat hashavat hasheviyit tiseferu chamishiym yvom vehikeravetem minechah chadashah layhovah

Hebrew: מִמּוֹשְׁבֹ֨תֵיכֶ֜ם תָּבִ֣יאּוּ ׀ לֶ֣חֶם תְּנוּפָ֗ה שְׁ֚תַּיִם שְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים סֹ֣לֶת תִּהְיֶ֔ינָה חָמֵ֖ץ תֵּאָפֶ֑ינָה בִּכּוּרִ֖ים לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall bring from your settlements two loaves of bread as an elevation offering; each shall be made of two-tenths of a measure of choice flour, baked after leavening, as first fruits to יהוה.
Transliteration: mimvoshevoteykhem taviyu lechem tenufah shetayim sheney esheroniym solet tiheyeynah chamets teafeynah vikhuriym layhovah

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֣ם עַל־הַלֶּ֗חֶם שִׁבְעַ֨ת כְּבָשִׂ֤ים תְּמִימִם֙ בְּנֵ֣י שָׁנָ֔ה וּפַ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר אֶחָ֖ד וְאֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם יִהְי֤וּ עֹלָה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וּמִנְחָתָם֙ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֔ם אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: With the bread you shall present, as burnt offerings to יהוה, seven yearling lambs without blemish, one bull of the herd, and two rams, with their meal offerings and libations, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה.
Transliteration: vehikeravetem al-halechem shiveat khevashiym temiymim veney shanah ufar ven-vakar echad veeylim shenayiim yiheyu olah layhovah uminechatam venisekheyhem isheh reycha-niychocha layhovah

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֛ם שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּ֑את וּשְׁנֵ֧י כְבָשִׂ֛ים בְּנֵ֥י שָׁנָ֖ה לְזֶ֥בַח שְׁלָמִֽים׃
Translated: You shall also offer one he-goat as a sin offering and two yearling lambs as a sacrifice of well-being.
Transliteration: vaashiytem sheiyr-iziym echad lechatat usheney khevashiym veney shanah lezevach shelamiym

Hebrew: וְהֵנִ֣יף הַכֹּהֵ֣ן <small>׀</small> אֹתָ֡ם עַל֩ לֶ֨חֶם הַבִּכֻּרִ֤ים תְּנוּפָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֖י כְּבָשִׂ֑ים קֹ֛דֶשׁ יִהְי֥וּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה לַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: The priest shall elevate these—the two lambs —together with the bread of first fruits as an elevation offering before יהוה; they shall be holy to יהוה, for the priest.
Transliteration: veheniyf hakhohen <small></small> otam al lechem havikhuriym tenufah lifeney yehovah al-sheney khevashiym kodesh yiheyu layhovah lakhohen

Hebrew: וּקְרָאתֶ֞ם בְּעֶ֣צֶם ׀ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם בְּכׇל־מוֹשְׁבֹ֥תֵיכֶ֖ם לְדֹרֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: On that same day you shall hold a celebration; it shall be a sacred occasion for you; you shall not work at your occupations. This is a law for all time in all your settlements, throughout the ages.
Transliteration: ukeratem veetsem hayyvom hazeh mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu chukat volam vekhׇl-mvoshevoteykhem ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: וּֽבְקֻצְרְכֶ֞ם אֶת־קְצִ֣יר אַרְצְכֶ֗ם לֹֽא־תְכַלֶּ֞ה פְּאַ֤ת שָֽׂדְךָ֙ בְּקֻצְרֶ֔ךָ וְלֶ֥קֶט קְצִירְךָ֖ לֹ֣א תְלַקֵּ֑ט לֶֽעָנִ֤י וְלַגֵּר֙ תַּעֲזֹ֣ב אֹתָ֔ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: And when you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not reap all the way to the edges of your field, or gather the gleanings of your harvest; you shall leave them for the poor and the stranger: I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: uvekutserekhem et-ketsiyr aretsekhem lo-tekhaleh feat shadekha vekutserekha veleket ketsiyrekha lo telaket leaniy velager taazov otam aniy yehovah eloheykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֗דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ שַׁבָּת֔וֹן זִכְר֥וֹן תְּרוּעָ֖ה מִקְרָא־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people thus: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall observe complete rest, a sacred occasion commemorated with loud blasts.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael lemor vachodesh hasheviyiy veechad lachodesh yiheyeh lakhem shavatvon zikhervon teruah mikera-kodesh

Hebrew: כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֥ם אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall not work at your occupations; and you shall bring an offering by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu vehikeravetem isheh layhovah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: אַ֡ךְ בֶּעָשׂ֣וֹר לַחֹ֩דֶשׁ֩ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֨י הַזֶּ֜ה י֧וֹם הַכִּפֻּרִ֣ים ה֗וּא מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֥ם אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Mark, the tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. It shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall practice self-denial, and you shall bring an offering by fire to יהוה;
Transliteration: akhe veashvor lachodesh hasheviyiy hazeh yvom hakhifuriym hu mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem veiniytem et-nafeshoteykhem vehikeravetem isheh layhovah

Hebrew: וְכׇל־מְלָאכָה֙ לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י י֤וֹם כִּפֻּרִים֙ ה֔וּא לְכַפֵּ֣ר עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: you shall do no work throughout that day. For it is a Day of Atonement, on which expiation is made on your behalf before your God יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-melakhah lo taashu veetsem hayyvom hazeh khiy yvom khifuriym hu lekhafer aleykhem lifeney yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֤י כׇל־הַנֶּ֙פֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־תְעֻנֶּ֔ה בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְנִכְרְתָ֖ה מֵֽעַמֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated: Indeed, any person who does not practice self-denial throughout that day shall be cut off from kin;
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-hanefesh asher lo-teuneh veetsem hayyvom hazeh venikheretah meameyha

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַנֶּ֗פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר תַּעֲשֶׂה֙ כׇּל־מְלָאכָ֔ה בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וְהַֽאֲבַדְתִּ֛י אֶת־הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: and whoever does any work throughout that day, I will cause that person to perish from among the people.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hanefesh asher taasheh khׇl-melakhah veetsem hayyvom hazeh vehaavadetiy et-hanefesh hahiv mikerev amah

Hebrew: כׇּל־מְלָאכָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בְּכֹ֖ל מֹשְׁבֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do no work whatever; it is a law for all time, throughout the ages in all your settlements.
Transliteration: khׇl-melakhah lo taashu chukat volam ledoroteykhem vekhol moshevoteykhem

Hebrew: שַׁבַּ֨ת שַׁבָּת֥וֹן הוּא֙ לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּתִשְׁעָ֤ה לַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בָּעֶ֔רֶב מֵעֶ֣רֶב עַד־עֶ֔רֶב תִּשְׁבְּת֖וּ שַׁבַּתְּכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall practice self-denial; on the ninth day of the month at evening, from evening to evening, you shall observe this your sabbath.
Transliteration: shavat shavatvon hu lakhem veiniytem et-nafeshoteykhem vetisheah lachodesh vaerev meerev ad-erev tishevetu shavatekhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֜ר י֗וֹם לַחֹ֤דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִי֙ הַזֶּ֔ה חַ֧ג הַסֻּכּ֛וֹת שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Say to the Israelite people: On the fifteenth day of this seventh month there shall be the Feast of Booths to יהוה, [to last] seven days.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael lemor vachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh hasheviyiy hazeh chag hasukhvot shiveat yamiym layhovah

Hebrew: בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן מִקְרָא־קֹ֑דֶשׁ כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations;
Transliteration: vayyvom harishvon mikera-kodesh khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu

Hebrew: שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים תַּקְרִ֥יבוּ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָ֑ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֡י מִקְרָא־קֹ֩דֶשׁ֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֜ם וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם אִשֶּׁ֤ה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ עֲצֶ֣רֶת הִ֔וא כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: seven days you shall bring offerings by fire to יהוה. On the eighth day you shall observe a sacred occasion and bring an offering by fire to יהוה; it is a solemn gathering: you shall not work at your occupations.
Transliteration: shiveat yamiym takeriyvu isheh layhovah vayyvom hashemiyniy mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem vehikeravetem isheh layhovah atseret hiv khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה מוֹעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־תִּקְרְא֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם מִקְרָאֵ֣י קֹ֑דֶשׁ לְהַקְרִ֨יב אִשֶּׁ֜ה לַיהֹוָ֗ה עֹלָ֧ה וּמִנְחָ֛ה זֶ֥בַח וּנְסָכִ֖ים דְּבַר־י֥וֹם בְּיוֹמֽוֹ׃
Translated: Those are the set times of יהוה that you shall celebrate as sacred occasions, bringing offerings by fire to יהוה —burnt offerings, meal offerings, sacrifices, and libations, on each day what is proper to it—
Transliteration: eleh mvoadey yehovah asher-tikereu otam mikeraey kodesh lehakeriyv isheh layhovah olah uminechah zevach unesakhiym devar-yvom veyvomvo

Hebrew: מִלְּבַ֖ד שַׁבְּתֹ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִלְּבַ֣ד מַתְּנֽוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם וּמִלְּבַ֤ד כׇּל־נִדְרֵיכֶם֙ וּמִלְּבַד֙ כׇּל־נִדְבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּתְּנ֖וּ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: apart from the sabbaths of יהוה, and apart from your gifts and from all your votive offerings and from all your freewill offerings that you give to יהוה.
Transliteration: milevad shavetot yehovah umilevad matenvoteykhem umilevad khׇl-nidereykhem umilevad khׇl-nidevoteykhem asher titenu layhovah

Hebrew: אַ֡ךְ בַּחֲמִשָּׁה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֜וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י בְּאׇסְפְּכֶם֙ אֶת־תְּבוּאַ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ תָּחֹ֥גּוּ אֶת־חַג־יְהֹוָ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים בַּיּ֤וֹם הָֽרִאשׁוֹן֙ שַׁבָּת֔וֹן וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֖י שַׁבָּתֽוֹן׃
Translated: Mark, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the yield of your land, you shall observe the festival of יהוה [to last] seven days: a complete rest on the first day, and a complete rest on the eighth day.
Transliteration: akhe vachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh hasheviyiy veׇsefekhem et-tevuat haarets tachogu et-chag-yehovah shiveat yamiym vayyvom harishvon shavatvon uvayyvom hashemiyniy shavatvon

Hebrew: וּלְקַחְתֶּ֨ם לָכֶ֜ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן פְּרִ֨י עֵ֤ץ הָדָר֙ כַּפֹּ֣ת תְּמָרִ֔ים וַעֲנַ֥ף עֵץ־עָבֹ֖ת וְעַרְבֵי־נָ֑חַל וּשְׂמַחְתֶּ֗ם לִפְנֵ֛י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: On the first day you shall take the product of hadar trees, branches of palm trees, boughs of leafy trees, and willows of the brook, and you shall rejoice before your God יהוה seven days.
Transliteration: ulekachetem lakhem vayyvom harishvon feriy ets hadar khafot temariym vaanaf ets-avot vearevey-nachal ushemachetem lifeney yehovah eloheykhem shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְחַגֹּתֶ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ חַ֣ג לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִ֖ים בַּשָּׁנָ֑ה חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י תָּחֹ֥גּוּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall observe it as a festival of יהוה for seven days in the year; you shall observe it in the seventh month as a law for all time, throughout the ages.
Transliteration: vechagotem otvo chag layhovah shiveat yamiym vashanah chukat volam ledoroteykhem vachodesh hasheviyiy tachogu otvo

Hebrew: בַּסֻּכֹּ֥ת תֵּשְׁב֖וּ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים כׇּל־הָֽאֶזְרָח֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל יֵשְׁב֖וּ בַּסֻּכֹּֽת׃
Translated: You shall live in booths seven days; all citizens in Israel shall live in booths,
Transliteration: vasukhot teshevu shiveat yamiym khׇl-haezerach veyisherael eishevu vasukhot

Hebrew: לְמַ֘עַן֮ יֵדְע֣וּ דֹרֹֽתֵיכֶם֒ כִּ֣י בַסֻּכּ֗וֹת הוֹשַׁ֙בְתִּי֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּהוֹצִיאִ֥י אוֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: in order that future generations may know that I made the Israelite people live in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt—I, your God יהוה.
Transliteration: lemaan eideu doroteykhem khiy vasukhvot hvoshavetiy et-veney yisherael vehvotsiyiy votam meerets mitserayiim aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶֽת־מֹעֲדֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: So Moses declared to the Israelites the set times of יהוה.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh et-moadey yehovah el-veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: צַ֞ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֨וּ אֵלֶ֜יךָ שֶׁ֣מֶן זַ֥יִת זָ֛ךְ כָּתִ֖ית לַמָּא֑וֹר לְהַעֲלֹ֥ת נֵ֖ר תָּמִֽיד׃
Translated: Command the Israelite people to bring you clear oil of beaten olives for lighting, for kindling lamps regularly.
Transliteration: tsav et-veney yisherael veyikechu eleykha shemen zayiit zakhe khatiyt lamavor lehaalot ner tamiyd

Hebrew: מִחוּץ֩ לְפָרֹ֨כֶת הָעֵדֻ֜ת בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֗ד יַעֲרֹךְ֩ אֹת֨וֹ אַהֲרֹ֜ן מֵעֶ֧רֶב עַד־בֹּ֛קֶר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה תָּמִ֑יד חֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹֽתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Aaron shall set them up in the Tent of Meeting outside the curtain of the Pact [to burn] from evening to morning before יהוה regularly; it is a law for all time throughout the ages.
Transliteration: michuts lefarokhet haedut veohel mvoed yaarokhe otvo aharon meerev ad-voker lifeney yehovah tamiyd chukat volam ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: עַ֚ל הַמְּנֹרָ֣ה הַטְּהֹרָ֔ה יַעֲרֹ֖ךְ אֶת־הַנֵּר֑וֹת לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה תָּמִֽיד׃ {פ}
Translated: He shall set up the lamps on the pure lampstand before יהוה [to burn] regularly.
Transliteration: al hamenorah hatehorah yaarokhe et-hanervot lifeney yehovah tamiyd {f}

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֣ סֹ֔לֶת וְאָפִיתָ֣ אֹתָ֔הּ שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה חַלּ֑וֹת שְׁנֵי֙ עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים יִהְיֶ֖ה הַֽחַלָּ֥ה הָאֶחָֽת׃
Translated: You shall take choice flour and bake of it twelve loaves, two-tenths of a measure for each loaf.
Transliteration: velakacheta solet veafiyta otah sheteym eshereh chalvot sheney esheroniym yiheyeh hachalah haechat

Hebrew: וְשַׂמְתָּ֥ אוֹתָ֛ם שְׁתַּ֥יִם מַֽעֲרָכ֖וֹת שֵׁ֣שׁ הַֽמַּעֲרָ֑כֶת עַ֛ל הַשֻּׁלְחָ֥ן הַטָּהֹ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Place them on the pure table before יהוה in two rows, six to a row.
Transliteration: veshameta votam shetayiim maarakhvot shesh hamaarakhet al hashulechan hatahor lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֥ עַל־הַֽמַּעֲרֶ֖כֶת לְבֹנָ֣ה זַכָּ֑ה וְהָיְתָ֤ה לַלֶּ֙חֶם֙ לְאַזְכָּרָ֔ה אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: With each row you shall place pure frankincense, which is to be a token offering for the bread, as an offering by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: venatata al-hamaarekhet levonah zakhah vehayetah lalechem leazekharah isheh layhovah

Hebrew: בְּי֨וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֜ת בְּי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּ֗ת יַֽעַרְכֶ֛נּוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה תָּמִ֑יד מֵאֵ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּרִ֥ית עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: He shall arrange them before יהוה regularly every sabbath day—it is a commitment for all time on the part of the Israelites.
Transliteration: veyvom hashavat veyvom hashavat yaarekhenu lifeney yehovah tamiyd meet veney-yisherael veriyt volam

Hebrew: וְהָֽיְתָה֙ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּלְבָנָ֔יו וַאֲכָלֻ֖הוּ בְּמָק֣וֹם קָדֹ֑שׁ כִּ֡י קֹ֩דֶשׁ֩ קׇֽדָשִׁ֨ים ה֥וּא ל֛וֹ מֵאִשֵּׁ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה חׇק־עוֹלָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: They shall belong to Aaron and his sons, who shall eat them in the sacred precinct; for they are his as most holy things from יהוה’s offerings by fire, a due for all time.
Transliteration: vehayetah leaharon ulevanayv vaakhaluhu vemakvom kadosh khiy kodesh kׇdashiym hu lvo meishey yehovah chׇk-volam {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ בֶּן־אִשָּׁ֣ה יִשְׂרְאֵלִ֔ית וְהוּא֙ בֶּן־אִ֣ישׁ מִצְרִ֔י בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּנָּצוּ֙ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה בֶּ֚ן הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִ֔ית וְאִ֖ישׁ הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִֽי׃
Translated: There came out among the Israelites a man whose mother was Israelite and whose father was Egyptian. And a fight broke out in the camp between that half-Israelite and a certain Israelite.
Transliteration: vayetse ven-ishah yishereeliyt vehu ven-iysh mitseriy vetvokhe veney yisherael vayinatsu vamachaneh ven hayishereeliyt veiysh hayishereeliy

Hebrew: וַ֠יִּקֹּ֠ב בֶּן־הָֽאִשָּׁ֨ה הַיִּשְׂרְאֵלִ֤ית אֶת־הַשֵּׁם֙ וַיְקַלֵּ֔ל וַיָּבִ֥יאוּ אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וְשֵׁ֥ם אִמּ֛וֹ שְׁלֹמִ֥ית בַּת־דִּבְרִ֖י לְמַטֵּה־דָֽן׃
Translated: The son of the Israelite woman pronounced the Name in blasphemy, and he was brought to Moses—now his mother’s name was Shelomith daughter of Dibri of the tribe of Dan—
Transliteration: vayikov ven-haishah hayishereeliyt et-hashem vayekalel vayaviyu otvo el-mosheh veshem imvo shelomiyt vat-diveriy lemateh-dan

Hebrew: וַיַּנִּיחֻ֖הוּ בַּמִּשְׁמָ֑ר לִפְרֹ֥שׁ לָהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: and he was placed in custody, until the decision of יהוה should be made clear to them.
Transliteration: vayaniychuhu vamishemar liferosh lahem al-fiy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: הוֹצֵ֣א אֶת־הַֽמְקַלֵּ֗ל אֶל־מִחוּץ֙ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְסָמְכ֧וּ כׇֽל־הַשֹּׁמְעִ֛ים אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְרָגְמ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ כׇּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: Take the blasphemer outside the camp; and let all who were within hearing lay their hands upon his head, and let the community leadership stone him.
Transliteration: hvotse et-hamekalel el-michuts lamachaneh vesamekhu khׇl-hashomeiym et-yedeyhem al-roshvo veragemu otvo khׇl-haedah

Hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֥ישׁ אִ֛ישׁ כִּֽי־יְקַלֵּ֥ל אֱלֹהָ֖יו וְנָשָׂ֥א חֶטְאֽוֹ׃
Translated: And to the Israelite people speak thus: Anyone who blasphemes God shall bear the guilt;
Transliteration: veel-veney yisherael tedaver lemor iysh iysh khiy-yekalel elohayv venasha chetevo

Hebrew: וְנֹקֵ֤ב שֵׁם־יְהֹוָה֙ מ֣וֹת יוּמָ֔ת רָג֥וֹם יִרְגְּמוּ־ב֖וֹ כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֑ה כַּגֵּר֙ כָּֽאֶזְרָ֔ח בְּנׇקְבוֹ־שֵׁ֖ם יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: and one who also pronounces the name יהוה shall be put to death. The community leadership shall stone that person; stranger or citizen—having thus pronounced the Name—shall be put to death.
Transliteration: venokev shem-yehovah mvot yumat ragvom yiregemu-vvo khׇl-haedah khager khaezerach venׇkevvo-shem yumat

Hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּ֥י יַכֶּ֖ה כׇּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֑ם מ֖וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: If any party kills any human being, that person shall be put to death.
Transliteration: veiysh khiy yakheh khׇl-nefesh adam mvot yumat

Hebrew: וּמַכֵּ֥ה נֶֽפֶשׁ־בְּהֵמָ֖ה יְשַׁלְּמֶ֑נָּה נֶ֖פֶשׁ תַּ֥חַת נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated: One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it: life for life.
Transliteration: umakheh nefesh-vehemah yeshalemenah nefesh tachat nafesh

Hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּֽי־יִתֵּ֥ן מ֖וּם בַּעֲמִית֑וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֔ה כֵּ֖ן יֵעָ֥שֶׂה לּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If any party maims another [person]: what was done shall be done in return—
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-yiten mum vaamiytvo khaasher ashah khen eiasheh lvo

Hebrew: שֶׁ֚בֶר תַּ֣חַת שֶׁ֔בֶר עַ֚יִן תַּ֣חַת עַ֔יִן שֵׁ֖ן תַּ֣חַת שֵׁ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֥ן מוּם֙ בָּֽאָדָ֔ם כֵּ֖ן יִנָּ֥תֶן בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. The injury inflicted on a human being shall be inflicted in return.
Transliteration: shever tachat shever ayiin tachat ayiin shen tachat shen khaasher yiten mum vaadam khen yinaten vvo

Hebrew: וּמַכֵּ֥ה בְהֵמָ֖ה יְשַׁלְּמֶ֑נָּה וּמַכֵּ֥ה אָדָ֖ם יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: One who kills a beast shall make restitution for it; but one who kills a human being shall be put to death.
Transliteration: umakheh vehemah yeshalemenah umakheh adam yumat

Hebrew: מִשְׁפַּ֤ט אֶחָד֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כַּגֵּ֥ר כָּאֶזְרָ֖ח יִהְיֶ֑ה כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall have one standard for stranger and citizen alike: for I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: mishefat echad yiheyeh lakhem khager khaezerach yiheyeh khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁה֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וַיּוֹצִ֣יאוּ אֶת־הַֽמְקַלֵּ֗ל אֶל־מִחוּץ֙ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיִּרְגְּמ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ אָ֑בֶן וּבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עָשׂ֔וּ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses spoke thus to the Israelites. And they took the blasphemer outside the camp and pelted him with stones. The Israelites did as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-veney yisherael vayyvotsiyu et-hamekalel el-michuts lamachaneh vayiregemu otvo aven uveney-yisherael ashu khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּהַ֥ר סִינַ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses on Mount Sinai:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh vehar siynay lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כִּ֤י תָבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י נֹתֵ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם וְשָׁבְתָ֣ה הָאָ֔רֶץ שַׁבָּ֖ת לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I assign to you, the land shall observe a sabbath of יהוה.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem khiy tavou el-haarets asher aniy noten lakhem veshavetah haarets shavat layhovah

Hebrew: שֵׁ֤שׁ שָׁנִים֙ תִּזְרַ֣ע שָׂדֶ֔ךָ וְשֵׁ֥שׁ שָׁנִ֖ים תִּזְמֹ֣ר כַּרְמֶ֑ךָ וְאָסַפְתָּ֖ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
Translated: Six years you may sow your field and six years you may prune your vineyard and gather in the yield.
Transliteration: shesh shaniym tizera shadekha veshesh shaniym tizemor kharemekha veasafeta et-tevuatah

Hebrew: וּבַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗ת שַׁבַּ֤ת שַׁבָּתוֹן֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָאָ֔רֶץ שַׁבָּ֖ת לַיהֹוָ֑ה שָֽׂדְךָ֙ לֹ֣א תִזְרָ֔ע וְכַרְמְךָ֖ לֹ֥א תִזְמֹֽר׃
Translated: But in the seventh year the land shall have a sabbath of complete rest, a sabbath of יהוה: you shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.
Transliteration: uvashanah hasheviyit shavat shavatvon yiheyeh laarets shavat layhovah shadekha lo tizera vekharemekha lo tizemor

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת סְפִ֤יחַ קְצִֽירְךָ֙ לֹ֣א תִקְצ֔וֹר וְאֶת־עִנְּבֵ֥י נְזִירֶ֖ךָ לֹ֣א תִבְצֹ֑ר שְׁנַ֥ת שַׁבָּת֖וֹן יִהְיֶ֥ה לָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: You shall not reap the aftergrowth of your harvest or gather the grapes of your untrimmed vines; it shall be a year of complete rest for the land.
Transliteration: et sefiycha ketsiyrekha lo tiketsvor veet-inevey neziyrekha lo tivetsor shenat shavatvon yiheyeh laarets

Hebrew: וְ֠הָיְתָ֠ה שַׁבַּ֨ת הָאָ֤רֶץ לָכֶם֙ לְאׇכְלָ֔ה לְךָ֖ וּלְעַבְדְּךָ֣ וְלַאֲמָתֶ֑ךָ וְלִשְׂכִֽירְךָ֙ וּלְתוֹשָׁ֣בְךָ֔ הַגָּרִ֖ים עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: But you may eat whatever the land during its sabbath will produce—you, your male and female slaves, the hired and bound laborers who live with you,
Transliteration: vehayetah shavat haarets lakhem leׇkhelah lekha uleavedekha velaamatekha velishekhiyrekha uletvoshavekha hagariym imakhe

Hebrew: וְלִ֨בְהֶמְתְּךָ֔ וְלַֽחַיָּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאַרְצֶ֑ךָ תִּהְיֶ֥ה כׇל־תְּבוּאָתָ֖הּ לֶאֱכֹֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: and your cattle and the beasts in your land may eat all its yield.
Transliteration: velivehemetekha velachayah asher vearetsekha tiheyeh khׇl-tevuatah leekhol {s}

Hebrew: וְסָפַרְתָּ֣ לְךָ֗ שֶׁ֚בַע שַׁבְּתֹ֣ת שָׁנִ֔ים שֶׁ֥בַע שָׁנִ֖ים שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וְהָי֣וּ לְךָ֗ יְמֵי֙ שֶׁ֚בַע שַׁבְּתֹ֣ת הַשָּׁנִ֔ים תֵּ֥שַׁע וְאַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: You shall count off seven weeks of years—seven times seven years—so that the period of seven weeks of years gives you a total of forty-nine years.
Transliteration: vesafareta lekha sheva shavetot shaniym sheva shaniym sheva feamiym vehayu lekha yemey sheva shavetot hashaniym tesha vearevaiym shanah

Hebrew: וְהַֽעֲבַרְתָּ֞ שׁוֹפַ֤ר תְּרוּעָה֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִעִ֔י בֶּעָשׂ֖וֹר לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ בְּיוֹם֙ הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים תַּעֲבִ֥ירוּ שׁוֹפָ֖ר בְּכׇל־אַרְצְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Then you shall sound the horn loud; in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month—the Day of Atonement—you shall have the horn sounded throughout your land
Transliteration: vehaavareta shvofar teruah vachodesh hasheviiy veashvor lachodesh veyvom hakhifuriym taaviyru shvofar vekhׇl-aretsekhem

Hebrew: וְקִדַּשְׁתֶּ֗ם אֵ֣ת שְׁנַ֤ת הַחֲמִשִּׁים֙ שָׁנָ֔ה וּקְרָאתֶ֥ם דְּר֛וֹר בָּאָ֖רֶץ לְכׇל־יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ יוֹבֵ֥ל הִוא֙ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְשַׁבְתֶּ֗ם אִ֚ישׁ אֶל־אֲחֻזָּת֔וֹ וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתּ֖וֹ תָּשֻֽׁבוּ׃
Translated: and you shall hallow the fiftieth year. You shall proclaim release throughout the land for all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you: each of you shall return to your holding and each of you shall return to your family.
Transliteration: vekidashetem et shenat hachamishiym shanah ukeratem dervor vaarets lekhׇl-yosheveyha yvovel hiv tiheyeh lakhem veshavetem iysh el-achuzatvo veiysh el-mishefachetvo tashuvu

Hebrew: יוֹבֵ֣ל הִ֗וא שְׁנַ֛ת הַחֲמִשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם לֹ֣א תִזְרָ֔עוּ וְלֹ֤א תִקְצְרוּ֙ אֶת־סְפִיחֶ֔יהָ וְלֹ֥א תִבְצְר֖וּ אֶת־נְזִרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee for you: you shall not sow, neither shall you reap the aftergrowth or harvest the untrimmed vines,
Transliteration: yvovel hiv shenat hachamishiym shanah tiheyeh lakhem lo tizerau velo tiketseru et-sefiycheyha velo tivetseru et-nezireyha

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יוֹבֵ֣ל הִ֔וא קֹ֖דֶשׁ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם מִ֨ן־הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה תֹּאכְל֖וּ אֶת־תְּבוּאָתָֽהּ׃
Translated: for it is a jubilee. It shall be holy to you: you may only eat the growth direct from the field.
Transliteration: khiy yvovel hiv kodesh tiheyeh lakhem min-hashadeh tokhelu et-tevuatah

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֥ת הַיּוֹבֵ֖ל הַזֹּ֑את תָּשֻׁ֕בוּ אִ֖ישׁ אֶל־אֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: In this year of jubilee, each of you shall return to your holding.
Transliteration: vishenat hayyvovel hazot tashuvu iysh el-achuzatvo

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־תִמְכְּר֤וּ מִמְכָּר֙ לַעֲמִיתֶ֔ךָ א֥וֹ קָנֹ֖ה מִיַּ֣ד עֲמִיתֶ֑ךָ אַל־תּוֹנ֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ אֶת־אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: When you sell property to your neighbor, or buy any from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another.
Transliteration: vekhiy-timekheru mimekhar laamiytekha vo kanoh miyad amiytekha al-tvonu iysh et-achiyv

Hebrew: בְּמִסְפַּ֤ר שָׁנִים֙ אַחַ֣ר הַיּוֹבֵ֔ל תִּקְנֶ֖ה מֵאֵ֣ת עֲמִיתֶ֑ךָ בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר שְׁנֵֽי־תְבוּאֹ֖ת יִמְכׇּר־לָֽךְ׃
Translated: In buying from your neighbor, you shall deduct only for the number of years since the jubilee; and in selling to you, that person shall charge you only for the remaining crop years:
Transliteration: vemisefar shaniym achar hayyvovel tikeneh meet amiytekha vemisefar sheney-tevuot yimekhׇr-lakhe

Hebrew: לְפִ֣י ׀ רֹ֣ב הַשָּׁנִ֗ים תַּרְבֶּה֙ מִקְנָת֔וֹ וּלְפִי֙ מְעֹ֣ט הַשָּׁנִ֔ים תַּמְעִ֖יט מִקְנָת֑וֹ כִּ֚י מִסְפַּ֣ר תְּבוּאֹ֔ת ה֥וּא מֹכֵ֖ר לָֽךְ׃
Translated: the more such years, the higher the price you pay; the fewer such years, the lower the price; for what is being sold to you is a number of harvests.
Transliteration: lefiy rov hashaniym tareveh mikenatvo ulefiy meot hashaniym tameiyt mikenatvo khiy misefar tevuot hu mokher lakhe

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א תוֹנוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־עֲמִית֔וֹ וְיָרֵ֖אתָ מֵֽאֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not wrong one another, but fear your God; for I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: velo tvonu iysh et-amiytvo veyareta meeloheykha khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶם֙ אֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֔י וְאֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֥י תִּשְׁמְר֖וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֣ם אֹתָ֑ם וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ לָבֶֽטַח׃
Translated: You shall observe My laws and faithfully keep My rules, that you may live upon the land in security;
Transliteration: vaashiytem et-chukotay veet-mishefatay tishemeru vaashiytem otam viyshavetem al-haarets lavetach

Hebrew: וְנָתְנָ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ פִּרְיָ֔הּ וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם לָשֹׂ֑בַע וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֥ם לָבֶ֖טַח עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: the land shall yield its fruit and you shall eat your fill, and you shall live upon it in security.
Transliteration: venatenah haarets fireyah vaakhaletem lashova viyshavetem lavetach aleyha

Hebrew: וְכִ֣י תֹאמְר֔וּ מַה־נֹּאכַ֖ל בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑ת הֵ֚ן לֹ֣א נִזְרָ֔ע וְלֹ֥א נֶאֱסֹ֖ף אֶת־תְּבוּאָתֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: And should you ask, “What are we to eat in the seventh year, if we may neither sow nor gather in our crops?”
Transliteration: vekhiy tomeru mah-nokhal vashanah hasheviyit hen lo nizera velo neesof et-tevuatenu

Hebrew: וְצִוִּ֤יתִי אֶת־בִּרְכָתִי֙ לָכֶ֔ם בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַשִּׁשִּׁ֑ית וְעָשָׂת֙ אֶת־הַתְּבוּאָ֔ה לִשְׁלֹ֖שׁ הַשָּׁנִֽים׃
Translated: I will ordain My blessing for you in the sixth year, so that it shall yield a crop sufficient for three years.
Transliteration: vetsiviytiy et-virekhatiy lakhem vashanah hashishiyt veashat et-hatevuah lishelosh hashaniym

Hebrew: וּזְרַעְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשְּׁמִינִ֔ת וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם מִן־הַתְּבוּאָ֣ה יָשָׁ֑ן עַ֣ד ׀ הַשָּׁנָ֣ה הַתְּשִׁיעִ֗ת עַד־בּוֹא֙ תְּב֣וּאָתָ֔הּ תֹּאכְל֖וּ יָשָֽׁן׃
Translated: When you sow in the eighth year, you will still be eating old grain of that crop; you will be eating the old until the ninth year, until its crops come in.
Transliteration: uzeraetem et hashanah hashemiynit vaakhaletem min-hatevuah yashan ad hashanah hateshiyit ad-vvo tevuatah tokhelu yashan

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֗רֶץ לֹ֤א תִמָּכֵר֙ לִצְמִתֻ֔ת כִּי־לִ֖י הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־גֵרִ֧ים וְתוֹשָׁבִ֛ים אַתֶּ֖ם עִמָּדִֽי׃
Translated: But the land must not be sold beyond reclaim, for the land is Mine; you are but strangers resident with Me.
Transliteration: vehaarets lo timakher litsemitut khiy-liy haarets khiy-geriym vetvoshaviym atem imadiy

Hebrew: וּבְכֹ֖ל אֶ֣רֶץ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶ֑ם גְּאֻלָּ֖ה תִּתְּנ֥וּ לָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: Throughout the land that you hold, you must provide for the redemption of the land.
Transliteration: uvekhol erets achuzatekhem geulah titenu laarets {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־יָמ֣וּךְ אָחִ֔יךָ וּמָכַ֖ר מֵאֲחֻזָּת֑וֹ וּבָ֤א גֹֽאֲלוֹ֙ הַקָּרֹ֣ב אֵלָ֔יו וְגָאַ֕ל אֵ֖ת מִמְכַּ֥ר אָחִֽיו׃
Translated: If one of your kin is in straits and has to sell part of a holding, the nearest redeemer shall come and redeem what that relative has sold.
Transliteration: khiy-yamukhe achiykha umakhar meachuzatvo uva goalvo hakarov elayv vegaal et mimekhar achiyv

Hebrew: וְאִ֕ישׁ כִּ֛י לֹ֥א יִֽהְיֶה־לּ֖וֹ גֹּאֵ֑ל וְהִשִּׂ֣יגָה יָד֔וֹ וּמָצָ֖א כְּדֵ֥י גְאֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: If any party has no one to be redeemer but prospers and acquires enough to redeem with,
Transliteration: veiysh khiy lo yiheyeh-lvo goel vehishiygah yadvo umatsa khedey geulatvo

Hebrew: וְחִשַּׁב֙ אֶת־שְׁנֵ֣י מִמְכָּר֔וֹ וְהֵשִׁיב֙ אֶת־הָ֣עֹדֵ֔ף לָאִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָֽכַר־ל֑וֹ וְשָׁ֖ב לַאֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: the years since its sale shall be computed and the difference shall be refunded to the party to whom it was sold, so that the person returns to that holding.
Transliteration: vechishav et-sheney mimekharvo veheshiyv et-haodef laiysh asher makhar-lvo veshav laachuzatvo

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם לֹֽא־מָצְאָ֜ה יָד֗וֹ דֵּי֮ הָשִׁ֣יב לוֹ֒ וְהָיָ֣ה מִמְכָּר֗וֹ בְּיַד֙ הַקֹּנֶ֣ה אֹת֔וֹ עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיּוֹבֵ֑ל וְיָצָא֙ בַּיֹּבֵ֔ל וְשָׁ֖ב לַאֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: If that person lacks sufficient means to recover it, what was sold shall remain with the purchaser until the jubilee; in the jubilee year it shall be released, so that the person returns to that holding.
Transliteration: veim lo-matseah yadvo dey hashiyv lvo vehayah mimekharvo veyad hakoneh otvo ad shenat hayyvovel veyatsa vayovel veshav laachuzatvo {s}

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ כִּֽי־יִמְכֹּ֤ר בֵּית־מוֹשַׁב֙ עִ֣יר חוֹמָ֔ה וְהָיְתָה֙ גְּאֻלָּת֔וֹ עַד־תֹּ֖ם שְׁנַ֣ת מִמְכָּר֑וֹ יָמִ֖ים תִּהְיֶ֥ה גְאֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: If any party sells a dwelling house in a walled city, it may be redeemed until a year has elapsed since its sale; the redemption period shall be a year.
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-yimekhor veyt-mvoshav iyr chvomah vehayetah geulatvo ad-tom shenat mimekharvo yamiym tiheyeh geulatvo

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם לֹֽא־יִגָּאֵ֗ל עַד־מְלֹ֣את לוֹ֮ שָׁנָ֣ה תְמִימָה֒ וְ֠קָ֠ם הַבַּ֨יִת אֲשֶׁר־בָּעִ֜יר אֲשֶׁר־[ל֣וֹ] (לא) חֹמָ֗ה לַצְּמִיתֻ֛ת לַקֹּנֶ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ לְדֹרֹתָ֑יו לֹ֥א יֵצֵ֖א בַּיֹּבֵֽל׃
Translated: If it is not redeemed before a full year has elapsed, the house in the walled city shall pass to the purchaser beyond reclaim throughout the ages; it shall not be released in the jubilee.
Transliteration: veim lo-yigael ad-melot lvo shanah temiymah vekam havayiit asher-vaiyr asher-[lvo] (l) chomah latsemiytut lakoneh otvo ledorotayv lo eitse vayovel

Hebrew: וּבָתֵּ֣י הַחֲצֵרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר אֵין־לָהֶ֤ם חֹמָה֙ סָבִ֔יב עַל־שְׂדֵ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ יֵחָשֵׁ֑ב גְּאֻלָּה֙ תִּהְיֶה־לּ֔וֹ וּבַיֹּבֵ֖ל יֵצֵֽא׃
Translated: But houses in villages that have no encircling walls shall be classed as open country: they may be redeemed, and they shall be released through the jubilee.
Transliteration: uvatey hachatseriym asher eyn-lahem chomah saviyv al-shedeh haarets eichashev geulah tiheyeh-lvo uvayovel eitse

Hebrew: וְעָרֵי֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם בָּתֵּ֖י עָרֵ֣י אֲחֻזָּתָ֑ם גְּאֻלַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם תִּהְיֶ֥ה לַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: As for the cities of Levi, the houses in the cities it holds: Levi shall forever have the right of redemption.
Transliteration: vearey haleviyim vatey arey achuzatam geulat volam tiheyeh laleviyim

Hebrew: וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר יִגְאַל֙ מִן־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וְיָצָ֧א מִמְכַּר־בַּ֛יִת וְעִ֥יר אֲחֻזָּת֖וֹ בַּיֹּבֵ֑ל כִּ֣י בָתֵּ֞י עָרֵ֣י הַלְוִיִּ֗ם הִ֚וא אֲחֻזָּתָ֔ם בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Such property as may be redeemed from Levi—houses sold in a city it holds—shall be released through the jubilee; for the houses in the cities of Levi are its holding among the Israelites.
Transliteration: vaasher yigeal min-haleviyim veyatsa mimekhar-vayiit veiyr achuzatvo vayovel khiy vatey arey haleviyim hiv achuzatam vetvokhe veney yisherael

Hebrew: וּֽשְׂדֵ֛ה מִגְרַ֥שׁ עָרֵיהֶ֖ם לֹ֣א יִמָּכֵ֑ר כִּֽי־אֲחֻזַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֛ם ה֖וּא לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: But the unenclosed land about its cities cannot be sold, for that is its holding for all time.
Transliteration: ushedeh migerash areyhem lo yimakher khiy-achuzat volam hu lahem {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָמ֣וּךְ אָחִ֔יךָ וּמָ֥טָה יָד֖וֹ עִמָּ֑ךְ וְהֶֽחֱזַ֣קְתָּ בּ֔וֹ גֵּ֧ר וְתוֹשָׁ֛ב וָחַ֖י עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: If your kin, being in straits, come under your authority, and are held by you as though resident aliens, let them live by your side:
Transliteration: vekhiy-yamukhe achiykha umatah yadvo imakhe vehechezaketa vvo ger vetvoshav vachay imakhe

Hebrew: אַל־תִּקַּ֤ח מֵֽאִתּוֹ֙ נֶ֣שֶׁךְ וְתַרְבִּ֔ית וְיָרֵ֖אתָ מֵֽאֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ וְחֵ֥י אָחִ֖יךָ עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: do not exact advance or accrued interest, but fear your God. Let your kin live by your side as such.
Transliteration: al-tikach meitvo neshekhe vetareviyt veyareta meeloheykha vechey achiykha imakhe

Hebrew: אֶ֨ת־כַּסְפְּךָ֔ לֹֽא־תִתֵּ֥ן ל֖וֹ בְּנֶ֑שֶׁךְ וּבְמַרְבִּ֖ית לֹא־תִתֵּ֥ן אׇכְלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Do not lend your money at advance interest, nor give your food at accrued interest.
Transliteration: et-khasefekha lo-titen lvo veneshekhe uvemareviyt lo-titen ׇkhelekha

Hebrew: אֲנִ֗י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לָתֵ֤ת לָכֶם֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: I יהוה am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, to be your God.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah eloheykhem asher-hvotsetiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim latet lakhem et-erets khenaan liheyvot lakhem lelohiym {s}

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָמ֥וּךְ אָחִ֛יךָ עִמָּ֖ךְ וְנִמְכַּר־לָ֑ךְ לֹא־תַעֲבֹ֥ד בּ֖וֹ עֲבֹ֥דַת עָֽבֶד׃
Translated: If your kin under you continue in straits and must be given over to you, do not subject them to the treatment of a slave.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yamukhe achiykha imakhe venimekhar-lakhe lo-taavod vvo avodat aved

Hebrew: כְּשָׂכִ֥יר כְּתוֹשָׁ֖ב יִהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֑ךְ עַד־שְׁנַ֥ת הַיֹּבֵ֖ל יַעֲבֹ֥ד עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Remaining with you as a hired or bound laborer, they shall serve with you only until the jubilee year.
Transliteration: kheshakhiyr khetvoshav yiheyeh imakhe ad-shenat hayovel yaavod imakhe

Hebrew: וְיָצָא֙ מֵֽעִמָּ֔ךְ ה֖וּא וּבָנָ֣יו עִמּ֑וֹ וְשָׁב֙ אֶל־מִשְׁפַּחְתּ֔וֹ וְאֶל־אֲחֻזַּ֥ת אֲבֹתָ֖יו יָשֽׁוּב׃
Translated: Then they, along with any children, shall be free of your authority; they shall go back to their family and return to the ancestral holding.—
Transliteration: veyatsa meimakhe hu uvanayv imvo veshav el-mishefachetvo veel-achuzat avotayv yashuv

Hebrew: כִּֽי־עֲבָדַ֣י הֵ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם לֹ֥א יִמָּכְר֖וּ מִמְכֶּ֥רֶת עָֽבֶד׃
Translated: For they are My servants, whom I freed from the land of Egypt; they may not give themselves over into servitude.—
Transliteration: khiy-avaday hem asher-hvotsetiy otam meerets mitserayiim lo yimakheru mimekheret aved

Hebrew: לֹא־תִרְדֶּ֥ה ב֖וֹ בְּפָ֑רֶךְ וְיָרֵ֖אתָ מֵאֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: You shall not rule over them ruthlessly; you shall fear your God.
Transliteration: lo-tiredeh vvo vefarekhe veyareta meeloheykha

Hebrew: וְעַבְדְּךָ֥ וַאֲמָתְךָ֖ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִהְיוּ־לָ֑ךְ מֵאֵ֣ת הַגּוֹיִ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֙ סְבִיבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם מֵהֶ֥ם תִּקְנ֖וּ עֶ֥בֶד וְאָמָֽה׃
Translated: Such male and female slaves as you may have—it is from the nations round about you that you may acquire male and female slaves.
Transliteration: veavedekha vaamatekha asher yiheyu-lakhe meet hagvoyim asher seviyvoteykhem mehem tikenu eved veamah

Hebrew: וְ֠גַ֠ם מִבְּנֵ֨י הַתּוֹשָׁבִ֜ים הַגָּרִ֤ים עִמָּכֶם֙ מֵהֶ֣ם תִּקְנ֔וּ וּמִמִּשְׁפַּחְתָּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עִמָּכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר הוֹלִ֖ידוּ בְּאַרְצְכֶ֑ם וְהָי֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם לַֽאֲחֻזָּֽה׃
Translated: You may also buy them from among the children of aliens resident among you, or from their families that are among you, whom they begot in your land. These shall become your property:
Transliteration: vegam miveney hatvoshaviym hagariym imakhem mehem tikenu umimishefachetam asher imakhem asher hvoliydu vearetsekhem vehayu lakhem laachuzah

Hebrew: וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּ֨ם אֹתָ֜ם לִבְנֵיכֶ֤ם אַחֲרֵיכֶם֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֲחֻזָּ֔ה לְעֹלָ֖ם בָּהֶ֣ם תַּעֲבֹ֑דוּ וּבְאַ֨חֵיכֶ֤ם בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אִ֣ישׁ בְּאָחִ֔יו לֹא־תִרְדֶּ֥ה ב֖וֹ בְּפָֽרֶךְ׃ {ס}
Translated: you may keep them as a possession for your children after you, for them to inherit as property for all time. Such you may treat as slaves. But as for your Israelite kin, no one shall rule ruthlessly over another.
Transliteration: vehitenachaletem otam liveneykhem achareykhem lareshet achuzah leolam vahem taavodu uveacheykhem veney-yisherael iysh veachiyv lo-tiredeh vvo vefarekhe {s}

Hebrew: וְכִ֣י תַשִּׂ֗יג יַ֣ד גֵּ֤ר וְתוֹשָׁב֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ וּמָ֥ךְ אָחִ֖יךָ עִמּ֑וֹ וְנִמְכַּ֗ר לְגֵ֤ר תּוֹשָׁב֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ א֥וֹ לְעֵ֖קֶר מִשְׁפַּ֥חַת גֵּֽר׃
Translated: If a resident alien among you has prospered, and your kin, being in straits, comes under that one’s authority and is given over to the resident alien among you, or to an offshoot of an alien’s family,
Transliteration: vekhiy tashiyg yad ger vetvoshav imakhe umakhe achiykha imvo venimekhar leger tvoshav imakhe vo leeker mishefachat ger

Hebrew: אַחֲרֵ֣י נִמְכַּ֔ר גְּאֻלָּ֖ה תִּהְיֶה־לּ֑וֹ אֶחָ֥ד מֵאֶחָ֖יו יִגְאָלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: [your kin] shall have the right of redemption even after having been given over. [Typically,] a brother shall do the redeeming,
Transliteration: acharey nimekhar geulah tiheyeh-lvo echad meechayv yigealenu

Hebrew: אוֹ־דֹד֞וֹ א֤וֹ בֶן־דֹּדוֹ֙ יִגְאָלֶ֔נּוּ אֽוֹ־מִשְּׁאֵ֧ר בְּשָׂר֛וֹ מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּ֖וֹ יִגְאָלֶ֑נּוּ אֽוֹ־הִשִּׂ֥יגָה יָד֖וֹ וְנִגְאָֽל׃
Translated: or an uncle or an uncle’s son shall do the redeeming—anyone in the family who is of the same flesh shall do the redeeming; or, having prospered, [your formerly impoverished kin] may do the redeeming.
Transliteration: vo-dodvo vo ven-dodvo yigealenu vo-misheer vesharvo mimishefachetvo yigealenu vo-hishiygah yadvo venigeal

Hebrew: וְחִשַּׁב֙ עִם־קֹנֵ֔הוּ מִשְּׁנַת֙ הִמָּ֣כְרוֹ ל֔וֹ עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֑ל וְהָיָ֞ה כֶּ֤סֶף מִמְכָּרוֹ֙ בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שָׁנִ֔ים כִּימֵ֥י שָׂכִ֖יר יִהְיֶ֥ה עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: The total shall be computed with the purchaser as from the year of being given over to the other until the jubilee year; the price of sale shall be applied to the number of years, as though it were for a term as a hired laborer under the other’s authority.
Transliteration: vechishav im-konehu mishenat himakhervo lvo ad shenat hayovel vehayah khesef mimekharvo vemisefar shaniym khiymey shakhiyr yiheyeh imvo

Hebrew: אִם־ע֥וֹד רַבּ֖וֹת בַּשָּׁנִ֑ים לְפִיהֶן֙ יָשִׁ֣יב גְּאֻלָּת֔וֹ מִכֶּ֖סֶף מִקְנָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: If many years remain, [your kin] shall pay back for the redemption in proportion to the purchase price;
Transliteration: im-vod ravvot vashaniym lefiyhen yashiyv geulatvo mikhesef mikenatvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־מְעַ֞ט נִשְׁאַ֧ר בַּשָּׁנִ֛ים עַד־שְׁנַ֥ת הַיֹּבֵ֖ל וְחִשַּׁב־ל֑וֹ כְּפִ֣י שָׁנָ֔יו יָשִׁ֖יב אֶת־גְּאֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: and if few years remain until the jubilee year, so shall it be computed: payment shall be made for the redemption according to the years involved.
Transliteration: veim-meat nishear vashaniym ad-shenat hayovel vechishav-lvo khefiy shanayv yashiyv et-geulatvo

Hebrew: כִּשְׂכִ֥יר שָׁנָ֛ה בְּשָׁנָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֣ה עִמּ֑וֹ לֹֽא־יִרְדֶּ֥נּֽוּ בְּפֶ֖רֶךְ לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: One shall be under the other’s authority as a laborer hired by the year; the other shall not rule ruthlessly in your sight.
Transliteration: khishekhiyr shanah veshanah yiheyeh imvo lo-yiredenu veferekhe leeyneykha

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵ֖ל בְּאֵ֑לֶּה וְיָצָא֙ בִּשְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֔ל ה֖וּא וּבָנָ֥יו עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: If not redeemed in any of those ways, that person, along with any children, shall go free in the jubilee year.
Transliteration: veim-lo yigael veeleh veyatsa vishenat hayovel hu uvanayv imvo

Hebrew: כִּֽי־לִ֤י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ עֲבָדִ֔ים עֲבָדַ֣י הֵ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אוֹתָ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: For it is to Me that the Israelites are servants: they are My servants, whom I freed from the land of Egypt—I, your God יהוה.
Transliteration: khiy-liy veney-yisherael avadiym avaday hem asher-hvotsetiy votam meerets mitserayiim aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: לֹֽא־תַעֲשׂ֨וּ לָכֶ֜ם אֱלִילִ֗ם וּפֶ֤סֶל וּמַצֵּבָה֙ לֹֽא־תָקִ֣ימוּ לָכֶ֔ם וְאֶ֣בֶן מַשְׂכִּ֗ית לֹ֤א תִתְּנוּ֙ בְּאַרְצְכֶ֔ם לְהִֽשְׁתַּחֲוֺ֖ת עָלֶ֑יהָ כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall not make idols for yourselves, or set up for yourselves carved images or pillars, or place figured stones in your land to worship upon, for I יהוה am your God.
Transliteration: lo-taashu lakhem eliylim ufesel umatsevah lo-takiymu lakhem veeven mashekhiyt lo titenu vearetsekhem lehishetachavot aleyha khiy aniy yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתַ֣י תִּשְׁמֹ֔רוּ וּמִקְדָּשִׁ֖י תִּירָ֑אוּ אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall keep My sabbaths and venerate My sanctuary, Mine, יהוה’s.
Transliteration: et-shavetotay tishemoru umikedashiy tiyrau aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: אִם־בְּחֻקֹּתַ֖י תֵּלֵ֑כוּ וְאֶת־מִצְוֺתַ֣י תִּשְׁמְר֔וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: If you follow My laws and faithfully observe My commandments,
Transliteration: im-vechukotay telekhu veet-mitsevotay tishemeru vaashiytem otam

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י גִשְׁמֵיכֶ֖ם בְּעִתָּ֑ם וְנָתְנָ֤ה הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ יְבוּלָ֔הּ וְעֵ֥ץ הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה יִתֵּ֥ן פִּרְיֽוֹ׃
Translated: I will grant your rains in their season, so that the earth shall yield its produce and the trees of the field their fruit.
Transliteration: venatatiy gishemeykhem veitam venatenah haarets yevulah veets hashadeh yiten fireyvo

Hebrew: וְהִשִּׂ֨יג לָכֶ֥ם דַּ֙יִשׁ֙ אֶת־בָּצִ֔יר וּבָצִ֖יר יַשִּׂ֣יג אֶת־זָ֑רַע וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם לַחְמְכֶם֙ לָשֹׂ֔בַע וִֽישַׁבְתֶּ֥ם לָבֶ֖טַח בְּאַרְצְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Your threshing shall overtake the vintage, and your vintage shall overtake the sowing; you shall eat your fill of bread and dwell securely in your land.
Transliteration: vehishiyg lakhem dayiish et-vatsiyr uvatsiyr yashiyg et-zara vaakhaletem lachemekhem lashova viyshavetem lavetach vearetsekhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י שָׁלוֹם֙ בָּאָ֔רֶץ וּשְׁכַבְתֶּ֖ם וְאֵ֣ין מַחֲרִ֑יד וְהִשְׁבַּתִּ֞י חַיָּ֤ה רָעָה֙ מִן־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְחֶ֖רֶב לֹא־תַעֲבֹ֥ר בְּאַרְצְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will grant peace in the land, and you shall lie down untroubled by anyone; I will give the land respite from vicious beasts, and no sword shall cross your land.
Transliteration: venatatiy shalvom vaarets ushekhavetem veeyn machariyd vehishevatiy chayah raah min-haarets vecherev lo-taavor vearetsekhem

Hebrew: וּרְדַפְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם וְנָפְל֥וּ לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם לֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: [Your army] shall give chase to your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.
Transliteration: uredafetem et-oyeveykhem venafelu lifeneykhem lecharev

Hebrew: וְרָדְפ֨וּ מִכֶּ֤ם חֲמִשָּׁה֙ מֵאָ֔ה וּמֵאָ֥ה מִכֶּ֖ם רְבָבָ֣ה יִרְדֹּ֑פוּ וְנָפְל֧וּ אֹיְבֵיכֶ֛ם לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם לֶחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Five of you shall give chase to a hundred, and a hundred of you shall give chase to ten thousand; your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
Transliteration: veradefu mikhem chamishah meah umeah mikhem revavah yiredofu venafelu oyeveykhem lifeneykhem lecharev

Hebrew: וּפָנִ֣יתִי אֲלֵיכֶ֔ם וְהִפְרֵיתִ֣י אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהִרְבֵּיתִ֖י אֶתְכֶ֑ם וַהֲקִימֹתִ֥י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will look with favor upon you, and make you fertile and multiply you; and I will maintain My covenant with you.
Transliteration: ufaniytiy aleykhem vehifereytiy etekhem vehireveytiy etekhem vahakiymotiy et-veriytiy itekhem

Hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֥ם יָשָׁ֖ן נוֹשָׁ֑ן וְיָשָׁ֕ן מִפְּנֵ֥י חָדָ֖שׁ תּוֹצִֽיאוּ׃
Translated: You shall eat old grain long stored, and you shall have to clear out the old to make room for the new.
Transliteration: vaakhaletem yashan nvoshan veyashan mifeney chadash tvotsiyu

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֥י מִשְׁכָּנִ֖י בְּתוֹכְכֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־תִגְעַ֥ל נַפְשִׁ֖י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will establish My abode in your midst, and I will not spurn you.
Transliteration: venatatiy mishekhaniy vetvokhekhem velo-tigeal nafeshiy etekhem

Hebrew: וְהִתְהַלַּכְתִּי֙ בְּת֣וֹכְכֶ֔ם וְהָיִ֥יתִי לָכֶ֖ם לֵֽאלֹהִ֑ים וְאַתֶּ֖ם תִּהְיוּ־לִ֥י לְעָֽם׃
Translated: I will be ever present in your midst: I will be your God, and you shall be My people.
Transliteration: vehitehalakhetiy vetvokhekhem vehayiytiy lakhem lelohiym veatem tiheyu-liy leam

Hebrew: אֲנִ֞י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֤אתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם מִֽהְיֹ֥ת לָהֶ֖ם עֲבָדִ֑ים וָאֶשְׁבֹּר֙ מֹטֹ֣ת עֻלְּכֶ֔ם וָאוֹלֵ֥ךְ אֶתְכֶ֖ם קֽוֹמְמִיּֽוּת׃ {פ}
Translated: I יהוה am your God who brought you out from the land of the Egyptians to be their slaves no more, who broke the bars of your yoke and made you walk erect.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah eloheykhem asher hvotsetiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim miheyot lahem avadiym vaeshevor motot ulekhem vavolekhe etekhem kvomemiyyut {f}

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֥א תִשְׁמְע֖וּ לִ֑י וְלֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַמִּצְוֺ֖ת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: But if you do not obey Me and do not observe all these commandments,
Transliteration: veim-lo tishemeu liy velo taashu et khׇl-hamitsevot haeleh

Hebrew: וְאִם־בְּחֻקֹּתַ֣י תִּמְאָ֔סוּ וְאִ֥ם אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטַ֖י תִּגְעַ֣ל נַפְשְׁכֶ֑ם לְבִלְתִּ֤י עֲשׂוֹת֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתַ֔י לְהַפְרְכֶ֖ם אֶת־בְּרִיתִֽי׃
Translated: if you reject My laws and spurn My rules, so that you do not observe all My commandments and you break My covenant,
Transliteration: veim-vechukotay timeasu veim et-mishefatay tigeal nafeshekhem leviletiy ashvot et-khׇl-mitsevotay lehaferekhem et-veriytiy

Hebrew: אַף־אֲנִ֞י אֶֽעֱשֶׂה־זֹּ֣את לָכֶ֗ם וְהִפְקַדְתִּ֨י עֲלֵיכֶ֤ם בֶּֽהָלָה֙ אֶת־הַשַּׁחֶ֣פֶת וְאֶת־הַקַּדַּ֔חַת מְכַלּ֥וֹת עֵינַ֖יִם וּמְדִיבֹ֣ת נָ֑פֶשׁ וּזְרַעְתֶּ֤ם לָרִיק֙ זַרְעֲכֶ֔ם וַאֲכָלֻ֖הוּ אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I in turn will do this to you: I will wreak misery upon you—consumption and fever, which cause the eyes to pine and the body to languish; you shall sow your seed to no purpose, for your enemies shall eat it.
