Transliteration: af-aniy eesheh-zot lakhem vehifekadetiy aleykhem vehalah et-hashachefet veet-hakadachat mekhalvot eynayiim umediyvot nafesh uzeraetem lariyk zareakhem vaakhaluhu oyeveykhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י פָנַי֙ בָּכֶ֔ם וְנִגַּפְתֶּ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם וְרָד֤וּ בָכֶם֙ שֹֽׂנְאֵיכֶ֔ם וְנַסְתֶּ֖ם וְאֵין־רֹדֵ֥ף אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will set My face against you: you shall be routed by your enemies, and your foes shall dominate you. You shall flee though none pursues.
Transliteration: venatatiy fanay vakhem venigafetem lifeney oyeveykhem veradu vakhem shoneeykhem venasetem veeyn-rodef etekhem

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־עַד־אֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א תִשְׁמְע֖וּ לִ֑י וְיָסַפְתִּי֙ לְיַסְּרָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם שֶׁ֖בַע עַל־חַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And if, for all that, you do not obey Me, I will go on to discipline you sevenfold for your sins,
Transliteration: veim-ad-eleh lo tishemeu liy veyasafetiy leyaserah etekhem sheva al-chatoteykhem

Hebrew: וְשָׁבַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־גְּא֣וֹן עֻזְּכֶ֑ם וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־שְׁמֵיכֶם֙ כַּבַּרְזֶ֔ל וְאֶֽת־אַרְצְכֶ֖ם כַּנְּחֻשָֽׁה׃
Translated: and I will break your proud glory. I will make your skies like iron and your earth like copper,
Transliteration: veshavaretiy et-gevon uzekhem venatatiy et-shemeykhem khavarezel veet-aretsekhem khanechushah

Hebrew: וְתַ֥ם לָרִ֖יק כֹּחֲכֶ֑ם וְלֹֽא־תִתֵּ֤ן אַרְצְכֶם֙ אֶת־יְבוּלָ֔הּ וְעֵ֣ץ הָאָ֔רֶץ לֹ֥א יִתֵּ֖ן פִּרְיֽוֹ׃
Translated: so that your strength shall be spent to no purpose. Your land shall not yield its produce, nor shall the trees of the land yield their fruit.
Transliteration: vetam lariyk khochakhem velo-titen aretsekhem et-yevulah veets haarets lo yiten fireyvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־תֵּֽלְכ֤וּ עִמִּי֙ קֶ֔רִי וְלֹ֥א תֹאב֖וּ לִשְׁמֹ֣עַֽ לִ֑י וְיָסַפְתִּ֤י עֲלֵיכֶם֙ מַכָּ֔ה שֶׁ֖בַע כְּחַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And if you remain hostile toward Me and refuse to obey Me, I will go on smiting you sevenfold for your sins.
Transliteration: veim-telekhu imiy keriy velo tovu lishemoa liy veyasafetiy aleykhem makhah sheva khechatoteykhem

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁלַחְתִּ֨י בָכֶ֜ם אֶת־חַיַּ֤ת הַשָּׂדֶה֙ וְשִׁכְּלָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם וְהִכְרִ֙יתָה֙ אֶת־בְּהֶמְתְּכֶ֔ם וְהִמְעִ֖יטָה אֶתְכֶ֑ם וְנָשַׁ֖מּוּ דַּרְכֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will loose wild beasts against you, and they shall bereave you of your children and wipe out your cattle. They shall decimate you, and your roads shall be deserted.
Transliteration: vehishelachetiy vakhem et-chayat hashadeh veshikhelah etekhem vehikheriytah et-vehemetekhem vehimeiytah etekhem venashamu darekheykhem

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־בְּאֵ֔לֶּה לֹ֥א תִוָּסְר֖וּ לִ֑י וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֥ם עִמִּ֖י קֶֽרִי׃
Translated: And if these things fail to discipline you for Me, and you remain hostile to Me,
Transliteration: veim-veeleh lo tivaseru liy vahalakhetem imiy keriy

Hebrew: וְהָלַכְתִּ֧י אַף־אֲנִ֛י עִמָּכֶ֖ם בְּקֶ֑רִי וְהִכֵּיתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ גַּם־אָ֔נִי שֶׁ֖בַע עַל־חַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I too will remain hostile to you: I in turn will smite you sevenfold for your sins.
Transliteration: vehalakhetiy af-aniy imakhem vekeriy vehikheytiy etekhem gam-aniy sheva al-chatoteykhem

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתִ֨י עֲלֵיכֶ֜ם חֶ֗רֶב נֹקֶ֙מֶת֙ נְקַם־בְּרִ֔ית וְנֶאֱסַפְתֶּ֖ם אֶל־עָרֵיכֶ֑ם וְשִׁלַּ֤חְתִּי דֶ֙בֶר֙ בְּת֣וֹכְכֶ֔ם וְנִתַּתֶּ֖ם בְּיַד־אוֹיֵֽב׃
Translated: I will bring a sword against you to wreak vengeance for the covenant; and if you withdraw into your cities, I will send pestilence among you, and you shall be delivered into enemy hands.
Transliteration: vehevetiy aleykhem cherev nokemet nekam-veriyt veneesafetem el-areykhem veshilachetiy dever vetvokhekhem venitatem veyad-voeiv

Hebrew: בְּשִׁבְרִ֣י לָכֶם֮ מַטֵּה־לֶ֒חֶם֒ וְ֠אָפ֠וּ עֶ֣שֶׂר נָשִׁ֤ים לַחְמְכֶם֙ בְּתַנּ֣וּר אֶחָ֔ד וְהֵשִׁ֥יבוּ לַחְמְכֶ֖ם בַּמִּשְׁקָ֑ל וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם וְלֹ֥א תִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in a single oven; they shall dole out your bread by weight, and though you eat, you shall not be satisfied.
Transliteration: veshiveriy lakhem mateh-lechem veafu esher nashiym lachemekhem vetanur echad veheshiyvu lachemekhem vamishekal vaakhaletem velo tishevau {s}

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־בְּזֹ֔את לֹ֥א תִשְׁמְע֖וּ לִ֑י וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֥ם עִמִּ֖י בְּקֶֽרִי׃
Translated: But if, despite this, you disobey Me and remain hostile to Me,
Transliteration: veim-vezot lo tishemeu liy vahalakhetem imiy vekeriy

Hebrew: וְהָלַכְתִּ֥י עִמָּכֶ֖ם בַּחֲמַת־קֶ֑רִי וְיִסַּרְתִּ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ אַף־אָ֔נִי שֶׁ֖בַע עַל־חַטֹּאתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will act against you in wrathful hostility; I, for My part, will discipline you sevenfold for your sins.
Transliteration: vehalakhetiy imakhem vachamat-keriy veyisaretiy etekhem af-aniy sheva al-chatoteykhem

Hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֖ם בְּשַׂ֣ר בְּנֵיכֶ֑ם וּבְשַׂ֥ר בְּנֹתֵיכֶ֖ם תֹּאכֵֽלוּ׃
Translated: You shall eat the flesh of your sons and the flesh of your daughters.
Transliteration: vaakhaletem veshar veneykhem uveshar venoteykhem tokhelu

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁמַדְתִּ֞י אֶת־בָּמֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם וְהִכְרַתִּי֙ אֶת־חַמָּ֣נֵיכֶ֔ם וְנָֽתַתִּי֙ אֶת־פִּגְרֵיכֶ֔ם עַל־פִּגְרֵ֖י גִּלּוּלֵיכֶ֑ם וְגָעֲלָ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will destroy your cult places and cut down your incense stands, and I will heap your carcasses upon your lifeless fetishes. I will spurn you.
Transliteration: vehishemadetiy et-vamoteykhem vehikheratiy et-chamaneykhem venatatiy et-figereykhem al-figerey giluleykhem vegaalah nafeshiy etekhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתִּ֤י אֶת־עָֽרֵיכֶם֙ חׇרְבָּ֔ה וַהֲשִׁמּוֹתִ֖י אֶת־מִקְדְּשֵׁיכֶ֑ם וְלֹ֣א אָרִ֔יחַ בְּרֵ֖יחַ נִיחֹֽחֲכֶֽם׃
Translated: I will lay your cities in ruin and make your sanctuaries desolate, and I will not savor your pleasing odors.
Transliteration: venatatiy et-areykhem chׇrevah vahashimvotiy et-mikedesheykhem velo ariycha vereycha niychochakhem

Hebrew: וַהֲשִׁמֹּתִ֥י אֲנִ֖י אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְשָֽׁמְמ֤וּ עָלֶ֙יהָ֙ אֹֽיְבֵיכֶ֔ם הַיֹּשְׁבִ֖ים בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: I will make the land desolate, so that your enemies who settle in it shall be appalled by it.
Transliteration: vahashimotiy aniy et-haarets veshamemu aleyha oyeveykhem hayosheviym vah

Hebrew: וְאֶתְכֶם֙ אֱזָרֶ֣ה בַגּוֹיִ֔ם וַהֲרִיקֹתִ֥י אַחֲרֵיכֶ֖ם חָ֑רֶב וְהָיְתָ֤ה אַרְצְכֶם֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה וְעָרֵיכֶ֖ם יִהְי֥וּ חׇרְבָּֽה׃
Translated: And you I will scatter among the nations, and I will unsheath the sword against you. Your land shall become a desolation and your cities a ruin.
Transliteration: veetekhem ezareh vagvoyim vahariykotiy achareykhem charev vehayetah aretsekhem shemamah veareykhem yiheyu chׇrevah

Hebrew: אָז֩ תִּרְצֶ֨ה הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתֶ֗יהָ כֹּ֚ל יְמֵ֣י הׇשַּׁמָּ֔הֿ וְאַתֶּ֖ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם אָ֚ז תִּשְׁבַּ֣ת הָאָ֔רֶץ וְהִרְצָ֖ת אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Then shall the land make up for its sabbath years throughout the time that it is desolate and you are in the land of your enemies; then shall the land rest and make up for its sabbath years.
Transliteration: az tiretseh haarets et-shavetoteyha khol yemey hׇshamahֿ veatem veerets oyeveykhem az tishevat haarets vehiretsat et-shavetoteyha

Hebrew: כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י הׇשַּׁמָּ֖הֿ תִּשְׁבֹּ֑ת אֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־שָׁבְתָ֛ה בְּשַׁבְּתֹתֵיכֶ֖ם בְּשִׁבְתְּכֶ֥ם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Throughout the time that it is desolate, it shall observe the rest that it did not observe in your sabbath years while you were dwelling upon it.
Transliteration: khׇl-yemey hׇshamahֿ tishevot et asher lo-shavetah veshavetoteykhem veshivetekhem aleyha

Hebrew: וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בָּכֶ֔ם וְהֵבֵ֤אתִי מֹ֙רֶךְ֙ בִּלְבָבָ֔ם בְּאַרְצֹ֖ת אֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם וְרָדַ֣ף אֹתָ֗ם ק֚וֹל עָלֶ֣ה נִדָּ֔ף וְנָס֧וּ מְנֻֽסַת־חֶ֛רֶב וְנָפְל֖וּ וְאֵ֥ין רֹדֵֽף׃
Translated: As for those of you who survive, I will cast a faintness into their hearts in the land of their enemies. The sound of a driven leaf shall put them to flight. Fleeing as though from the sword, they shall fall though none pursues.
Transliteration: vehanisheariym vakhem vehevetiy morekhe vilevavam vearetsot oyeveyhem veradaf otam kvol aleh nidaf venasu menusat-cherev venafelu veeyn rodef

Hebrew: וְכָשְׁל֧וּ אִישׁ־בְּאָחִ֛יו כְּמִפְּנֵי־חֶ֖רֶב וְרֹדֵ֣ף אָ֑יִן וְלֹא־תִֽהְיֶ֤ה לָכֶם֙ תְּקוּמָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י אֹֽיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: With no one pursuing, they shall stumble over one another as before the sword. You shall not be able to stand your ground before your enemies,
Transliteration: vekhashelu iysh-veachiyv khemifeney-cherev verodef ayiin velo-tiheyeh lakhem tekumah lifeney oyeveykhem

Hebrew: וַאֲבַדְתֶּ֖ם בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם וְאָכְלָ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם אֶ֖רֶץ אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: but shall perish among the nations; and the land of your enemies shall consume you.
Transliteration: vaavadetem vagvoyim veakhelah etekhem erets oyeveykhem

Hebrew: וְהַנִּשְׁאָרִ֣ים בָּכֶ֗ם יִמַּ֙קּוּ֙ בַּֽעֲוֺנָ֔ם בְּאַרְצֹ֖ת אֹיְבֵיכֶ֑ם וְאַ֛ף בַּעֲוֺנֹ֥ת אֲבֹתָ֖ם אִתָּ֥ם יִמָּֽקּוּ׃
Translated: Those of you who survive shall be heartsick over their iniquity in the land of your enemies; more, they shall be heartsick over the iniquities of their forebears;
Transliteration: vehanisheariym vakhem yimaku vaavonam vearetsot oyeveykhem veaf vaavonot avotam itam yimaku

Hebrew: וְהִתְוַדּ֤וּ אֶת־עֲוֺנָם֙ וְאֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן אֲבֹתָ֔ם בְּמַעֲלָ֖ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר מָֽעֲלוּ־בִ֑י וְאַ֕ף אֲשֶׁר־הָֽלְכ֥וּ עִמִּ֖י בְּקֶֽרִי׃
Translated: and they shall confess their iniquity and the iniquity of their forebears, in that they trespassed against Me, yea, were hostile to Me.
Transliteration: vehitevadu et-avonam veet-avon avotam vemaalam asher maalu-viy veaf asher-halekhu imiy vekeriy

Hebrew: אַף־אֲנִ֗י אֵלֵ֤ךְ עִמָּם֙ בְּקֶ֔רִי וְהֵבֵאתִ֣י אֹתָ֔ם בְּאֶ֖רֶץ אֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם אוֹ־אָ֣ז יִכָּנַ֗ע לְבָבָם֙ הֶֽעָרֵ֔ל וְאָ֖ז יִרְצ֥וּ אֶת־עֲוֺנָֽם׃
Translated: When I, in turn, have been hostile to them and have removed them into the land of their enemies, then at last shall their obdurate heart humble itself, and they shall atone for their iniquity.
Transliteration: af-aniy elekhe imam vekeriy vehevetiy otam veerets oyeveyhem vo-az yikhana levavam hearel veaz yiretsu et-avonam

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתִּ֖י אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֣י יַעֲק֑וֹב וְאַף֩ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֨י יִצְחָ֜ק וְאַ֨ף אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֧י אַבְרָהָ֛ם אֶזְכֹּ֖ר וְהָאָ֥רֶץ אֶזְכֹּֽר׃
Translated: Then will I remember My covenant with Jacob; I will remember also My covenant with Isaac, and also My covenant with Abraham; and I will remember the land.
Transliteration: vezakharetiy et-veriytiy yaakvov veaf et-veriytiy yitsechak veaf et-veriytiy averaham ezekhor vehaarets ezekhor

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֩רֶץ֩ תֵּעָזֵ֨ב מֵהֶ֜ם וְתִ֣רֶץ אֶת־שַׁבְּתֹתֶ֗יהָ בׇּהְשַׁמָּהֿ֙ מֵהֶ֔ם וְהֵ֖ם יִרְצ֣וּ אֶת־עֲוֺנָ֑ם יַ֣עַן וּבְיַ֔עַן בְּמִשְׁפָּטַ֣י מָאָ֔סוּ וְאֶת־חֻקֹּתַ֖י גָּעֲלָ֥ה נַפְשָֽׁם׃
Translated: For the land shall be forsaken of them, making up for its sabbath years by being desolate of them, while they atone for their iniquity; for the abundant reason that they rejected My rules and spurned My laws.
Transliteration: vehaarets teazev mehem vetirets et-shavetoteyha vׇheshamahֿ mehem vehem yiretsu et-avonam yaan uveyaan vemishefatay maasu veet-chukotay gaalah nafesham

Hebrew: וְאַף־גַּם־זֹ֠את בִּֽהְיוֹתָ֞ם בְּאֶ֣רֶץ אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֗ם לֹֽא־מְאַסְתִּ֤ים וְלֹֽא־גְעַלְתִּים֙ לְכַלֹּתָ֔ם לְהָפֵ֥ר בְּרִיתִ֖י אִתָּ֑ם כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Yet, even then, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them or spurn them so as to destroy them, annulling My covenant with them: for I יהוה am their God.
Transliteration: veaf-gam-zot viheyvotam veerets oyeveyhem lo-measetiym velo-gealetiym lekhalotam lehafer veriytiy itam khiy aniy yehovah eloheyhem

Hebrew: וְזָכַרְתִּ֥י לָהֶ֖ם בְּרִ֣ית רִאשֹׁנִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוֹצֵֽאתִי־אֹתָם֩ מֵאֶ֨רֶץ מִצְרַ֜יִם לְעֵינֵ֣י הַגּוֹיִ֗ם לִהְי֥וֹת לָהֶ֛ם לֵאלֹהִ֖ים אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: I will remember in their favor the covenant with the ancients, whom I freed from the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations to be their God: I, יהוה.
Transliteration: vezakharetiy lahem veriyt rishoniym asher hvotsetiy-otam meerets mitserayiim leeyney hagvoyim liheyvot lahem lelohiym aniy yehovah

Hebrew: אֵ֠לֶּה הַֽחֻקִּ֣ים וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִים֮ וְהַתּוֹרֹת֒ אֲשֶׁר֙ נָתַ֣ן יְהֹוָ֔ה בֵּינ֕וֹ וּבֵ֖ין בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּהַ֥ר סִינַ֖י בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: These are the laws, rules, and instructions that יהוה established, through Moses on Mount Sinai, with the Israelite people.
Transliteration: eleh hachukiym vehamishefatiym vehatvorot asher natan yehovah veynvo uveyn veney yisherael vehar siynay veyad-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אִ֕ישׁ כִּ֥י יַפְלִ֖א נֶ֑דֶר בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ נְפָשֹׁ֖ת לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When any party explicitly vows to יהוה the equivalent for a human being,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem iysh khiy yafeli neder veerekhekha nefashot layhovah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֤ה עֶרְכְּךָ֙ הַזָּכָ֔ר מִבֶּן֙ עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה וְהָיָ֣ה עֶרְכְּךָ֗ חֲמִשִּׁ֛ים שֶׁ֥קֶל כֶּ֖סֶף בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: the following scale shall apply: If it is a male from twenty to sixty years of age, the equivalent is fifty shekels of silver by the sanctuary weight;
Transliteration: vehayah erekhekha hazakhar miven esheriym shanah vead ven-shishiym shanah vehayah erekhekha chamishiym shekel khesef veshekel hakodesh

Hebrew: וְאִם־נְקֵבָ֖ה הִ֑וא וְהָיָ֥ה עֶרְכְּךָ֖ שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים שָֽׁקֶל׃
Translated: if it is a female, the equivalent is thirty shekels.
Transliteration: veim-nekevah hiv vehayah erekhekha sheloshiym shakel

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם מִבֶּן־חָמֵ֜שׁ שָׁנִ֗ים וְעַד֙ בֶּן־עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְהָיָ֧ה עֶרְכְּךָ֛ הַזָּכָ֖ר עֶשְׂרִ֣ים שְׁקָלִ֑ים וְלַנְּקֵבָ֖ה עֲשֶׂ֥רֶת שְׁקָלִֽים׃
Translated: If the age is from five years to twenty years, the equivalent is twenty shekels for a male and ten shekels for a female.
Transliteration: veim miven-chamesh shaniym vead ven-esheriym shanah vehayah erekhekha hazakhar esheriym shekaliym velanekevah asheret shekaliym

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם מִבֶּן־חֹ֗דֶשׁ וְעַד֙ בֶּן־חָמֵ֣שׁ שָׁנִ֔ים וְהָיָ֤ה עֶרְכְּךָ֙ הַזָּכָ֔ר חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה שְׁקָלִ֖ים כָּ֑סֶף וְלַנְּקֵבָ֣ה עֶרְכְּךָ֔ שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת שְׁקָלִ֖ים כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: If the age is from one month to five years, the equivalent for a male is five shekels of silver, and the equivalent for a female is three shekels of silver.
Transliteration: veim miven-chodesh vead ven-chamesh shaniym vehayah erekhekha hazakhar chamishah shekaliym khasef velanekevah erekhekha sheloshet shekaliym khasef

Hebrew: וְ֠אִ֠ם מִבֶּן־שִׁשִּׁ֨ים שָׁנָ֤ה וָמַ֙עְלָה֙ אִם־זָכָ֔ר וְהָיָ֣ה עֶרְכְּךָ֔ חֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר שָׁ֑קֶל וְלַנְּקֵבָ֖ה עֲשָׂרָ֥ה שְׁקָלִֽים׃
Translated: If the age is sixty years or over, the equivalent is fifteen shekels in the case of a male and ten shekels for a female.
Transliteration: veim miven-shishiym shanah vamaelah im-zakhar vehayah erekhekha chamishah ashar shakel velanekevah asharah shekaliym

Hebrew: וְאִם־מָ֥ךְ הוּא֙ מֵֽעֶרְכֶּ֔ךָ וְהֶֽעֱמִידוֹ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהֶעֱרִ֥יךְ אֹת֖וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן עַל־פִּ֗י אֲשֶׁ֤ר תַּשִּׂיג֙ יַ֣ד הַנֹּדֵ֔ר יַעֲרִיכֶ֖נּוּ הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: But if one cannot afford the equivalent, that person shall be presented before the priest, and the priest shall make an assessment; the priest shall make the assessment according to what the vower can afford.
Transliteration: veim-makhe hu meerekhekha veheemiydvo lifeney hakhohen veheeriykhe otvo hakhohen al-fiy asher tashiyg yad hanoder yaariykhenu hakhohen {s}

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־בְּהֵמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַקְרִ֧יבוּ מִמֶּ֛נָּה קׇרְבָּ֖ן לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה כֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֥ן מִמֶּ֛נּוּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה יִֽהְיֶה־קֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: If [the vow concerns] any animal that may be brought as an offering to יהוה, any such that may be given to יהוה shall be holy.
Transliteration: veim-vehemah asher yakeriyvu mimenah kׇrevan layhovah khol asher yiten mimenu layhovah yiheyeh-kodesh

Hebrew: לֹ֣א יַחֲלִיפֶ֗נּוּ וְלֹֽא־יָמִ֥יר אֹת֛וֹ ט֥וֹב בְּרָ֖ע אוֹ־רַ֣ע בְּט֑וֹב וְאִם־הָמֵ֨ר יָמִ֤יר בְּהֵמָה֙ בִּבְהֵמָ֔ה וְהָֽיָה־ה֥וּא וּתְמוּרָת֖וֹ יִֽהְיֶה־קֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: One may not exchange or substitute another for it, either good for bad, or bad for good; if one does substitute one animal for another, the thing vowed and its substitute shall both be holy.
Transliteration: lo yachaliyfenu velo-yamiyr otvo tvov vera vo-ra vetvov veim-hamer yamiyr vehemah vivehemah vehayah-hu utemuratvo yiheyeh-kodesh

Hebrew: וְאִם֙ כׇּל־בְּהֵמָ֣ה טְמֵאָ֔ה אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹא־יַקְרִ֧יבוּ מִמֶּ֛נָּה קׇרְבָּ֖ן לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה וְהֶֽעֱמִ֥יד אֶת־הַבְּהֵמָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: If [the vow concerns] any impure animal that may not be brought as an offering to יהוה, the animal shall be presented before the priest,
Transliteration: veim khׇl-vehemah temeah asher lo-yakeriyvu mimenah kׇrevan layhovah veheemiyd et-havehemah lifeney hakhohen

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱרִ֤יךְ הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֹתָ֔הּ בֵּ֥ין ט֖וֹב וּבֵ֣ין רָ֑ע כְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן כֵּ֥ן יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: and the priest shall assess it. Whether high or low, whatever assessment is set by the priest shall stand;
Transliteration: veheeriykhe hakhohen otah veyn tvov uveyn ra kheerekhekha hakhohen khen yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְאִם־גָּאֹ֖ל יִגְאָלֶ֑נָּה וְיָסַ֥ף חֲמִישִׁת֖וֹ עַל־עֶרְכֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: and if one wishes to redeem it, one-fifth must be added to its assessment.
Transliteration: veim-gaol yigealenah veyasaf chamiyshitvo al-erekhekha

Hebrew: וְאִ֗ישׁ כִּֽי־יַקְדִּ֨שׁ אֶת־בֵּית֥וֹ קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְהֶעֱרִיכוֹ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן בֵּ֥ין ט֖וֹב וּבֵ֣ין רָ֑ע כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲרִ֥יךְ אֹת֛וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֖ן כֵּ֥ן יָקֽוּם׃
Translated: If any party consecrates a house to יהוה, the priest shall assess it. Whether high or low, as the priest assesses it, so it shall stand;
Transliteration: veiysh khiy-yakedish et-veytvo kodesh layhovah veheeriykhvo hakhohen veyn tvov uveyn ra khaasher yaariykhe otvo hakhohen khen yakum

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם־הַמַּקְדִּ֔ישׁ יִגְאַ֖ל אֶת־בֵּית֑וֹ וְ֠יָסַ֠ף חֲמִישִׁ֧ית כֶּֽסֶף־עֶרְכְּךָ֛ עָלָ֖יו וְהָ֥יָה לֽוֹ׃
Translated: and if the one who has consecrated the house wishes to redeem it, one-fifth must be added to the sum at which it was assessed, and then it shall be returned.
Transliteration: veim-hamakediysh yigeal et-veytvo veyasaf chamiyshiyt khesef-erekhekha alayv vehayah lvo

Hebrew: וְאִ֣ם ׀ מִשְּׂדֵ֣ה אֲחֻזָּת֗וֹ יַקְדִּ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וְהָיָ֥ה עֶרְכְּךָ֖ לְפִ֣י זַרְע֑וֹ זֶ֚רַע חֹ֣מֶר שְׂעֹרִ֔ים בַּחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שֶׁ֥קֶל כָּֽסֶף׃
Translated: If any party consecrates to יהוה any land-holding, its assessment shall be in accordance with its seed requirement: fifty shekels of silver to a ḥomer of barley seed.
Transliteration: veim mishedeh achuzatvo yakediysh iysh layhovah vehayah erekhekha lefiy zarevo zera chomer sheoriym vachamishiym shekel khasef

Hebrew: אִם־מִשְּׁנַ֥ת הַיֹּבֵ֖ל יַקְדִּ֣ישׁ שָׂדֵ֑הוּ כְּעֶרְכְּךָ֖ יָקֽוּם׃
Translated: If the land is consecrated as of the jubilee year, its assessment stands.
Transliteration: im-mishenat hayovel yakediysh shadehu kheerekhekha yakum

Hebrew: וְאִם־אַחַ֣ר הַיֹּבֵל֮ יַקְדִּ֣ישׁ שָׂדֵ֒הוּ֒ וְחִשַּׁב־ל֨וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַכֶּ֗סֶף עַל־פִּ֤י הַשָּׁנִים֙ הַנּ֣וֹתָרֹ֔ת עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֑ל וְנִגְרַ֖ע מֵֽעֶרְכֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: But if the land is consecrated after the jubilee, the priest shall compute the price according to the years that are left until the jubilee year, and its assessment shall be so reduced;
Transliteration: veim-achar hayovel yakediysh shadehu vechishav-lvo hakhohen et-hakhesef al-fiy hashaniym hanvotarot ad shenat hayovel venigera meerekhekha

Hebrew: וְאִם־גָּאֹ֤ל יִגְאַל֙ אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה הַמַּקְדִּ֖ישׁ אֹת֑וֹ וְ֠יָסַ֠ף חֲמִשִׁ֧ית כֶּֽסֶף־עֶרְכְּךָ֛ עָלָ֖יו וְקָ֥ם לֽוֹ׃
Translated: and if the one who consecrated the land wishes to redeem it, one-fifth must be added to the sum at which it was assessed, and it shall be passed back.
Transliteration: veim-gaol yigeal et-hashadeh hamakediysh otvo veyasaf chamishiyt khesef-erekhekha alayv vekam lvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א יִגְאַל֙ אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה וְאִם־מָכַ֥ר אֶת־הַשָּׂדֶ֖ה לְאִ֣ישׁ אַחֵ֑ר לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵ֖ל עֽוֹד׃
Translated: But if the one [who consecrated it] does not redeem the land, and the land is sold to another party, it shall no longer be redeemable:
Transliteration: veim-lo yigeal et-hashadeh veim-makhar et-hashadeh leiysh acher lo yigael vod

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה הַשָּׂדֶ֜ה בְּצֵאת֣וֹ בַיֹּבֵ֗ל קֹ֛דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה כִּשְׂדֵ֣ה הַחֵ֑רֶם לַכֹּהֵ֖ן תִּהְיֶ֥ה אֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: when it is released in the jubilee, the land shall be holy to יהוה, as land proscribed; it becomes the priest’s holding.
Transliteration: vehayah hashadeh vetsetvo vayovel kodesh layhovah khishedeh hacherem lakhohen tiheyeh achuzatvo

Hebrew: וְאִם֙ אֶת־שְׂדֵ֣ה מִקְנָת֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֕ר לֹ֖א מִשְּׂדֵ֣ה אֲחֻזָּת֑וֹ יַקְדִּ֖ישׁ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: If one consecrates to יהוה land that was purchased, which is not one’s land-holding,
Transliteration: veim et-shedeh mikenatvo asher lo mishedeh achuzatvo yakediysh layhovah

Hebrew: וְחִשַּׁב־ל֣וֹ הַכֹּהֵ֗ן אֵ֚ת מִכְסַ֣ת הָֽעֶרְכְּךָ֔ עַ֖ד שְׁנַ֣ת הַיֹּבֵ֑ל וְנָתַ֤ן אֶת־הָעֶרְכְּךָ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the priest shall compute the proportionate assessment up to the jubilee year, and the assessment shall be paid as of that day, a sacred donation to יהוה.
Transliteration: vechishav-lvo hakhohen et mikhesat haerekhekha ad shenat hayovel venatan et-haerekhekha vayyvom hahu kodesh layhovah

Hebrew: בִּשְׁנַ֤ת הַיּוֹבֵל֙ יָשׁ֣וּב הַשָּׂדֶ֔ה לַאֲשֶׁ֥ר קָנָ֖הוּ מֵאִתּ֑וֹ לַאֲשֶׁר־ל֖וֹ אֲחֻזַּ֥ת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: In the jubilee year the land shall revert to the one from whom it was bought, whose holding the land is.
Transliteration: vishenat hayyvovel yashuv hashadeh laasher kanahu meitvo laasher-lvo achuzat haarets

Hebrew: וְכׇ֨ל־עֶרְכְּךָ֔ יִהְיֶ֖ה בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים גֵּרָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֥ה הַשָּֽׁקֶל׃
Translated: All assessments shall be by the sanctuary weight, the shekel being twenty gerahs.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-erekhekha yiheyeh veshekel hakodesh esheriym gerah yiheyeh hashakel

Hebrew: אַךְ־בְּכ֞וֹר אֲשֶׁר־יְבֻכַּ֤ר לַֽיהֹוָה֙ בִּבְהֵמָ֔ה לֹֽא־יַקְדִּ֥ישׁ אִ֖ישׁ אֹת֑וֹ אִם־שׁ֣וֹר אִם־שֶׂ֔ה לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: A firstling of animals, however, which—as a firstling—is יהוה’s, cannot be consecrated by anybody; whether ox or sheep, it is יהוה’s.
Transliteration: akhe-vekhvor asher-yevukhar layhovah vivehemah lo-yakediysh iysh otvo im-shvor im-sheh layhovah hu

Hebrew: וְאִ֨ם בַּבְּהֵמָ֤ה הַטְּמֵאָה֙ וּפָדָ֣ה בְעֶרְכֶּ֔ךָ וְיָסַ֥ף חֲמִשִׁת֖וֹ עָלָ֑יו וְאִם־לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵ֖ל וְנִמְכַּ֥ר בְּעֶרְכֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: But if it is of impure animals, it may be ransomed at its assessment, with one-fifth added; if it is not redeemed, it shall be sold at its assessment.
Transliteration: veim vavehemah hatemeah ufadah veerekhekha veyasaf chamishitvo alayv veim-lo yigael venimekhar veerekhekha

Hebrew: אַךְ־כׇּל־חֵ֡רֶם אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַחֲרִם֩ אִ֨ישׁ לַֽיהֹוָ֜ה מִכׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֗וֹ מֵאָדָ֤ם וּבְהֵמָה֙ וּמִשְּׂדֵ֣ה אֲחֻזָּת֔וֹ לֹ֥א יִמָּכֵ֖ר וְלֹ֣א יִגָּאֵ֑ל כׇּל־חֵ֕רֶם קֹֽדֶשׁ־קׇדָשִׁ֥ים ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But of all that anyone owns, be it human or beast or land-holding, nothing that has been proscribed for יהוה may be sold or redeemed; every proscribed thing is totally consecrated to יהוה.
Transliteration: akhe-khׇl-cherem asher yacharim iysh layhovah mikhׇl-asher-lvo meadam uvehemah umishedeh achuzatvo lo yimakher velo yigael khׇl-cherem kodesh-kׇdashiym hu layhovah

Hebrew: כׇּל־חֵ֗רֶם אֲשֶׁ֧ר יׇחֳרַ֛ם מִן־הָאָדָ֖ם לֹ֣א יִפָּדֶ֑ה מ֖וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: No human being who has been proscribed can be ransomed: that person shall be put to death.
Transliteration: khׇl-cherem asher yׇchoram min-haadam lo yifadeh mvot yumat

Hebrew: וְכׇל־מַעְשַׂ֨ר הָאָ֜רֶץ מִזֶּ֤רַע הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ מִפְּרִ֣י הָעֵ֔ץ לַיהֹוָ֖ה ה֑וּא קֹ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: All tithes from the land, whether seed from the ground or fruit from the tree, are יהוה’s; they are holy to יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-maeshar haarets mizera haarets miferiy haets layhovah hu kodesh layhovah

Hebrew: וְאִם־גָּאֹ֥ל יִגְאַ֛ל אִ֖ישׁ מִמַּֽעַשְׂר֑וֹ חֲמִשִׁית֖וֹ יֹסֵ֥ף עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: If any party wishes to redeem any tithes, one-fifth must be added to them.
Transliteration: veim-gaol yigeal iysh mimaashervo chamishiytvo yosef alayv

Hebrew: וְכׇל־מַעְשַׂ֤ר בָּקָר֙ וָצֹ֔אן כֹּ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲבֹ֖ר תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑בֶט הָֽעֲשִׂירִ֕י יִֽהְיֶה־קֹּ֖דֶשׁ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: All tithes of the herd or flock—of all that passes under the shepherd’s staff, every tenth one—shall be holy to יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-maeshar vakar vatson khol asher-yaavor tachat hashavet haashiyriy yiheyeh-kodesh layhovah

Hebrew: לֹ֧א יְבַקֵּ֛ר בֵּֽין־ט֥וֹב לָרַ֖ע וְלֹ֣א יְמִירֶ֑נּוּ וְאִם־הָמֵ֣ר יְמִירֶ֔נּוּ וְהָֽיָה־ה֧וּא וּתְמוּרָת֛וֹ יִֽהְיֶה־קֹּ֖דֶשׁ לֹ֥א יִגָּאֵֽל׃
Translated: One must not look out for good as against bad, or make substitution for it. If one does make substitution for it, then it and its substitute shall both be holy: it cannot be redeemed.
Transliteration: lo yevaker veyn-tvov lara velo yemiyrenu veim-hamer yemiyrenu vehayah-hu utemuratvo yiheyeh-kodesh lo yigael

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַמִּצְוֺ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּהַ֖ר סִינָֽי׃
Translated: These are the commandments that יהוה gave Moses for the Israelite people on Mount Sinai.
Transliteration: eleh hamitsevot asher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh el-veney yisherael vehar siynay
